column2: ['Fairfield Ludlowe is an amazing school. I transferred to Ludlowe during the middle of sophomore year of high school. During my transition, teachers were very helpful making it a smooth transition for me. It has  an amazing education system and wonderful, helpful teachers.I found friends very quickly there since everyone was very friendly. Ludlowe has a lot to offer and overall it’s a great high school!', 'My experience at FLHS has been great! The teachers are very knowledgeable and provide a great deal of knowledge to us students. They offer extra help before and after school to make sure we have all of the resources we need to succeed. The administration is very helpful, always there to support us in everything - classes, clubs, extracurricular activities and sports. They also bring in speakers that share their life experiences and help us make better choices now so we are prepared for our futures. FLHS also has a pretty competitive sports program and I have enjoyed playing soccer and lacrosse throughout my high school career  I feel I have received a well-rounded education here that has prepared me for college and beyond.', 'With many strengths such as resourceful teachers. The teachers at Fairfield Ludlowe truly do care about their students and want to see them succeed. With offerings for things such as extra help, a student at Ludlowe is able to get any extra academic help in any topic they need. No teacher at Ludlowe wants to see their students fall behind and will put in the extra effort to make sure they don’t.The hudge selection of academics to choose from is yet another reason Ludlowe his an excellent school. With many different classes to choose from students at Ludlowe are sure to find their passion in life. Examples include classes such as Human Anatomy or Chemistry of Medicine for those interested in the medical field to Early Childhood classes that teach the future teachers of America.These are only two reasons why Ludlowe is an outstanding school, but they are why Ludlowe stands out to me.', "Fairfield Ludlowe High School has a great positive atmosphere.  I am interested in Fashion marketing and was able to take this class and get a feel if this is what I want to pursue in college.  There is a whole department devoted to Fashion design, marketing, and business.  We also get to do internships our senior year which was very instrumental.  Overall it's a great school and a positive place to learn.", 'The teachers are really nice and approachable.  Ludlowe is an incredibly rewarding place for students who are possessed with a drive for academic excellence.  However there are some teachers who are not as good.  Overall i have loved my experience here.', "Ludlowe is an incredibly rewarding place for students who are possessed with a drive for academic excellence, though tends to fall short at ensuring the extracurricular involvement of its' students.", 'School is very academic but many unmotivated and miserable teachers. Also they need more college readiness starting junior year and also no resources for therapy or help with problems as the counselors tattle and Tim the drug counselor is always busy.', 'The teachers at FLHS are well trained and care about the students. Almost everyone goes to a good college, and it all goes back to the educational system provided by the school.', "Fairfield Ludlowe High school has a lot of qualities that I think a lot of students take for granted. The majority of the teachers are passionate and very qualified for their jobs, we have resources available to the music and art department (like 3D printers!) that we're extrememly lucky to have, and we have a principal that is amazing and does his best to ensure the school is really serving the students in the best possible way.", "My overall experience at Ludlowe was amazing.  Its a great school with great teachers and I made a lot of friends.  The school itself is very up to date and extremely clean.  The only thing I wish they would change is the parking situation.  We have to pay to park and sometimes even the seniors don't have a spot because the spaces are so limited.  When we park in the surrounding area the neighbors complain and we get parking tickets from the police.  Other than that one issues the school itself is amazing!!!", 'Great programs for sports and other activities. This high school has so many great opportunities to offer.', 'I have had a memorable experience at Fairfield Ludlowe High School. I have developed great relationships with teachers who have taught me so much about academic subjects and life skills.', 'My High School years have been excellent. we have a wonderful staff and welcoming environment. Respect is shown in this school.', 'I have loved all four years I have been at Fairfield ludlowe High School. During my time here I was involved in many sports teams, clubs, and other after school activities. The staff here is awesome from teachers to counselors and even the janitorial staff; they are all amazing.', 'The school system at Ludlowe is phenomenal. They have great teachers and incredible athletics. Past students have stated that Ludlowe has made them extremely prepared for college.', "In general, the teachers are incredibly supportive and passionate about what they're teaching. Honors and AP classes are challenging but there are classes for all levels. Pretty good community feel. Students definitely don't have the most full world view though; located in quite a privileged community.", 'I had the best four years at Ludlowe. I worked hard and turned my grades around. I have also been on the football team as well as track and field for 4 years as well as involved in club activities', 'I really enjoyed my time at Ludlowe. I made friendships with many different people, but there were also many cliques since it was high school. They were also very strict on the administrative side about random rules.', 'I had the best experience at Ludlowe. From the academics, structure, and social events they offer a lot of oppoturinity and support for students.', 'Ludlowe for me was great. Everything about the school is pretty good, one thing that’s awesome that I loved about it was that all the kids aren’t that diffent from each other and fitting in was no problem, I did have some few teachers who’s expectations were a bit too high but I mean I can’t complain to much. The friends I have make the school 100% better and the community is dope, we’re all close and we try to help out kids we see that don’t allways feel like they fit in. Also Playing lacrosse and soccer for ludlowe was the best thing I could have done because we kick ass most the time but also because I feel like we’re a family.']

During my transition, teachers were very helpful making it a smooth transition for me. column6: ['FLHS has offered resources that I have taken advantage of in order to prepare myself for college. Some teachers may be better than others, but the ones that truly care make the bad ones worth it. I would also give the school a 0/10 in diversity. The school needs to try to educate its students so that they are comfortable with people who are different than them.', "Overall, my experience with Fairfield Ludlow High School was really good in the academic aspect. We had really good resources, facilities, and programs. Outside of the academics, the diversity lacked; and the out reach program to those who were diverse was poor. However, I didn't mind this much because my main focus was obtaining great education.", 'Fairfield Ludlowe High School is a wonderful school, I love it.  I am entering my senior year and it has been quite a rollercoaster. Most teachers are awesome and everyone is always willing to help you get by.', "Fairfield Ludlowe High School was a school that definitely prepared me for college, but at a price. There was zero diversity, they didn't encourage conversation, and shut down any attempt to change the status quo. The administration acts like it is trying to help, but shuts down any internal investigations and pushes their problems aside. Overall, my experience with the teachers there was great, minus a few bad apples, but that is to be expected. The people that go to FLHS are driven, but often entitled.", "Great school that is very inclusive and has a vast selection of courses to satisfy anyone's interests.  The school is strong in the core requirements as well.", "personally I didn't like the building or The student population. The teachers are great and they really try to have a personal academic connection with all of their students. Absolutely adore the deans.", 'There are a lot of great opportunities that are offered both academically and outside of school.  The teachers at FLHS are very good at their jobs and offer students a very good opportunity to learn at an advanced level. There is a great variety of sports teams offered at Ludlowe ranging from football, to lacrosse, to golf, and many more.', 'Fairfield Ludlowe is a nice school which I have been attending for four years already. I entered this school as a freshman and now I am already a senior who is considering enter New York University. The teachers in my school are all nice and do their job very well. Most of the students in the school are friendly and hard working. Being a senior, I know that many students around me get into good colleges to study what they want.', 'Great academics, wide variety of teachers & classes. Lots of Advanced Placement (AP) classes available. Many counselors among other services are available to students.', "As a high school senior, my experience at Ludlowe has made a tremendous impact on who i've become. I feel that this school has a lot to offer whether it be the diverse clubs, sports teams or electives. A lot is expected of you with a hefty workload, however this has prepared me for my future education. Every teacher will take the time to help you succeed.", 'I love my high school! I have had a multitude of engaged, helpful, and highly educated teachers. My school offers so many programs and materials. They are very interested in students concerns. My only complaint is that the school can feel very competitive and the majority of students care more about good grades than learning.', "The school is generally alright. Most of the teachers are friendly and understanding however, a few bad teachers will probably become much more memorable. Students are alright to each other. Generally, if you are nice to others, people will be nice to you. The school obviously is adequately funding with all of its computers and TV's.", "At my four years at Ludlowe High School, I have made so many friends and made great memories. I have been able to excel my learning and understanding of many different subjects. I have also been able to get into many clubs to get involved with the school and the town. The teachers are very helpful and understanding. I have never not felt welcomed at my school and wouldn't want to go to high school anywhere else!", 'Good school. Great athletic programs, tons of clubs, and there are tons of cool classes to take. Music program is good too and the people are really nice.', 'My experience at Fairfield Ludlowe High School has been great. The teachers are always offering help and support to students to clarify material. The academic standards are perfect preparing every student to be successful in college. Fairfield Ludlowe has provided me with great academics and athletics where I would not even think about attending a private high school. As a whole, the faculty and students are supported by the town of Fairfield at all of our home sports games. In return, as athletes and students, Fairfield Ludlowe always finds a way to give back to the needy and community. School spirit is never fades at athletic events and students have always enjoyed their four years with teachers who they connect with and make life long bonds with. Fairfield Ludlowe is a perfect high school acadeically and athletically preparing students to be successful in life while having fun doing what we love.', 'I did not like Fairfield Ludlowe High School very much. While the school offers an abundance of options for classes it is very difficult to fit any electives into your schedule. There are so many required courses that the extra electives are not an option.', 'Fairfield Ludlowe is a overall a high school. It is filled with teachers who strive to help you reach your goals and the students are nice. One drawback is that there is NO diversity (all affluent white kids), but it has a lot of clubs.', "Ludlowe is pretty great. Teachers are good, classes are good as well. I've had some scheduling problems before but that's about it. Great activities and a great atmosphere.", 'FLHS has amazing academics. The school focuses on each student individually, and students can really excel if they make an effort to do so. The clubs an activities are also exceptional. A few years ago, the school began having an activity period during the day to get more students involved in clubs, and it really works. It is one of the smartest decisions that the school has made. The school also prepares students very well for college with the block schedule and rigorous work. The administration is very good at enforcing the rules, although the teachers are not always the best. Many teachers are wonderful and really care about their students. The other disadvantage is the lack of diversity; some students do come over from Bridgeport on a special program, but there is not must integration between those students and the "WASP" type Fairfield-Southport-Greenfield Hill residents. Other than that, Fairfield Ludlowe is a great school, and I cherish my time spent here. ', "I moved to Fairfield in my junior year and made friends relatively fast that I think will always be there for me in times of need as I will for them. My favorite experience in this school was a trip to Disney and Universail Studios with the orchestra I've played in for 8 years. This is because my friends and i roomed together and bonded at a new level. We stayed up at night telling stories, talking about hot girls we'd be asking to prom, and even listening to use while playing video games. This was an experience that was great for me because I never really went so far away from home with just my friends. If I could've been in this school for all four years of high school I'd be even happier, but I'm satisfied that I spent my last two years in this school."]
column8: ['There are opportunities to learn anything you want to at this school and guidance counselor try to make sure you get everything on your schedule that you desire.', "There is a majority of white people at this school and I would say some of them are even white supremacists, however overall everybody cares about each other and doesn't desire to harm anyone.", "Teachers are very enthusiastic and challenge each student to go above and beyond in everything they do. After going to this school there is no way you are not college ready because the teachers treat you like your in college and I can speak for every senior at FLHS when I say that they helped us to the point where writing a paper everyday wouldn't be a problem. They also are very friendly and interact with their students, inspiring them and pushing them to be the best they can be. I myself was inspired by my AP Biology teacher who taught with a sort of atmosphere that got you hooked in and made you want to learn more. After attending this high school I feel I am a lot more prepared for college and without all the support from the teachers I wouldn't be as studious or hardworking as I am.", 'This is one of the top rated schools in the state.', 'Everyone is very nice and inclusive. We are generally tolerant of all groups as a whole.', 'I feel very safe at school. I have never had an issue with either the security or healthcare systems that are in place here.', 'There are many extracurricular activities for a variety of interests.', "It's been a good school. Almost no bullying, everyone cares about everyone else, etc.", 'Most teachers really care about their students. All of them are pretty knowledgeable on their subject- every once in a while there is a bad teacher- but mostly they are pretty good. Everyone has at least one really great teacher.', 'I think in general, most students feel a huge pressure to go to a good college and be involved in as much as they possibly can to build their resume. I think this expectation comes from both parents and administration and is very harmful for students. That being said, when a student finds the extracurricular they really like and a teacher or two that they really connect with, I think their experience at Ludlowe is greatly improved', "There are some teachers that really go above and beyond and very clearly care about the material they're teaching and the students. These teachers are always available for extra help, to talk with students about their lives, help with the college application process, etc. However, these teachers are probably the minority compared to the teachers that don't have that much invested in their students' success or only care about a student for as long as he or she is actually in their class.", 'My school takes everything very seriously and will not take threats lightly.', "I believe it's exceptional from what I can remember. There were many options and everyone was welcome.", 'I would choose this school all over again if I could because it taught you so much. My high school wasn\'t perfect; there were still cliques and plenty of drama, but at the end of the day, everyone looked out for each other and I had friends in all different "groups". Each sport team would come to the other sport\'s games to support them and it just didn\'t seem like a very competitive atmosphere of someone wanting to be above everyone else.', "I absolutely loved my teachers in high school. Apparently in other schools, students had different experiences with their teachers and didn't enjoy school because of it. My teachers were always there for their students whether it was for extra help on something or even with a personal issue. The teachers were very approachable and friendly, which is why I always had such good relationships with them and still keep in touch with them three years later. I would always let them know they were doing a good job so they would keep it up.", 'Many opportunities. You can join almost anything you can think of.', 'Teachers are great at ludlowe. They at times can be better, but overall engaging with students and genuinely most care about their job.', 'Most teachers at Fairfield Ludlowe truly love their job and go above and beyond to help students engage and learn the material. Most are available for extra help if a student is struggling, and it is very rare to see a teacher notice a student having a hard time and not say anything.', 'The school security at this school is excellent. A student will always feel safe.', 'At this school one can has a long list of sports to choose from. Also, there is a large variety of clubs that it is impossible for one not to get matched.']

column2: ['I enjoy my experience at Watchung Hills Regional High School. The school has given me many opportunities that other schools do not offer. I gave the rating four stars because I do believe there is room to grow and improve. I think the school needs to focus on diversity and not putting so much pressure on going to college. Most students feel obligated to go to college but some drop out and feel that college is not meant for them. I wish my school offered trade classes. I know that we have a vocational school, but I did not know I wanted to pursue the medical field in 8th grade when I would have had to make the decision.', 'WHRHS has extensive STEAM classes, programs, and after school activities. They offer PLTW (Project Lead The Way) engineering classes and have numerous after school clubs dedicated to the arts, hard sciences, and engineering. The curriculum is what students make of it. It can be very challenging or barely engaging depending on which classes a student chooses.', 'This school is very competitive, but challenges students to reach their full potential. With every club imaginable, different sports and elective courses , one is able to achieve anything they strive for. However, sometimes having a large schools isn’t as beneficial for students. Most sports are incredibly competitive and therefore hard to get into, limiting students top potential. On the other hand, there are tons of clubs that each student is welcome to join which makes up for the sports. Although the schools offers tons of electives from AP to honors and life-learning skill electives (Ex. Culinary arts) I feel as though it lacks electives focused on the medical field. There are tons of electives that are related to law but other than AP biology and AP chemistry there aren’t much on medical field specifically.', "My experience at WHRHS has been a good one. I've made a lot of friends from all  4 towns that attend the high school, and it is a generally very healthy environment. The courses are academically rigorous but teachers are almost always willing to give extra help, and peer-to-peer tutoring is also offered. The athletic teams are also pretty good and our school has a lot of spirit. There is a slight lack in terms of diversity, but the school makes an effort to attend to everyone's needs and include everyone.", 'I greatly appreciate all there is to offer at WHRHS. If you cannot find your exact interests in a certain class, there is a club for it. Students also have the ability to tailor their schedules quite accurately to their desired speed and curriculum, all the way down to the level of the class. I have really enjoyed being given the opportunity to make my schedule and my school days fit me as best as possible to both ready me for college and keep me engaged all day long.', 'Overall I had a very good experience. However, I did not like some administrative choices. It seems that the board of education does not care for their students or listen to the student body as much as they should. Nevertheless, the teachers are great and I felt that I got a good education before college.', 'Very nice school with very lenient teachers. There are some really great teachers that you should get to know. Take advantage of all the clubs that WHRHS has to offer.', "I loved my four years at WH!  Coming from a small district, it was great to meet new students and friends.  There are so many classes to choose from and everything you could imagine.  The electives allow you to try new interests and hobbies you'd otherwise likely never have the opportunity to try.  Sports...the best!  Great coaches and student support at games was amazing.  Many of the teachers are there for you if you need extra assistance in any subject.", 'I like the vigorous course load that Watchung Hills offers. There is a broad variety of AP courses, which I took advantage of in order to place out of introductory college courses, and there is a diverse selection of electives, which allowed me to experiment with different interests. For example, I took Computer Aided Graphic Design and found that I enjoyed Photoshop. The school also has many well-funded clubs and sports, and I made the most of my time on cross country and robotics.', 'I personally did not have a good time in this high school. The main reasoning being the social scene. The school was extremely cliquey. Im sure that there were people where I could of have found my place in but the school was too big and exclusive for me too. I found myself stuck being friends with my old friends I had in middle school.The workload was definitely a lot if your in accelerated or honor classes. Junior year being the worst. I also found that the  courses went too fast and there were a lot of unnecessary tests. Again I dont know if this is just how it is in America. They had a good range of clubs and sports for people to find what they enjoy. Even though I never said much, I really enjoyed the jsa debate club. Another good thing about the school is that they have a good range of different electives for you to chose from.Now I go to a international highschool in Istanbul and im having a much better time socially and academically.', 'I had a great experience in high school and met some amazing people. I was well prepared for college.', "The teachers do a good job of preparing you, but theres not much protection for someone who changes their mind or wants to explore new things. Very little school spirit. You're in with a lot of other kids so sometimes can become very competitive.", 'Whatcung hills puts a huge focus on courses revolving the STEM program and as someone interested in engineering, I was always thrilled to have classes in DIG, PoE, aerospace, etc...etc...', 'The education that students get here is amazing. The teachers here for the most part want to see the students succeed, and will work with them to make sure they have a solid understanding of the material. This school prepared me well for college, and I am so thankful to have had the opportunity to go to a school like Watchung Hills.', 'Watchung Hills Regional High School offers students numerous ways to express themselves. Whether it be artistically, academically, or athletically there is room for every student to participate in something they are passionate about. The teachers are incredibly friendly and helpful for the most part, and will aid students to achieve their academic goals as long as they see their hard efforts in doing so. Extra help with teachers is always offered as an alternative to expensive tutors for those who do not have the same financial resources as others. Although the school has its flaws, it is for the most part a safe and peaceful learning environment for students.', "Watchung Hills helped get me to the right place for school. While I struggled with some personal issues at home school was  a safe space. There are many teachers I didn't get to have however some of the teachers I did have will remain in my memory for a long time. Always having an open office door or being understanding of what I was going through. The academics that are offered are amazing, with variety and opportunities to earn college credit.", 'It was a lot of fun, but a lot of work as well. I had a a lot of fun with my friends here. I like the school because 4 different townships go here, so you make a lot of friends. Most teachers are nice and helpful, and the guidance counselors help a lot with the college process.', 'I felt Watchung Hills focused too much on schoolwork and how competitive the school is instead of focusing on mental health and giving their students a break.', 'Overall a good school with lots of AP classes and club opportunities but very little diversity, especially within the programs created to help prepare students for college.', 'Watchung Hills Regional High School gave me a lot of opportunities. But not all the teachers are good and work well with understanding students situations.']

There are some really great teachers that you should get to know. Take advantage of all the clubs that WHRHS has to offer.', "I loved my four years at WH!  Coming from a small district, it was great to meet new students and friends.  There are so many classes to choose from and everything you could imagine.  The electives allow you to try new interests and hobbies you'd otherwise likely never have the opportunity to try.  Sports...the best!  Great coaches and student support at games was amazing.  Many of the teachers are there for you if you need extra assistance in any subject.", 'I like the vigorous course load that Watchung Hills offers. There is a broad variety of AP courses, which I took advantage of in order to place out of introductory college courses, and there is a diverse selection of electives, which allowed me to experiment with different interests. For example, I took Computer Aided Graphic Design and found that I enjoyed Photoshop. The school also has many well-funded clubs and sports, and I made the most of my time on cross country and robotics.', 'I personally did not have a good time in this high school. The main reasoning being the social scene. The school was extremely cliquey. Im sure that there were people where I could of have found my place in but the school was too big and exclusive for me too. I found myself stuck being friends with my old friends I had in middle school.The workload was definitely a lot if your in accelerated or honor classes. Junior year being the worst. I also found that the  courses went too fast and there were a lot of unnecessary tests. Again I dont know if this is just how it is in America. They had a good range of clubs and sports for people to find what they enjoy. Even though I never said much, I really enjoyed the jsa debate club. Another good thing about the school is that they have a good range of different electives for you to chose from.Now I go to a international highschool in Istanbul and im having a much better time socially and academically.', 'I had a great experience in high school and met some amazing people. I was well prepared for college.', "The teachers do a good job of preparing you, but theres not much protection for someone who changes their mind or wants to explore new things. Very little school spirit. You're in with a lot of other kids so sometimes can become very competitive.", 'Whatcung hills puts a huge focus on courses revolving the STEM program and as someone interested in engineering, I was always thrilled to have classes in DIG, PoE, aerospace, etc...etc...', 'The education that students get here is amazing. The teachers here for the most part want to see the students succeed, and will work with them to make sure they have a solid understanding of the material. This school prepared me well for college, and I am so thankful to have had the opportunity to go to a school like Watchung Hills.', 'Watchung Hills Regional High School offers students numerous ways to express themselves. Whether it be artistically, academically, or athletically there is room for every student to participate in something they are passionate about. The teachers are incredibly friendly and helpful for the most part, and will aid students to achieve their academic goals as long as they see their hard efforts in doing so. Extra help with teachers is always offered as an alternative to expensive tutors for those who do not have the same financial resources as others. Although the school has its flaws, it is for the most part a safe and peaceful learning environment for students.', "Watchung Hills helped get me to the right place for school. While I struggled with some personal issues at home school was  a safe space. There are many teachers I didn't get to have however some of the teachers I did have will remain in my memory for a long time. Always having an open office door or being understanding of what I was going through. The academics that are offered are amazing, with variety and opportunities to earn college credit.", 'It was a lot of fun, but a lot of work as well. I had a a lot of fun with my friends here. I like the school because 4 different townships go here, so you make a lot of friends. Most teachers are nice and helpful, and the guidance counselors help a lot with the college process.', 'I felt Watchung Hills focused too much on schoolwork and how competitive the school is instead of focusing on mental health and giving their students a break.', 'Overall a good school with lots of AP classes and club opportunities but very little diversity, especially within the programs created to help prepare students for college.', 'Watchung Hills Regional High School gave me a lot of opportunities. But not all the teachers are good and work well with understanding students situations.']
column6: ['The teachers and stuff are very helpful. People are very friendly. My daughter made good friends and has improved  academically every year.', 'Watchung Hills is above average in both size and quality. Housing around 2000 students, the school comes with many of the ups and downs this brings. On the ups side, the opportunities present are extremely varied, with a slew of elective classes to choose from along with extremely diverse clubs and activities. However, on the downside of things, the sheer size of Watchung Hills makes social life more of a challenge. This inevitably causes cliques to form, a system that also has its own benefits and downsides. In regards to sports and clubs, sports in particular are often fairly tight knit and make for a good way to make new friends. Clubs, however, meet less frequently and for a shorter period of time than sports in most cases, and are less effective at achieving this. Despite that, the sheer volume of clubs is quiet impressive.', 'The education within Watchung Hills Regional High School is why I am extremely grateful to attend this school. For example, I have not only learned an immense amount of important history from my three years of taking history class, I also learned about the human condition and many life lessons because of my phenomenal teachers within the history wing. Many of the teachers wishing Watchung Hills truly care about their students, and it shows. In addition, I have immersed myself within the theatre arts area of the school, and have learned more about myself as an artist. Because of the many music and arts courses I have taken, I know that I will continue the arts in my college pursuits.', 'The academics at this school are unnecessarily hard. I know students who have graduated who come back and tell me that our high school over-prepares us. For example, one of my friends has 126 in one of his classes in college but his GPA in high school was below a 3.0. This might look like an advantage, but it honestly shouldn\'t be considered as one. Students are overworked and are always stressed out. There are times when we have to pull all-nighters due to the unnecessary workload that is given. Students who have low GPAs aren\'t actually dumb or don\'t work hard. It\'s just that the school is hard. With the level of difficulty, the school has a "no extra-credit" policy, which is what makes it even worse. This makes a lot of the students look bad when they apply to colleges, but they\'re really not,  which is the sad part.', 'Not only does the school place a strong emphasis on safety, the general supportive atmosphere in the school makes it a suitable learning environment.', 'Loved that there was a a wide variety of electives to choose from. The teachers were always cared for the students.', 'Had a great 4 years, loved the choices for electives that my school has to offer. The athletic programs are great.  Guidance Department really works with you to get you prepared for the college application process.', 'has a great academic programs for all types of students.   I would like to see the school offer a mechanical program for students interested in that field', 'Watching hills has a lot of diversity and readiness for college. Has resources that better the students and eduction.', 'Many of the teachers were passionate about their job and very engaging in class. It is a big high school so there are many different people with different interests all over the place, guaranteeing that others will share common interests.', 'Watchung Hills has EXCELLENT teachers that will literally change your life for the better and prepare you so well for the future. The school is really big and has a lot of great clubs to get involved in so be sure to explore all your options and get involved because you won’t regret it and you will make some great friends along the way! The only bad thing about the school is the administration just because of all the politics and how people at the top are always trying to take away students freedoms just to make the school look better to the public. Overall, WH is a pretty good school and I’m so grateful for the enriching education I’ve receieved!', 'Watchung Hills provides extensive resources to students who are preparing for college. The amount of niche programs lets students explore choices that impact their decision post-graduation.', "Considered one of NJ's wealthiest high schools.Lots of programs and extra-curriculars. One of the rare schools that offer engineering/architecture electives and AP classes.", "Watchung Hills is overall a good school. Compared to a lot of other schools nationwide or even in the area, it is very advanced and prepares you well for college. While the administration can be hard to work with, most teachers are nice. I've had a number of teachers who've really inspired me, been kind to me, and definitely influenced my direction in life. (The history department in particular.) Yes, there is plenty of drama and fights over trivial things, but you'll find that at any school. As a senior, my best advice is to take advantage of all the school offers. Be it clubs, sports, extra help...take advantage of it, and immerse yourself in the culture. You'll get teachers you hate or courses you hate, or have to deal with seemingly incompetent administrators, but in the end, the good memories outweigh the bad. Have fun, apply yourself in class and extracurriculars, and thank those teachers that go above and beyond to help you learn. If you do, Watchung Hills will serve you well.", "As a student here, I have a slightly biased view and, like all high schoolers,  I can't wait to leave. But, it's a school in a suburban neighborhood so you kind of know everybody but then don't at the same time.", 'I thought that my experience at Watchung Hills was very good. All of the staff and teachers were nice and eager to help. One thing, however, which I hope they change is the school spirit. I feel like no one has spirit, and little students attend the sporting events.', 'High school is a formative time for everybody, and the staff at WHRHS know this and are there to help you succeed. All of the faculty including the academic advisors are all there to help you succeed to the best of your ability. At this school, everything that you put into it will be given back and then some. It is important to be somewhat self motivated to make sure you get the most out of everything offered here.', 'I enjoyed the number of engineering classes offered.  Classes such as intro to engineering design, principles of engineering, and civil engineering and architecture really allowed me to explore engineering and fostered a love for engineering.  These classes led me to major in engineering in college.', 'Watchung Hills Regional is an amazing school overall. With so many electives and a range of academic classes there is always a place for any student to fit in and find their niche.', "Currently a senior at Watchung Hills, I've seen everything. Good and bad. Watchung Hills is a very great school, academically. The students are ambitious, the athletes are motivated, and the teachers truly love their jobs. The school has an ambundous of resources such as technology, art supplies, instruments, biology tools, etc. Overall, there are no major accounts of issues regarding bullying or physical fights. However, one criticism. There is no diversity. It is a very caucasian dominant school, and students here have a very closed-off mindset. I feel as though most students are not very educated about people not like themselves, and therefore don't know how to act around certain minorities.  I have witnessed racial slurs, mostly behind people's backs, and felt very uncomfortable. The worst part of all, administration is not aware nor informed of occurrences like these, therefore there is no action against stopping this. We need change."]
column8: ['Watchung Hills is primarily full of white, affluent students. The academics are taken very seriously, but only to the extent that your test scores make them look good.', 'The teachers at Watching Hills are INCREDIBLE. Every day, I leave class inspired and ready to learn. However, the administration at Watchung Hills is terrible. When I had a problem with an unfair teacher last year, they were apathetic. Admin also resists any change that would better the mental state of its students if it risks lowering their statistics in any way.', 'Since 4 districts send their students to WHRHS, I am grateful for all the new friends I got to make and the people I got to interact with. Additionally, the teachers and guidance counselors are very helpful and supportive and the overall school offers many resources for students to use.', 'Watchung Hills Regional High School is a good highschool. There are lots of options for class levels (college prep, accelerated, honors, advanced placement). Also, there are many diverse classes and electives that you can take ranging from all types of subjects.', 'I enjoyed all four years at Watchung Hills.  The things I learned and the teachers were all amazing.  Playing a sport at the school was something I will always remember.  The school games and school events have an awesome school spirit.  I will always look back with great memories.', 'I liked that they prepare students for their college futures. I would like them to take into consideration their students opinions and focus on those ideas rather than just administrative ideas.', 'Watchung Hills is a regional high school so it has quite a large amount of students. It is a good school due to its challenging courses that teach students critical academic skills. The teachers are all engaging and supportive while the students are talented and driven. I am grateful to be a student at such a great school.', 'Your Watchung Hills experience is what you want to make it. With innumerable options about classes and clubs you fit in very well. However since it is a public school everything is shared and because that is the case some of the equipment is damaged and destroyed making some of the activities at the school unusable. However your education at Watchung Hills is very well put together and is designed for you to succeed. Teachers are more than welcoming to help you understand the topic weather that means they have to stay after class with you and help you.', 'I love Watchung hills, although we are not the most spirited school it is the best school. So big and so many different people to be around. This school represents anything you want to be. Everyone is very open to different things and for the most part everyone is very friendly. Most of the teachers are awesome and will help students in any way. The only bad thing I have to say about this school is the lack of school spirit. For such a big school I expected for everyone to go all out for everything. But over the years I have been there its gotten progressively better. The football games are defintely the most spirited. I wish all of the sporting events were that spirited.', 'I transferred as a sophomore and the whole experience from meeting new friends, teachers, and my guidance counselor helped make my transition smooth sailing. It has been smooth ever since I walked through the door. Big school with family feel!', 'There are opportunities for everyone at this school. While the administration has struggled at times, there are many positives to this school. Teachers have very flexible hours to come in for extra help and many understand the challenge and rigor of the school. School spirit is lackluster, but seems to be increasing. Challenging classes that certainly prepare students for college.', "It's a really nice place so far. While it may not be perfect the school is working hard to get there. There are constant improvements made to the school whether it be academically or physically. I really love having so many options for electives and feeling like I can make my own decisions.", 'The school offers many different course levels. There are CP, Honors, and AP courses. The school is huge and very diverse.', "WHRHS is somewhat average, the school itself is beautiful and is fairly well kept. The academics are rigorous and prepare students well for college. The administration is too concerned with some things such as the PARCC and the school's academic standings and is too light on punishments. For example, a huge cheating scandal spanning over several years had recently come to light and only one individual was punished and her punishment was a 10 day suspension and the colleges she applied to were not notified. Cheating is not taken seriously at all and should be more enforced. The administration does not listen to the concerns of the teachers or student body, it's pathetic.", 'The school is among one of the top public schools in the state. We have a wide range of classes and clubs that are offered. The community is a very close one and also a very welcoming one. My experience has been amazing due to to all the great teachers that I had that give me a passion for learning.', "Watchung Hills Regional High School is a very good school with a large selection of elective classes for its students and on the most part, a very dedicated staff of teachers and administrators. Its classes come in many different levels and they tend to prep its students for college. It also has numerous clubs for the students to choose. There is certainly a club to cover all interests. If the students do not find a club of interest, they could create their own and those new clubs could be offered to all other students once the clubs are approved. Further, the guidance counselors are extremely dedicated and helpful. They work hard to assist the students throughout the students' four years at the school in all aspects relating to their studies. I find that their assistance to the students during the college application process is most praiseworthy.", 'Great school academically. There are lots of ways to be involved in extracurricular activities such as sports, clubs, drama, band, chorus, etc.', 'Very good school academically and athletically.  I was very happy to move to this district at the right time before high school so I could be part of watching hills high school family.  teachers are very nice and helpful.  was able to play the sport that I always wanted to play in high school which football.', 'From my experience as a student at Watchung Hills is that the school not only offers a great education, but that the teachers and students are always encouraging you to improve everyday. What I like most about Watchung HIlls is how safe and included you feel. There is always someone to talk to whether its about school or just your daily life. If I were to change anything about the school it would be the school spirit. Although many of the people have school spirit the turnout for football games is always less than expected and that not only hurts the schools image, but the team as well. I would love to see a bigger turnout for games and more school run promotions at the games.', 'I love all the teachers and principals they have helped me be the person I am today helping caring and find to others. the teachers are the best that are so nice and give you help on everything you can ever need they have helped me with having trouble on tests and getting good grades. having a close relationship with the principals and security/resource officer has helped me to be confident in school and knowing they are always watching our for me and everyone that give me a sense of security and safety']

column2: ['I liked how my high school was academically rigorous. There were honors classes which challenged you. There was a lack of funding in the arts departments, while the sports teams received the most funding, even though many of the sports teams did not perform well.', 'It was a pretty good school overall that prepared me for college. The teachers were very insightful and provided good resources for students that would like to learn more about the topic at hand.', 'Students there are nice. For the most part, the teachers there are nice and knowledgeable. There are a lot of AP classes that students can take advantage of, as well as a flexible schedule (students get to choose if they want to drop a study hall for another class). A lot of courses that students can take in the performing arts, sciences, humanities, and language fields.', 'I went to Rutgers following my graduation  I thought I had to prepare myself for something more and it turned out to be another day in Holmdel High.', 'I greatly have enjoyed my time at Holmdel high school. I will be graduating from here in June and I can proudly say that the last four years have been nothing but a pleasure. The school has so much to offer. Great education, lots of diverse groups of students and teachers, an excellent facility, extremely safe environment, and has to be one of the best schools out there for getting you prepared for college. I had lots of fun going to school here with all of my friends and getting a great education. The sole reason most parents move to Holmdel is for the school system. The high school is a prime example of why people migrate here. I made so many great friends here, I  won two Group 2 State Championships with the soccer program, and I learned so many great lessons about not only about the subjects in school but life lessons as well. I will truly miss going to Holmdel High school. I will cherish the few months I still have here at Holmdel High school.', "I liked the number of AP classes the school offered. However, there are some teachers that should be reassessed in their ability to properly handle the students' needs with the curriculum after being there for 20+ years.", 'Holmdel High School is a parent run school. Whatever the parents want, usually happens. HHS is know for stron academics, however unless you were honors or below average, the academics weren’t that great. Holmdel schools are small, so you become family with students and faculty. From my experience, the teachers would do anything for me, and still would if I needed.', 'Great School. The opportunities Holmdel High School provides are unmatched by other schools in the area. The professors there are recognized as being in the top of their field and they show it through their grueling yet interesting styles of teaching.', 'I loved Holmdel High School because there are many opportunities to pursue both in the sciences and the arts. Many students are making their own research projects and also balancing other clubs and sports and succeeding at all of them.  There are several teachers I met that have changed my life for the better and helped me develop my future career path.', 'I love my school. Most of the teachers are very nice and extremely helpful, always willing to put in extra time to assist students who may need it. The food in the cafeteria is pretty fresh and there is always an excellent selection. The science programs at the school are amazing, with so many scholarships being given to graduating students and a lot of high level college and universities.', "Holmdel High School has definitely made me feel like I'm ready to take on any challenges the college process and my future has for me.", 'Incredible amount of bullying throughout middle and high school led me depressed, suicidal, and ended up leaving the school district altogether. Students were more interested in putting others down than building each other up. No school spirit whatsoever, and teachers did not care although I had been reaching out for help.', 'Holmdel High School has a rigorous curriculum and brilliant teachers that allow their students to flourish under the right circumstances. There are a wide variety of classes and students are slowly given the opportunity to choose different classes in order to suit their interests. However, there have been increasingly more regulations put into place in this school. These restrictions greatly inhibit the ability of many students to utilize all of their resources in the school environment. For this reason, while the education may be great, the environment in which you are learning certainly requires improvement.', "Holmdel is a very boring high school to go to. There is little to no school spirit and the athletics aren't very good besides the tennis team. Would not recommend to those seeking diversity. The administration also holds the students on a VERY tight leash.", 'Holmdel High School is a great schools with the best teachers! Students are given the instruction to prepare them for college.', 'I liked the resources that were readily available for students. The variety of classes gave students a lot of options.', 'I believe that I received a good education through Holmdel Schools, I have been in this school district since kindergarten and I have enjoyed it. The teachers that I have had vary, not every teacher was outstanding mainly because of teaching styles. One downside is that we have had the same classmates for 12 years, which is good and bad. Our grade is close because we have grown up together, but it does not allow a lot of diversity or opportunity to meet new people in school. Some classes are not as serious or vigorous as others, but that it due to the teachers. As far as college readiness, I feel somewhat prepared for college, I feel like I was not given as much work as I will receive in college. I also feel like we are too sheltered, and should be given more responsibility and independence. By saying this, I mean that the teachers should not always be so lenient because that causes laziness in students and bad working habits that will not be beneficial in college.', "I enjoyed my experience at Holmdel High School. It was a very comfortable atmosphere with support everywhere I looked. The guidance counselors did a good job preparing the students for college and the administration solved problems in the best ways possible. My only concern with the school is the staff. There are some teachers that just don't care about the students and their jobs the way they should. Some teachers receive a lot of complaints about their work ethic. Sports at HHS are not taken too seriously, but over the past few years, we have had a very strong men's soccer and track teams. Football isn't too strong but the teamwork and spirit is strong.", 'Holmdel High School has an excellent education system with a great support system for ambitious students. Unfortunately, the student population lacks school spirit and there is not much to do extracurricular-wise beyond academic endeavors .', 'A very competitive school in which students are constantly challenged to do their best, whether it be in academics, clubs, or sports. Overall a good school that very well prepares students for college.']

column6: ['Tough classes academically, good arts program and making great strides on athletics.  New football coach has dramatically changed the culture of the football program with fantastic results.', "Holmdel High School was a competitive school with great teachers. There's a wide variety of classes to choose from and they are very difficult. The teachers push you to do your best. This school made me so prepared for college. My first semester in college was extremely easy and I felt relieved that I wasn't as stressed as other students.", 'The academic program is excellent and serves to prepare students for college very well. It accommodates students of all levels.', 'Overall, I have had a very good high school experience in Holmdel. Many of the teachers are fantastic and love what they are doing and inspire their students everyday. However, it severely lacks in diversity and school spirit.', 'Holmdel High School prepares all of its students for the rigor and course work of college. Many of the regular classes at Holmdel are taught to the same standards as Honors classes in other schools, and the AP classes require a lot of hard work. This fosters a competitive drive  in the school regarding academics that is unparalleled in other schools in the county.', 'Throughout my four years  of high school at Holmdel High, I found that each year got better and more challenging than the last. I think that my school really prepares you for college life once you reach junior and senior years. Overall, I have enjoyed my time there and I will miss it when I graduate.', 'Holmdel High School is an academically competitive environment where expectations are high for every student. A large majority of us have excelled and graduated with flying colors, and I myself have been more than prepared for college. The opportunities to take AP and college-level courses and receive college credit are also available to students. My only criticism of this school is that its culture, clubs, and diversity are lacking overall.', "HHS has a nice environment. While school spirit is lacking and the administration can often be unstable and frequently replaced, there is a big focus on culturing the individual. The school population is small at around 250 per grade, but the smaller class size means that everyone gets to know each other and is rarely lonely. However, since it is such a small school many classes and programs are unable to run unless they have the interest of many passionate students. Also, there is an implied feeling of wealth in the town. Many wealthy kids are able to treat money as no matter, which can be alienating for the less wealthy town families especially with things like expensive field trips. The team sports aren't amazing but individual sports tend to rank higher.", 'The experience was average at best. The criteria to take honors or AP classes were stricter than other district schools. The teachers held extra help sessions only during lunch time, but did not have extra help sessions after school. This became a problem when my child had no free periods during the day, and only was available after school.  In addition, the Guidance Department did very little to help in the college application process.', 'Holmdel High School is a very good school.  They offer a wide variety of sports, music, and arts.  The principle is very accommodating to students that want to start new clubs.', 'I love the academics at the school. They offer so many different classes that you cant take all of them. The people are also nice if you get the right ones.', 'I loved my high school experience. I had some inspirational teachers. The cafeteria coffee is fantastic. I would like to see more diversity.', 'I liked Holmdel. I was in the honors and AP track so I often was very stressed, but I think that has prepared me well for college. Holmdel is a very good school so I cannot see anything that should be changed.', "If you're willing to work hard it will be a great school for you. It is very competitive academically, and that can be annoying, but most of the teachers in the AP and Honors classes really like what they are doing and teach well. The sports teams are pretty bad, except for a few like tennis and track. ", 'I always feel safe and secure! rarely any danger threats occur!', 'Lots of extra curricular activities! Students are always involved', 'Lots of extra curricular activities! I love the teachers and environment there!', 'Teachers are amazing! They value your education first and put in extra time and effort to help  you!', 'The lunch food does not look very appetizing so I try to avoid buying lunch.', 'Holmdel Highschool has many clubs to offer. These clubs are very accepting. The only issue is that they are not advertised very good so there is a lack of attendance.']
column8: ['Tough classes academically, good arts program and making great strides on athletics.  New football coach has dramatically changed the culture of the football program with fantastic results.', "Holmdel High School was a competitive school with great teachers. There's a wide variety of classes to choose from and they are very difficult. The teachers push you to do your best. This school made me so prepared for college. My first semester in college was extremely easy and I felt relieved that I wasn't as stressed as other students.", 'The academic program is excellent and serves to prepare students for college very well. It accommodates students of all levels.', 'Overall, I have had a very good high school experience in Holmdel. Many of the teachers are fantastic and love what they are doing and inspire their students everyday. However, it severely lacks in diversity and school spirit.', 'Holmdel High School prepares all of its students for the rigor and course work of college. Many of the regular classes at Holmdel are taught to the same standards as Honors classes in other schools, and the AP classes require a lot of hard work. This fosters a competitive drive  in the school regarding academics that is unparalleled in other schools in the county.', 'Throughout my four years  of high school at Holmdel High, I found that each year got better and more challenging than the last. I think that my school really prepares you for college life once you reach junior and senior years. Overall, I have enjoyed my time there and I will miss it when I graduate.', 'Holmdel High School is an academically competitive environment where expectations are high for every student. A large majority of us have excelled and graduated with flying colors, and I myself have been more than prepared for college. The opportunities to take AP and college-level courses and receive college credit are also available to students. My only criticism of this school is that its culture, clubs, and diversity are lacking overall.', "HHS has a nice environment. While school spirit is lacking and the administration can often be unstable and frequently replaced, there is a big focus on culturing the individual. The school population is small at around 250 per grade, but the smaller class size means that everyone gets to know each other and is rarely lonely. However, since it is such a small school many classes and programs are unable to run unless they have the interest of many passionate students. Also, there is an implied feeling of wealth in the town. Many wealthy kids are able to treat money as no matter, which can be alienating for the less wealthy town families especially with things like expensive field trips. The team sports aren't amazing but individual sports tend to rank higher.", 'The experience was average at best. The criteria to take honors or AP classes were stricter than other district schools. The teachers held extra help sessions only during lunch time, but did not have extra help sessions after school. This became a problem when my child had no free periods during the day, and only was available after school.  In addition, the Guidance Department did very little to help in the college application process.', 'Holmdel High School is a very good school.  They offer a wide variety of sports, music, and arts.  The principle is very accommodating to students that want to start new clubs.', 'I love the academics at the school. They offer so many different classes that you cant take all of them. The people are also nice if you get the right ones.', 'I loved my high school experience. I had some inspirational teachers. The cafeteria coffee is fantastic. I would like to see more diversity.', 'I liked Holmdel. I was in the honors and AP track so I often was very stressed, but I think that has prepared me well for college. Holmdel is a very good school so I cannot see anything that should be changed.', "If you're willing to work hard it will be a great school for you. It is very competitive academically, and that can be annoying, but most of the teachers in the AP and Honors classes really like what they are doing and teach well. The sports teams are pretty bad, except for a few like tennis and track. ", 'I always feel safe and secure! rarely any danger threats occur!', 'Lots of extra curricular activities! Students are always involved', 'Lots of extra curricular activities! I love the teachers and environment there!', 'Teachers are amazing! They value your education first and put in extra time and effort to help  you!', 'The lunch food does not look very appetizing so I try to avoid buying lunch.', 'Holmdel Highschool has many clubs to offer. These clubs are very accepting. The only issue is that they are not advertised very good so there is a lack of attendance.']

column2: ['Many teachers are capable and do a gret job while others are selfish and are set in their ways and do not care about helping their kids. Some administrators seem only concerned with money and not the students.', 'BBHS has given me a great education that I believe has prepared me to excel in college. I love the people at my school. Unfortunately since we are so small, our diversity was terrible and everyone was the same. I wish we did better in sports!!', 'Blind Brook High School is an incredible school, located on an incredible environment that nurtures and provides an excellent space for students to learn and grow as individuals.', "It's a small, wonderful school. The teachers are excellent, as are the facilities. The opportunities are endless, and it's really a great place to have grown up and gone to school.", 'The staff does not like to spend non-stipend / paid time on extracurricular activities.', 'It is rare to find a teacher willing to stay late or arrive early for a parents meeting . The staff seems to believe the school is there for their benefit more so than them being there for the students. Parents tend to be seen as a nuisance when they get involved in academics or counseling related matters,', 'Overall very safe due to the nature of the neighborhood and small size of the school. Lately there seem to more issues concerning drugs and alcohol.', 'Overall I have been able to navigate and do well in a very academically competitive school. I wish the staff and student body were more ethnically and background diverse,  I have some good friends who I have known since elementary school. Once we got to dating age the lack of diversity seemed to affect some of my relationships. I look forward to moving on to college with more students and diversity.', "There are a fantastic number of extracurricular activities. There are a variety of sports teams, clubs, and arts opportunities. That being said, however, there is some inequality among these extracurriculars. For instance, the sports teams almost annually receive new equipment, whereas in the last 8 years the theater department's budget has been slashed - only being allotted a fourth of what it once was.", "The school, while lacking in diversity, has given me all the tools I need to live a successful life: a stellar education, worthwhile extracurricular activities, and a sense of what I want to be in life and what I don't want to be. I want to be well rounded, a renaissance man, who lives humbly and compassionately. I don't necessarily need to be flashy and glitzy, just be me. Yes, a luxury car and a large house would be nice, but those are just bonuses that I believe will come along with loving one's life.", 'Some teachers fit the mold of a "great teacher," while others are lackluster. Several of them go above and beyond with use of technology in the class room, and attend to students\' needs whenever possible. On the other hand, there are teachers who are more conservative and stay away from technology, and only make themselves available when they want to be.', 'Most of the teachers at my school are hard working and dedicated to the overall well being of the students along with being actively involved in the successes/failures of the students.', 'The teachers and Administrators are very accommodating to needs and explanations when needed. I regularly attend open house and teacher parent events and walk away with a great feeling that the schools are run extremely well.', 'The teachers perform to a high standard of education.', 'I had very good teachers, loved soccer and band.', 'So it really depends with each situation/year because the administration is either okay or they need to calm  down', 'The majority of the teachers want nothing but the best for you and will make time for you if you need to go over a test or ask some questions however there are a few teachers who need to stop attempting to teach.', "There's a club for everyone whether you're into theater, sports, LGBTQ* rights, human relations, yearbook or really anything", "Actual school is fine. Safe and just good overall. Kids aren't great outside of school.", 'The food is very bad. Sometimes it grosses me out. They have taken away all snacks that have any sort of unhealthy features.']

column6: ['Administration is good and fair. I have never had any issues though so I am not very involved with their punishment on stuff.', "The outdoor fields and gymnasium are excellent (possibly best in the area). The locker rooms are pretty gross and the fitness room is small and doesn't have alot of machines. Also equipment is lacking.", 'Some teachers go above and beyond and are great overall, other teachers either lack qualities necessary for running a good class', 'Lots of options, quality of options varies. Not all clubs are quality, same with certain sports teams', 'The academics provided at this school are among the top 9 in the country. Probably the most important emphasis put on the school is focused towards education.', 'Like I mentioned before, this is a very small school so everyone knows everyone. That being said, there are a good number of cliques that form as a result. If you come to this school with a friendly and open attitude however, you will make friends.', 'There truly is a club for everyone to did here. Whether you like sports of the theater, if you are a student at blind brook there is a club out there for you.', "I personally don't really care for the schools lunches, I like to bring a paper bag lunch. If I had to eat and forgot to pack a lunch however, the school lunches are not particularly bad, I would just rather have something else.", 'There are plenty of resources at each students disposal. There are a sufficient amount of computers, working stations, etc.. I would highly regard the resources available at blind brook', 'Many of the teachers that I have had, have a thorough understanding of their profession and their material. The teachers will also provide extra help that may be easier to digest than an in-class lesson.', 'I personally play on quite a few athletic teams which leads me to say that I thoroughly enjoy the sports blind brook has to offer. That being said, there could be a few more choices of sports aside from just the generic ones.', 'Most if not all of the blind brook staff are warm and welcoming. The teachers will push you to excell, and guidance counselors provide an excellent source of reference for just about anything. A few of the rules set at the school are, in my mind, a bit unnecessary; however, I think the entire faculty has done and will continue to do a great job.', 'Classes are engaging, interesting and challenging. Teachers are always available for help and do there best to create exciting lessons and get to know students. There is a variety of classes available to take including AP courses. The scheduling process is relatively easy and guidance counselors are helpful. The workload is manageable however there is a good amount of work given to students and it is challenging. ', 'College preparedness is excellent as a result of the high standards of education found at Blind Brook and the challenging classes available. This school has a competitive environment and is ranked as one of the top high schools in the country. The school has a 100% graduation rate and most students go on to top ranked colleges and land great internships. ', 'There is a very diverse and plentiful amount of clubs one can join and take part in. Also students can easily create a new club with the right amount of support and interest in the club. Many students take part and really get involved in clubs and it is a great way to meet new people and make friends and it allows many opportunities for after school activities/field trips.  ', 'My overall school experience was great. There is a spot for everyone those who are artsy, athletic, intellectual and so forth. The school was a very small school and therefore everyone knew each other and being friends with a variety of people was generally easy. The classes were interesting and challenging and really prepared me for college and i had fun getting to know my teachers. The more involved you are in the community the more you get out of the experience i found myself involved in many clubs and sports and made many friends in many difference grades who had different interests and it made my experience awesome. Every student is an individual and the teachers, faculty and staff really get to know everyone and it is a tight close nit community. ', 'There are excellent sports facilities available for athletes and students; including a fitness center, brand new football and baseball fields as well as a nice looking track. Many students are involved in school sports and there is a good variety of sports to choose from including; soccer, basketball, football, lacrosse, track and field, swimming, cheerleading/dance team, baseball, hockey, tennis, cross country, and ski. Some sports teams are more competitive than others soccer and basketball being the most competitive and successful teams. There are many talented student athletes that end up playing college sports if they are dedicated and work hard. Fan support varies depending on the importance of the game and the success of the team and school spirit is pretty average.  ', 'The menu had a variety of options and there was an increased diversity in food options. The cafeteria staff had made efforts to increase the healthiness of the food and there has been a great improvement with many whole food options and salads ect. The food is overall pretty good and there is an abundance of snacks available throughout the day starting with breakfast options and ending with after school snacks. ', 'Many administrative policies have been made in order to help students benefit most from resources available and ensure the school environment is safe and friendly. Guidance counselors are often free to help with any academic or personal issues and make the SAT/college process less stressful. Classes are challenging but very interesting with a dedicated faculty that genuinely care about their students and are always available to help. The principal was a daily presence throughout the high school and always trying to be friendly with students, getting to know everyone, and present at school events such as homecoming games. The office staff and security guards were welcoming and helpful and kind if you got to know them. There is a zero tolerance policy regarding bullying and cheating and there are constant programs and workshops to enforce these policies. The dress code is pretty lenient allowing many types of clothing within reason.   ', 'good academics, but mixed socially, but everyone finds their group']
