column2: ['This school is one of the greatest in my opinion. There is an immense amount of diversity between students and growth and enriching courses. Our school also has one of the best school spirit. However, in SHHS there is an utter lack of spreading the message of AP and honors classes to minorities.', "Sleepy Hollow has a lot of diversity in its student body. All the teachers are passionate about what they're learning.", "I have really enjoyed my experience thus far at SHHS. The teachers seem to genuinely care about the students' well being and want to see them succeed. The food is subpar but… what do you expect. It's school lunch. Sleepy Hollow is a very diverse neighborhood and this is clearly represented in the school. You will find people of different ethnicities, origins, political stances and household incomes. As with all schools, there are groups and some people believe high school is the most important part of life, but most people are chill, laid back, cool people. I wouldn't want to go anywhere else.", 'Perfect school with great students and teachers. The teachers are dedicated to their work and are very wise. They always lend a helping hand and never give up on us. They are the perfect example of teachers that all schools need to succeed.', 'Personally loved my experience going to this school. So much school spirit and the teachers want you to do well and succeed. Guidance counselors are super great and helpful especially when applying to school, they always try to make time to help you.', 'Sleepy Hollow High School is a diverse school with great teachers, administration, and many students who want to learn. The school offers many community service opportunities and work programs. The school also accomodates for students with disabilities. The school not only has a diverse culture but also has a wide range of students from different financial statuses.', "My experience at Sleepy Hollow has been everything I could've hoped for and I am so grateful to have attended such an incredible school. Our student body is very diverse, which has allowed me to learn from all different perspectives and establish connections to people from various cultural backgrounds. This has truly enriched my education. The academics are excellent, the teachers are kind and friendly, and the overall environment is very welcoming and enjoyable.", "Unhealthy environment for LGBTQ+ students. Very cliquey atmosphere. Poorer off the Westchester school districts. Block schedule is annoying and doesn't seem to help productivity at all. Lots of nasty rumors about bullying and straight up violence that occurs, even if they are given a fraction of truth.", "In my opinion, Sleepy Hollow High School is an amazing High School to attend. The teachers and staff are always there to help and support students. The atmosphere here at Sleepy is quite interesting to some students and staff but it's just how it runs here. The amount of programs and equipment that the school buys for the students is astonishing. It just shows how much the staff cares about the student's success. Students can get along with others in clubs, sports, and after-school activities. There's not much to change around the school other than phone rules, hats, school lunch, and or student parking.", 'I liked the diversity and the academics and the amount of courses it offers. I would like to see more languages added to the foreign language department and more clubs that promote world equality and represent people as a whole.', 'Sleepy Hollow High School is a school that is ethically diverse and takes school spirit very seriously. The Headless Horseman is the mascot for the school which makes Halloween extra special because the school encourages the students to dress up and the town does the same. The teachers overall are good but some can be more personal than others. Some teachers rely heavily on powerpoint while others like the lecture style approach. The one thing I would change is to make sure that no student goes to prom alone unless they want to.', 'I received a great education from this school. Diversity is celebrated here and kindness is promoted. Safety is an upmost priority. I do wish that there was a home-ec class provided or mandatory. I do not feel as though I was prepared for college as much as I could have been.', 'teachers are always so helpful and have many office hours if you need help. the students are also very kind to you, especially if you are a new student.', "High school wasn't really a big part of my life.  I really enjoyed playing baseball because it allowed me to develop strong bonds with many of my current friends.  While some classes drove me nuts, there were a select few like AP Physics, AP Calculus BC, and AP Computer Science that I really enjoyed.  What made these classes so great were the teachers.  They really want to see you succeed and that helped me strive in those classes.  I would strongly recommend reaching out for extra help if you need it as most teachers are willing to work around your schedule.  I do wish the counselors could have been more involved in the college selection process.  While I don't have strong pride in my high school like other students, I am happy I was able to have the teachers I had.", 'I have loved my experience at Sleepy Hollow High School.  I will be sad to leave in June but I know that they have prepared me for the future.  I look forward to continue challenging myself in college.', "I have been going to Sleepy Hollow High School as a freshman since 2014 and I have loved every bit of it! The teachers have always and continue to be so supportive of their students. Everyone really comes together and it such a tight knit school and I'm glad I have the privilege of graduating from Sleepy Hollow next June.", "The Sleepy Hollow High School Experience is like no other. One of the things that makes us very unique is the diversity in the school! Everyone is from various parts of the world, yet we all get along and have a good time. Another thing thats great about Sleepy Hollow High School as I've heard from current alums in college is how the teachers prepare you for college. Our school culture is one thing that makes us different from the rest. Being in Sleepy Hollow during October is sure a treat. We attract a lot of tourists and our spirit week is in October. That includes getting ready for the big homecoming football game on saturday, getting together as a grade and decorating the hallways and dressed up according to what theme it is that day. We are nationally recognized because of our mascot The Headless Horseman. Only thing I would change is the food, the food is average.", "Based on my experience in Sleepy Hollow High School, it's been a wonderful experience shared by friends and teachers. As a Senior Applying to colleges, professional councilors make sure your college ready before fall of senior year. In addition, the one thing when entering and leaving Sleepy Hollow High School is the school spirit. Both Boys and Girls Sports are really competitive and energetic especially, Football, Basketball, Soccer and Wrestling. Academically, its really good to send your child here to get hands on advance learning (Continually getting better).", 'I loved Sleepy Hollow High school, because it focused very well on diversity, and the students. Also on the involvement of the parents. They worked really hard to get us ready for college up until the very end, when graduation time neared. Almost everyone is super nice and supportive. Its a really great high school.', "It was an important part of my life's journey. I had a great experience and learned how to be more indeoendednt and creative. The teachers that i had at Sleepy Hollow High are some of the best people and mentors I've ever met."]

Guidance counselors are super great and helpful especially when applying to school, they always try to make time to help you.', 'Sleepy Hollow High School is a diverse school with great teachers, administration, and many students who want to learn. The school offers many community service opportunities and work programs. The school also accomodates for students with disabilities. The school not only has a diverse culture but also has a wide range of students from different financial statuses.', "My experience at Sleepy Hollow has been everything I could've hoped for and I am so grateful to have attended such an incredible school. Our student body is very diverse, which has allowed me to learn from all different perspectives and establish connections to people from various cultural backgrounds. This has truly enriched my education. The academics are excellent, the teachers are kind and friendly, and the overall environment is very welcoming and enjoyable.", "Unhealthy environment for LGBTQ+ students. Very cliquey atmosphere. Poorer off the Westchester school districts. Block schedule is annoying and doesn't seem to help productivity at all. Lots of nasty rumors about bullying and straight up violence that occurs, even if they are given a fraction of truth.", "In my opinion, Sleepy Hollow High School is an amazing High School to attend. The teachers and staff are always there to help and support students. The atmosphere here at Sleepy is quite interesting to some students and staff but it's just how it runs here. The amount of programs and equipment that the school buys for the students is astonishing. It just shows how much the staff cares about the student's success. Students can get along with others in clubs, sports, and after-school activities. There's not much to change around the school other than phone rules, hats, school lunch, and or student parking.", 'I liked the diversity and the academics and the amount of courses it offers. I would like to see more languages added to the foreign language department and more clubs that promote world equality and represent people as a whole.', 'Sleepy Hollow High School is a school that is ethically diverse and takes school spirit very seriously. The Headless Horseman is the mascot for the school which makes Halloween extra special because the school encourages the students to dress up and the town does the same. The teachers overall are good but some can be more personal than others. Some teachers rely heavily on powerpoint while others like the lecture style approach. The one thing I would change is to make sure that no student goes to prom alone unless they want to.', 'I received a great education from this school. Diversity is celebrated here and kindness is promoted. Safety is an upmost priority. I do wish that there was a home-ec class provided or mandatory. I do not feel as though I was prepared for college as much as I could have been.', 'teachers are always so helpful and have many office hours if you need help. the students are also very kind to you, especially if you are a new student.', "High school wasn't really a big part of my life.  I really enjoyed playing baseball because it allowed me to develop strong bonds with many of my current friends.  While some classes drove me nuts, there were a select few like AP Physics, AP Calculus BC, and AP Computer Science that I really enjoyed.  What made these classes so great were the teachers.  They really want to see you succeed and that helped me strive in those classes.  I would strongly recommend reaching out for extra help if you need it as most teachers are willing to work around your schedule.  I do wish the counselors could have been more involved in the college selection process.  While I don't have strong pride in my high school like other students, I am happy I was able to have the teachers I had.", 'I have loved my experience at Sleepy Hollow High School.  I will be sad to leave in June but I know that they have prepared me for the future.  I look forward to continue challenging myself in college.', "I have been going to Sleepy Hollow High School as a freshman since 2014 and I have loved every bit of it! The teachers have always and continue to be so supportive of their students. Everyone really comes together and it such a tight knit school and I'm glad I have the privilege of graduating from Sleepy Hollow next June.", "The Sleepy Hollow High School Experience is like no other. One of the things that makes us very unique is the diversity in the school! Everyone is from various parts of the world, yet we all get along and have a good time. Another thing thats great about Sleepy Hollow High School as I've heard from current alums in college is how the teachers prepare you for college. Our school culture is one thing that makes us different from the rest. Being in Sleepy Hollow during October is sure a treat. We attract a lot of tourists and our spirit week is in October. That includes getting ready for the big homecoming football game on saturday, getting together as a grade and decorating the hallways and dressed up according to what theme it is that day. We are nationally recognized because of our mascot The Headless Horseman. Only thing I would change is the food, the food is average.", "Based on my experience in Sleepy Hollow High School, it's been a wonderful experience shared by friends and teachers. As a Senior Applying to colleges, professional councilors make sure your college ready before fall of senior year. In addition, the one thing when entering and leaving Sleepy Hollow High School is the school spirit. Both Boys and Girls Sports are really competitive and energetic especially, Football, Basketball, Soccer and Wrestling. Academically, its really good to send your child here to get hands on advance learning (Continually getting better).", 'I loved Sleepy Hollow High school, because it focused very well on diversity, and the students. Also on the involvement of the parents. They worked really hard to get us ready for college up until the very end, when graduation time neared. Almost everyone is super nice and supportive. Its a really great high school.', "It was an important part of my life's journey. I had a great experience and learned how to be more indeoendednt and creative. The teachers that i had at Sleepy Hollow High are some of the best people and mentors I've ever met."]
column6: ['Excellent teaching staff. Loved the atmosphere and people there. Best four years of my life ! I was very involved in everything sleepy - sports, clubs, activities- and I miss it very much. Definitely go here if you are a parent searching for a child!', 'The curriculum is wonderful, instilling high standards in their students that have carried on past their high school career. The teachers are, for the most part, friendly and well-taught, ensuring to properly articulate and cultivate their course material to guarantee the elevation of student capabilities.', 'Sleepy Hollow was a great high school. We were truly a little community there. We may not have been the top school in academics or sports, however we held our own against our competitors.', "I found the teachers and faculty supportive and available, and I think that the courses at this school did a fantastic job of preparing me for college-level work. I'm also really thankful for the environment -- the school is very diverse and feels quite safe, without any of the typical bullying or clique problems that you so often hear about in relation to college. In addition, the surrounding town is a safe, fun place to grow up, and the local community is extremely supportive of the students.", 'Sleepy Hollow High School is a unique public school that I was lucky to attend. There is a lot of diversity among students and teachers and that makes a student feel comfortable and welcomed. Sleepy Hollow High School offers AP courses, different languages, has honor societies, clubs, afternoon programs and sports. I participated in few sports including tennis, soccer and volleyball and was always encouraged to complete school work first. Also, as a second language student, I was fortuned to join regular classes and learn the English language in order to form and maintain friendships.', 'Sleepy Hollow High School has a very diverse population with amazing teachers and many extracurricular activities. It provided a wonderful place to have fun, while still focusing on work, but I feel it has not properly prepared me for college life because of the class settings.', 'Sleepy Hollow High School allows its students to participate in many different activities and maintains a loving and exclusive environment with both teachers and students. The academics are very rigorous, but teachers tend to be inconsistent with their teaching methods, depending on their moods. One day you will be doing work through the entire 90 minute period, meanwhile on another day you may find yourself watching 90 minutes worth of YouTube videos, unrelated to the current topic.', "I loved most of the teachers.Class were long but interesting for the most part. Grades weren't that large in size which allowed you to know everyone.  It was a once in a lifetime experience i will never forget.", 'I love how close Sleepy is as a school. It doesn\'t matter where you come from, who you are, etc. Everyone is different in Sleepy. Everyone is unique in their own way. Whether you\'re "popular" or more of an "introvert". The one thing everyone has in common with each other is how much spirit we have for Sleepy and that right there is what brings us so close together as a school.', "I loved going to Sleepy Hollow High School. There was always a sense of community present - even after attending for four years. Teachers were always available for not just lesson reviews but great guidance. Sleepy Hollow was also a place full of spirit and that's something that really united everyone.", 'I have loved my years at Sleepy Hollow High School! It is a great school! The teachers are all amazing people and are really committed to helping us as students learn and prepare for our futures.  At Sleepy Hollow we take a lot of pride in our school as well.  We have a lot of wonderful events and we just all share a common love for our school and sometimes each other.', "There are a lot of ways ton get involved in school activities. It's also pretty easy to develop relationships with your teachers. Spirit week is often the binding force for each grade and is a lot of fun. High school here really ends up to be what you make of it", "I love the bond between the students and the teachers!  We are all so close and diverse. It gives a great taste to what's to come in the future when you work with all different types of people. ", 'Some good classes and teachers. It has amazing art program but is underfunded. generally awful administration and food.', 'The academics and activities were great.', "Very diverse and everyone's culture is included.", "There's many activities to chose from and there's at least one activity one can join.", 'Sleepy hollow high school is very diverse and everyone is always involved and never left behind', 'This school is very into art. The school allowed the art club to paint morals around the school. The school also got involved in th vans comipition. I was on of the winners in my junior year. I also got to particate and do a moral in town beads use of the school.', 'My math teacher use to tell us how we would use the math problem in real life. He said the statistics we would use in business to see in what they should invest.  Also that magazine used it to analyze polls.']

column2: ['This school is ok. You can take columbia university classes for free, but we also share space with another school, the gym sucks, and the people suck. Some teachers are terrible but some of them are ok.', "I enjoyed the variety of classes and the fact that we're given the opportunity to take college classes at Columbia University, as well as many other schools. However, I did not enjoy the extremely strict uniform policy, some of the teachers, and some of the students.", 'When my daughter entered Columbia secondary school , she was suprised to see this school campus  is so small compared to her previous school in Beijing China. Maybe it is in Newyork city,narrow, limit.More time she spent the time in school, more she like everything and enjoy very moment in school. The school has the teachers taking their best efforts  help each students in their academy, arts, curriculum etc. The teachers are familiar with every student and have very good relationships with students. My daughter involved in the sports of cross country and annal Broadway musical in school. As the rising seniors ,the AP chemistry teacher and AP calculus gave them a lot of summer time homework which has wonderful explanations  about it .I was told that the AP chemistry teacher Pro. Rachel Jun is a recipient of a 2018Blackboard Award! I’m very very glad the school gives the engineering  lesson and to my surprise,she equipped an amazing robot full of high technology during the class.', 'A very small school, but most the faculty gives each student personalized assistance. The school offers a wide variety of programs and worthwhile help from college advisors, counselors and more. Resources are average, but the culture makes up for it.', "My son is a senior and graduating this year. He is studying at CSS for three years and it has been a great experience so far. Although school's closer relation with Columbia U. is advantageous, number of AP courses are only a few, not enough. Most of the teachers are great, administration and college readiness is excellent. I wish they had a library in the building shared by three schools, or an access opportunity to Columbia libraries.", 'I have had an incredible academic journey at Columbia Secondary School. The kids are super encouraging and the general vibe is that kids will ensure they all succeed. The school is a bit heavy on project-based learning, but more often than not they are engaging and fun.', "From my time in the Columbia Secondary School, I have learned that it is important to be involved in the school community and take advantage of all of the resources that are offered in the school's facilities. This includes nominations for extracurricular programs and college classes that can be taken outside of the school.", "I'm still in freshman year, and I've been here since 6th grade. The school and academics are good in itself. The teachers are very passionate about what they teach compared to a lot of other schools I've heard of. It's honestly what you make of it. It's a hard school to be quite frank. The people here, aren't exactly the best and I've been involved in too much drama from 6th to 9th grade. Homework is not too hard or long if you manage your time well. This is a school where you can very easily get involved with the community, however, not many kids do. It's quite hard to be independent here, but you honestly can be if you try. But yeah, be aware of these things. You can take Columbia courses though, only if you're eligible and you have REALLY good grades. The dean is strict on the uniform policy, which is annoying. The girl's basketball team was cut off which really sucks, and the only sports that are really focused on are the boy's basketball, and the rugby team. Review by: Alyssa R.P", "Overall I have greatly enjoyed my time at BSU and feel that it has prepared me for college in ways that I didn't expect.", "I went to this school for seven years (middle school and high school) and I can say for sure that they prepared me for college. Their curriculum is STEM heavy, with engineering (with computer science), science, math, and technology all four years. The only thing I have to say is that their music and art curriculum is a little lacking. But there are still art opportunities! There is a musical production every year that takes a whole semester to prepare for. After school there are a number of clubs and electives for every interest (I enjoyed Video Game Club!). We even have a garden, complete with live chickens! College preparedness begins  near the end of your Junior year; I was so ready that I had my college application finished before November, thanks to the college counselors. The teachers are great here, open for help (many of them have office hours). The workload might be tough at first, but it's nothing that students can handle. I will miss the school when I leave for college.", 'As far as New York City schools go, Columbia Secondary School for Math, Science and Engineering is a good school. You are given many opportunities as a student ,like the option to take classes at Columbia University, and there are no shortage in the amount of extra-curriculars you can take. This school also has a large emphasis on rugby and on STEM. The only problems with this school are that it is still young and can be very unorganized at times and also is very competitive with a heavy work load. However Overall it is a really good school and there is always something to do.', 'I really like the diversity at Columbia Secondary School. I’ve gained friends from all around the world from just being in school. Our academics are really good too because we have courses that challenge us beyond the average grade level that we are in.', "My experience at CSS is very different. There are many highs and lows about the school, just like any other school. But overall, academically, the teachers do the best that they can do to educate us, and  the students recognize that, even if we don't push ourselves to do our best. However, many of the students find CSS challenging due to the workload. But we're all up for the challenge, otherwise we would not be at CSS. CSS is a great school, and should be recognized more for being a great school instead of some of the things that have happened in the past at CSS.", 'I attended CSS for 7 years,and it was quite a unique experience for me.  I felt that the school prepared me well as I go to college in the fall, with both the teachers and the ability to take classes at Columbia University to get a vibe of how college classes are. The school does have some variety of clubs and sports offered for students, but not as extensive compared to other schools,mostly since we share the building with 2 other schools so times for practices and games are limited.', "CSS prepared me for college and encouraged me to apply to multiple colleges so I'd have a range of options.", "I attended CSS  from 6th all the way to 12th grade, and was quite happy with my experience.  For its incredible diversity, strong sense of community, and challenging academics, I'd highly recommend CSS. Being able to take CU classes in my later years was a great opportunity, and the small grade sizes always meant that teachers built personal relationships with their students. All that being said, CSS is definitely not a typical selective NYC magnet school, and if that is the experience you're looking for I'd recommend against CSS. The school lacks proper funding, as evident by the cramped hallways and lack of a library, and the sense of competition found at schools like Bronx Science or Stuyvesant is completely absent.  That isn't to say CSS isn't difficult   if you want it to be - its just that the core curriculum (and administration) never push students too far our of their comfort zone. Overall, I'd definitely recommend the school.", "It was very stressful at times, but the school does prepare the students for college. The school doesn't get much funding, and the administration can be frustrating at times, but it prepares the students for their next steps. Although small, the school has a big sense of community. Columbia Secondary is diverse, and holds events appreciating every bodies culture.", 'I do not hold any grudges towards Columbia Secondary School and am very grateful for the time I had there. The access to various college course options were tremendously helpful and the college office takes good care of their students in the application process, as well as matching a student up to a good college for them. The family spirit of it is also well intact and fostered through activities and events held by the administration and parents of the students. The types of classes provided are also quite good, although their quality in actuality may fluctuate.', "I like my classes. All of my classes are rigorous enough in order to prepare me and help me attain the skills necessary to succeed in college. Although the rule policies are pretty strict, and at times, annoying, I understand it's for the best, and they are just trying to maintain order. I've been at CSS for 5 years now and counting. I have made such great friends here, and you feel as if you know everyone because it's such a small school. Also, the teachers are very easy to reach out to. They really care about your education, and they all have their own office hours after school in order to ensure that you understand the material. About the school culture, we take pride in our musicals, which have so much support from everyone affiliated with the school. They are amazing. Overall, I have so far enjoyed my experience at CSS. Of course, we all hate coming to school because of the work, but I just enjoy my school in general.", "Columbia Secondary is a great school for academics. You are encouraged to do your very best. Most of the teachers will help you if you ask and want you to succeed. This is a public school so the food and facilities are not the best but based off of what they have, we're better off than some others. Sports are not a big part of the CSS community but they are there. This school makes me feel ready for college because of the workload and how I've learned to manage it."]

column6: ['I loved my time at Columbia Secondary School. A very accelerated way of learning, this high school provided students with a private school experience whilst staying at a public school level. The teachers were friendly and knew exactly how to handle and teach each individual person, whilst still staying on task and thoroughly increasing knowledge. For the future I would like to see a change within the food system, more options presented as well as at a better quality. I would also like to see the administration increase their abilities when it comes to helping students in a more fair way.', 'Since it’s a new school, there are still quite a few steps that need to be taken before this school is running more efficiently. However, I was 100% prepared for college work and learned an immense amount at CSS that has been incredibly useful in every situation.', 'I loved being surrounded by a diverse, inter-knit, and supportive community. I developed a deep relationship with my professors, peers, and some staff members. CSS has made me a more culturally aware person and has opened me the doors to cool opportunities: from attending Columbia University classes to hanging out with chickens at the garden. Our school is truly one of a kind. I wish that we could obtain a bigger space because as we continue expanding as a whole, we are going to need a facility so that our students can thrive to the maximum.', "The school is very small, I would prefer if it had its own building. A lot of the teachers are nice but some aren't very interested in the students and how well the understand the content, rather they just want to blow through the course.", 'What I have loved so much about Columbia Secondary School is the opportunity to take college classes at Columbia University with other college students. I believe that my experiences at CU have helped me to develop new studying skills and work habits that I may not have developed otherwise.', 'Columbia Secondary School is a very diverse and safe place that allows the students and staff to get along well, learn from each other, and build a better community.', 'Thinking back on my high school career at Columbia Secondary School, I now realize it was not very memorable. I enjoyed being around some of the students, but a lot of the time, students were very loud in the hallways and classrooms. Some professors were amazing at what they did; you could tell they really cared about their students work. There were also many professors who did not seem to care very much about their students work. The academics were never easy. There was always something challenging in each class, getting us more prepared for college. There were sadly not many clubs or activities or sports available for students while I attended. Despite there not being very much of school culture, I never felt afraid while being at school. Just because there is not a lot of school spirit does not mean students are mean or aggressive towards one another. Even though I cannot remember much of my high school career, I do remember it always being safe and welcoming.', 'Although the diversity and school events in Columbia Secondary School are like no other, some teachers do not care about the well-being of their students. The school also tends to sweep under the rug their errors but are not afraid to shine the spotlight on the errors of their students. In addition, the school honors the same group of students and do not motivate others to reach for their best. That being said Columbia Secondary School still consists of very bright and well-informed individuals which explains why bullying is not very common in this school.', 'An excellent school, helps you get ready for your future and has great teachers. You learn a lot while having fun. Teachers are very approachable and will help you with anything you ask for help with as best as they can', 'This school has great academics, well taught by passionate teachers, who go out of their way to help students reach their goals. The electives it offers along with opportunities such as its CU courses and strong engineering and philosophy curriculum allow for a well-rounded education with the resources necessary to make students develop interests they will pursue in the real world.', 'This school is one of the few schools that actually cares about the students. Teachers recognize the potential in every one of us and push us to become better. Very little do you see schools as open minded and rational as Columbia Secondary School.', 'The school is immensely diverse and the curriculum is quite rigorous. This school prepares you for the rigors of college and they even allow you to take classes at Columbia University as a high school student. The teachers are motivated and try their hardest to keep students motivated and engaged!', 'My experience in Columbia Secondary School has overall been good. It has pushed me to taken advantage of rigorous courses whether its been AP classes, college classes, or CU classes. Also the diversity in my classes have positively influenced my learning in classes and my overall growth as a person. Finally, the teachers have all encouraged me to always continue to do the best work I can, and also always ask for help when needed. The only thing I would have liked was a greater expansion in the sport and extracurricular area, in order to make me feel more motivated to become a part of the CSS community.', 'Columbia Secondary School is a great diverse community where everyone works together for the success of the students. The administration, faculty, parents and students bring the community to its best.', 'All of out teachers are professors and challenge us in the classroom which is good for our knowledge.', 'There are not many sports, but their is volleyball, basketball, soccer and rugby.', 'In term of the relationships you build with teachers, they make you feel safe and welcomed. Overall helping you engage in class.', 'Overall the teacher want every student to be successful in the class. Therefore they provide any step to help you learn and understand the class.', "If I could restart my high school years, I would certainly attend my high school again. The reason behind this is because the academics, the diversity, the community spirit, and the faculty support. Academically, the school has great courses, that  not only are made to be interesting, but also challenging. Each student is offered a variety of courses that allow them to work hard and challenge their minds. The school is also extremely diverse in all aspects of that statement. The school has lots of students from various ethnicity's', sexual orientations, financial situations, and genders. Additionally, there is no discrimination against any of the students with physical and/or learning disabilities. Lastly, the CSS community is very accepting and the school pride and spirit is very high. From sporting events, to the annual plays, the students, parents, and faculty are very involved. Similarly, the clubs and electives the school offers, also have a very high rate of student involvement. Lastly, the support offered by the teachers is amazing. The teachers know each of their students by name and make themselves available on countless opportunities. Moreover, the teachers also keep up with the students to ensure that in the future if they need anything the teacher is available to help them.  All in all, the atmosphere of the school as a whole is amazing and I would recommend it to anyone.", 'The teachers at Columbia Secondary School are very engaging and caring. For the most part, the teachers are open to helping students who appear to be struggling in their course. Additionally, the faculty is kind and always attempt to make the learning experience and interesting and informative as possible. They also take extra time out of their days to ensure that all students are on the same page and understand the material. Furthermore, the students feel comfortable and confident in the classroom because the teachers create a safe and exciting environment.']

column1: NYC Lab High School for Collaborative Studies
column2: ['I am a new freshman so I have only been here for about a month. I chose Lab over a specialized school because of the sense of community and I have not been disappointed. What makes Lab unique is that there are great academics but that is not all. The teachers are incredible, the best part of Lab in my opinion. I feel connected to all of my teachers already. Most of the sports teams are good and there are great club options. The one thing I would say is there is little diversity and it is a bit cliquey. All in all, I love Lab!', 'NYC Lab School was the very foundation that helped me discover who I was and who I wanted. With teachers that feel more like family, and courses that truly challenge you, Lab is beyond an exemplary example of what high school should consist of. If you were ever falling behind, you had teachers who reached out and always offered the utmost support. There was an endless amount of opportunities offered at Lab, and I regret not taking advantage of them all. If you do decide to make the best academic and social decision of your life possible, please utilize everything this amazing institution brings to the table. You will truly miss it when its over.', "NYC Lab School is what you make of it, if you are a driven and passionate student it will give you the resources you need to make your dreams come true. I personally know two students who dreamt of going to Princeton and Harvard, both of those dreams came true. But, some students want everything to be done for them and blame the school for their own personal lack of advancement. So it's more self-motivated. The downsides are that it's a small school and the microcosmic nature of it can make small issues seem larger than they are. Also sometimes student input for changes aren't always entertained.", 'It’s a school with a lot of diversity and they really value education and being together as a community. Also they show a lot of respect towards students and races/diversity.', 'NYC lab high school was amazing. Even though I have graduated from here, I have made some life time friends. The education I received here was great. The support system in this school is something I will never forget.', "PROS: ~supportive community~liberal school ~amazing teachers ~college prep/advisory is great ~freshmen can get lunch outside of schoolCONS:~bathrooms are out of order. gotta head upstairs to the middle school or use the one's downstairs.~clubs don't get much funding. bake sales hardly contribute much.~school lunch is atrocious.", "Nyc Lab Collaborative High school lives up to it's name as it pushes the overarching agenda in it's schools about collaborative with others, and working through a problem, while this may sound cheesy, many students benefit from this as these ideas encompassed by the school give students and idea of what direction to head in life and what values to hold true to. Getting into the school itself, Lab is not very academically challenging, classes are up to par with NYC DOE standards, however when it comes to preparing students for college, Lab gives students all the resources they need in order to succeed and move on in life.", 'Great focus on collaboration and inclusiveness. Encourages students to voice their opinions. Very centered on student ideas.', 'The teachers are amazing! Everyone really cares about you and Lab is such a welcoming environment.  I just wish they prepared me more for college!', 'Growing up in New York, as we all know, is competitive. When I was applying to high schools, many of my peers viewed Lab as lesser and thus, I entered viewing it as such. I complained about receiving little to no homework freshman year when peers at other schools had hours of work. I complained about not feeling challenged in English and History. I complained about my commute. Yet by the end of sophomore year, I was finally able to see Lab for what it is: a hidden gem among stereotypical competitive high schools. While the students at Lab are competitive, it wasn\'t cutthroat; many resources were provided to ensure we were "in touch" with our feelings and properly managing our stress levels. Due to what I perceived to be some of the downfalls of Lab, I was able to supplement my four years with unique experiences and opportunities, which provided for a college application that won me acceptances at multiple top 20 schools. No school is ever a perfect fit - its up to you to make it work.', "Great staff is always there for you...you'd definitely be able to find someone to talk to. The Holls implements discipline that you'll see yourself using during and after hs. It's a free and welcoming atmosphere. Very unique not like mmay other schools in the city. The teachers care to give you the best of what they know. Loved every bit of it", 'It was an average school with a unique environment. I went to Lab middle school as well but the academics were more rigorous there.', "Overall I believe that NYC Lab High School for Collaborative Studies is a great school,  I feel you can't share your political views. I would have liked to see a wider variety of classes to take and to have to option to choose which ones. I loved all the sports that were offered but bowling or even a ski team would have been nice to be apart of if it were to be offered by the school.", "Overall, Lab is a decent school. It's not that diverse in terms of race and socio-economic status, but the academics are amazing and the teachers are very supportive. Socially, though, Lab is not the best. There are many cliques that form pretty quickly so it can be difficult to find where you fit in within a limited amount of time. The seniors at Lab get into some incredible and prestigious colleges, and students at Lab are prepared for the college application process from the start!", 'My experience has been fantastic, I have grown not only as a scholar but as an individual. Through the power of collaboration I was able to find a community that helped me reach my full potential and made sure that I would be able to enter the world as a fully alive global citizen.', "There is no other place like Lab. The minute you walk through the doors, you know that there is a community that cares about you. The teachers want you to succeed and will do anything in their power to help you. Lab is a relatively small school, and that's why I love it. You get to know all of your classmates and those in other grades! Lab also has special days where we appreciate other cultures, celebrate each other, and create awareness on important topics. Students are also welcome to host assemblies if they feel like there is an issue that needs to be talked about. Recently, we had our first Environmental Film Festival. The entire school watched documentaries and discussed how pollution is impacting our world and what we can do to prevent it. Things like this make me realize that I can't imagine going to another school besides Lab.", 'I made my best friends in Lab. I am grateful that there was a staff that looks over your college process and revises your essays. The one downsides should be noted, there are some teachers who are clearly  choosing the easy way out, teaching wise. I have had classes where we sat there and copied the textbook down in our notes word for word and took quizzes on the information every week.', 'I had a wonderful four years experience in this school where I learned how to be independent, trust myself, and not give up even when I lose hope. I couldn’t do it without the supportive and inspiring teachers, staffs and students as a whole. I love the wide range of clubs and sports- you could open a club even if you are a freshman. We also celebrate AIDS day, Pridefest, Sports Day and Spirit Week which is very informative and fun. However, I believe there isn’t much diversity in this school as it could have been. There’s lack of South Asian, African American and Hispanic students. I also believe the Advanced Placement (AP) classes doesn’t prepare us to be fully confident to take the AP tests. I also believe we aren’t prepared well in advance upon how to deal with the college process. I am in the middle of college process and I feel extremely lost: I don’t know which college to apply.', 'I think that the extracurriculars could be better, the only extracurricular that are very known are athletics and Lab theater company.', 'I had an overall great experience at NYC Lab, this school prepared me for the challenges that I was going to face in college. Especially the habits, while in high school I thought that they were just things that were said to us, but during my first year in college I found myself doing certain things and remembering Brooke Jackson, the principal, speaking of how the habits will be useful to us.']

Especially the habits, while in high school I thought that they were just things that were said to us, but during my first year in college I found myself doing certain things and remembering Brooke Jackson, the principal, speaking of how the habits will be useful to us.']
column6: ['The teachers at NYC Lab  are very approachable, they genuinely care for the success and well being for the student.', 'Everyone in the school is very nice in general, they can be rude but in general things go well.', 'I am able to learn a lot in this school, but there are some more advancements they can take.', 'this school is very diverse, and includes everyone in every activity we do.', 'There are variety of extracurricular activities available from art clubs, gay straight alliance club, music clubs to playing a sport. Everyone is proud to be apart of their club or organization and loves to show off their school spirit.', 'The overall experience at this school is great. There is a great atmosphere and everyone is very understandable and accepting and always there for you. The education is great and the amount of extracurricular activities, athletic or non athletic, are available and fun.', "Majority of the teachers are amazing at this school, but there are some that are hard to approach and don't respectfully listen to you. But overall, everyone is great. The security guards, the hall monitors, and especially the principal.", "There are TONS of extracurriculars here at lab. I don't know a single person who isn't involved with at least one.", "I've never regretted attending Lab. The environment is great for new and old students alike. It's a small school so it's easy to make friends. The only real problem I've had is juggling my AP classes with extracurriculars.", 'The best thing about my school is the student-teacher relationships. All of my teachers are adults that I can come to about not only just class related things but about advice outside of school or to just strike up a conversation. My school also has a program called Office Hours, where students can come in before school starts and receive help with any homework assignments or ask questions about the class material.', "Some of the choices made for courses/grading in the past were not the best, but overall, the school has excellent educators. The teachers are generally fair in grading and liberally allow for make-up testing, late homework submissions, with minor penalties.\r The one course as noted above was a core AP class, which used an experiemental approach to grading (based on skill building), which proved to be an abject failure and hurt students' grades in their crucial junior year. Parents and students were up in arms about it and the course curriculum was changed this year.", 'The school building is in need of some repairs, since the building is not in great shape; especially, the bathrooms and the courtyard, which are functional, but pretty horrible esthetically.', 'A really terrific school, NYC LAB Collaborative HS cares about their students. It starts with the principal - who is wonderful - caring, smart, nurturing and highly approachable. Most of the teachers are very knowledgable, giving to their students and open to all opinions - and so are the amazing guidance counselors. Fueled by a terrific PA group, LAB is a unique school that believes in the spirit and power of collaboration, community and their kids. We are so happy we chose this school for our daughter in the heart of Chelsea in ûberfantastic New York City!', 'When I was at Lab, whenever students entered the building, they had to swipe their student IDs. There were security staff manning the machines the students swiped in at. The students entered from a different entry than other visitors. Whenever other visitors came, they had to sign in at the front desk with a security guard.', "There are a lot of clubs, but most meetings are during lunch periods during the school day. There aren't many after-school activities, but you will still see students in the halls after the school day is over. They are either in one of the few extra-curricular activities that meets after school (theater), or working on a project/getting homework help.", "The people at Lab are really nice and friendly. It isn't like how high school is typically portrayed in movies where people are bullied or miserable. Since it is a relatively small school (I had a graduating class of about 125), everyone in my grade knew just about everyone else. The one drawback would be the lack of diversity of AP classes at Lab, and how they aren't taken as seriously as they should be (especially looking back for college credit).", "The teachers here are great. I feel that they truly care about the students, and they'll remember you even after you have taken their classes. Their teaching styles are unique, but they try their bests to engage students in their work. There are a lot of projects, which helps students better understand the materials they are learning.", 'Health and safety at this school is great. Were not one of the schools that people outside the school try to mess with at all probably because we are not poor. The only two unhealthy things in our school is how disgusting our bathrooms are, which apparently in the next year or two were getting replaced, and anything the kids do to themselves not influenced by anyone else.', "The extracurriculars at this school are great. We have many options to choose from like student government, model united nation, cheerleading, a multitude of sports, and a bunch of other clubs in all different types of fields. I don't know much about the ones that cost money (if there even are some) but all the clubs get a lot of the money they need from the school, and if they need more we can hold bake sales or similar things to get more money for the club. Also if there is a club that a student wants to start all they need to do is fill out out a form, find a teacher to lead it, and then put up posters around the school to get other students to join.", "I really love this school because they don't expect that you can work constantly under a huge amount of pressure for every class. This school takes in the emotional aspect of your life too and they understand if your going through a hard tim and need an extension on an assignment. Also teachers of the same grades or ones with many students shared try to collaborate so that any major tests and assignments are not due for multiple classes at the same time so kids wont have to stress. The reason I did not give the school a five out of five is because it is a collaborative school but they don't implement that for the students assignments and general work very well, they still do it better than other schools though."]
column8: ['The teachers at NYC Lab  are very approachable, they genuinely care for the success and well being for the student.', 'Everyone in the school is very nice in general, they can be rude but in general things go well.', 'I am able to learn a lot in this school, but there are some more advancements they can take.', 'this school is very diverse, and includes everyone in every activity we do.', 'There are variety of extracurricular activities available from art clubs, gay straight alliance club, music clubs to playing a sport. Everyone is proud to be apart of their club or organization and loves to show off their school spirit.', 'The overall experience at this school is great. There is a great atmosphere and everyone is very understandable and accepting and always there for you. The education is great and the amount of extracurricular activities, athletic or non athletic, are available and fun.', "Majority of the teachers are amazing at this school, but there are some that are hard to approach and don't respectfully listen to you. But overall, everyone is great. The security guards, the hall monitors, and especially the principal.", "There are TONS of extracurriculars here at lab. I don't know a single person who isn't involved with at least one.", "I've never regretted attending Lab. The environment is great for new and old students alike. It's a small school so it's easy to make friends. The only real problem I've had is juggling my AP classes with extracurriculars.", 'The best thing about my school is the student-teacher relationships. All of my teachers are adults that I can come to about not only just class related things but about advice outside of school or to just strike up a conversation. My school also has a program called Office Hours, where students can come in before school starts and receive help with any homework assignments or ask questions about the class material.', "Some of the choices made for courses/grading in the past were not the best, but overall, the school has excellent educators. The teachers are generally fair in grading and liberally allow for make-up testing, late homework submissions, with minor penalties.\r The one course as noted above was a core AP class, which used an experiemental approach to grading (based on skill building), which proved to be an abject failure and hurt students' grades in their crucial junior year. Parents and students were up in arms about it and the course curriculum was changed this year.", 'The school building is in need of some repairs, since the building is not in great shape; especially, the bathrooms and the courtyard, which are functional, but pretty horrible esthetically.', 'A really terrific school, NYC LAB Collaborative HS cares about their students. It starts with the principal - who is wonderful - caring, smart, nurturing and highly approachable. Most of the teachers are very knowledgable, giving to their students and open to all opinions - and so are the amazing guidance counselors. Fueled by a terrific PA group, LAB is a unique school that believes in the spirit and power of collaboration, community and their kids. We are so happy we chose this school for our daughter in the heart of Chelsea in ûberfantastic New York City!', 'When I was at Lab, whenever students entered the building, they had to swipe their student IDs. There were security staff manning the machines the students swiped in at. The students entered from a different entry than other visitors. Whenever other visitors came, they had to sign in at the front desk with a security guard.', "There are a lot of clubs, but most meetings are during lunch periods during the school day. There aren't many after-school activities, but you will still see students in the halls after the school day is over. They are either in one of the few extra-curricular activities that meets after school (theater), or working on a project/getting homework help.", "The people at Lab are really nice and friendly. It isn't like how high school is typically portrayed in movies where people are bullied or miserable. Since it is a relatively small school (I had a graduating class of about 125), everyone in my grade knew just about everyone else. The one drawback would be the lack of diversity of AP classes at Lab, and how they aren't taken as seriously as they should be (especially looking back for college credit).", "The teachers here are great. I feel that they truly care about the students, and they'll remember you even after you have taken their classes. Their teaching styles are unique, but they try their bests to engage students in their work. There are a lot of projects, which helps students better understand the materials they are learning.", 'Health and safety at this school is great. Were not one of the schools that people outside the school try to mess with at all probably because we are not poor. The only two unhealthy things in our school is how disgusting our bathrooms are, which apparently in the next year or two were getting replaced, and anything the kids do to themselves not influenced by anyone else.', "The extracurriculars at this school are great. We have many options to choose from like student government, model united nation, cheerleading, a multitude of sports, and a bunch of other clubs in all different types of fields. I don't know much about the ones that cost money (if there even are some) but all the clubs get a lot of the money they need from the school, and if they need more we can hold bake sales or similar things to get more money for the club. Also if there is a club that a student wants to start all they need to do is fill out out a form, find a teacher to lead it, and then put up posters around the school to get other students to join.", "I really love this school because they don't expect that you can work constantly under a huge amount of pressure for every class. This school takes in the emotional aspect of your life too and they understand if your going through a hard tim and need an extension on an assignment. Also teachers of the same grades or ones with many students shared try to collaborate so that any major tests and assignments are not due for multiple classes at the same time so kids wont have to stress. The reason I did not give the school a five out of five is because it is a collaborative school but they don't implement that for the students assignments and general work very well, they still do it better than other schools though."]

column2: ['I like how everyone is so friendly here. No bullying is welcome, and is driven out. Everybody is so welcoming to new students and has a very well academic system. The teachers are very helpful and teach very well and thoroughly. It is a great highschool to attend to, overall.', 'Fair Lawn High school was a very safe school. It opened my eyes academically through learning such advanced lessons and topics compared to those high schools around me were teaching. While I loved the education I received, the food and environment was not so great. The food was very bad and the bathrooms would stink up all the hallways.', 'Fair Lawn High School offers a warm and welcoming environment. With great academic  and extracurricular opportunities, the possibilities are limitless.', 'Fair Lawn has a high-quality arts program that allows students to get involved and grow in extraordinary ways. There are plenty of clubs and opportunities to grow there.', ':) :)                                                                                                                                                                                                              :)                                                                                                                          :)                                                                                                                    :)', 'Fair Lawn High School is a welcoming environment that provides us, students, with many great opportunities that will help our futures. Plans and activities are constantly being made to help get students involved in activities inside and outside of the school. Our town is very privileged which is a blessing, but I do not think that enough of us are aware of how lucky we are to live in a town like ours with staff and programs dedicated to helping us grow and succeed.', "Fair Lawn is pretty good. The teachers are great, but extracurriculars could improve a bit. The guidance department is very helpful and there's no bullying I can think of.", "Fair Lawn High School is overall a good school. Some of the teachers go out of their way to make sure you fully understand lessons and the class. However, there is a handful that does not have daily lessons or plans or they are do not truly care about teaching and can be disrespectful to students. Most of them will be understanding of you and how you learn, but there is always a chance that you will get a teacher who does not care about their students or who do not know how to teach at a high school level. However, through clubs and sports, you'll find teachers and coaches who really strive to see you succeed and push you to your highest potential. Fair Lawn High School has lost a sense of school culture and a lot of times fails to embrace the school spirit. There should an increase in fun activities for students during the day, such as assemblies.", "It is pretty good and I have been in the Student Government for 4 years. I am currently the President. There are plenty of good teachers and a very strong academic program. On the extra-curricular side, it is strong too. However, I think what can improve would be the athletics program and the fact that we don't have a homecoming dance.", "It's been a great several years here at Fair Lawn High School. I have been given the opportunity to learn many new things and become involved in excellent academic, athletic, and extracurricular programs.", 'The school is accepting, has an incredible amount of extracurriculars, and has good academics. This a school that feels like home. Overall, I have had a pleasant experience here.', 'I like the community  at Fair Lawn High School. I am always surrounded be kind, caring, and amazing people. Everyone is always willing to help and make your time at school easier.', 'There are many clubs and sports available at this school. This school also has a great student government Teachers are willing to help you understand the material after school.', 'The academics are pretty good for the honors students. Otherwise, the high school is probably similar to the average high school with nothing too amazing or traumatic.', "I've enjoyed my years at Fair Lawn High School. A lot of the staff is great, and I always feel willing to go to them whenever I need help understanding an assignment. A lot of the after-school activities are very fun, and they do their best to make sure the students enjoy themselves.My biggest complaint is that they make you schedule classes before the year is even halfway over, and they give a month where you can switch afterwards. I believe that students must be in the classroom to get a feel if they should stay in the class or not.Other than how they handle schedules, I believe that Fair Lawn High School is a very good school that provides students with many different options in terms of classes and other ways that they can egt involved.", 'Fair Lawn High School is a good school because it is academically challenging and prepares students for college. It also is very diverse and has many different ways to get involved besides academic. There are a lot of sports and clubs for everyone to join.', 'I like how there are many clubs to choose from and my only complaint is that the food is not the best and there are not many options for vegetarians/ vegans. Many of the teachers here are great and truly care about the students acedamic success.', 'Fair Lawn High School has a staff and administration that truly care about the well-being of their students. Not only do they guide us through our classes and our future, but they also maintain our safety and attend to us to the best of their abilities. From the principal to the janitors, regardless of their roles, all the staff and administration undoubtedly provide us with the best circumstances. I only wish other students could appreciate it as much as they should.', 'I love how Fair Lawn High School offers a variety of interesting class for all areas of expertise, whether you are in CP, Honor or AP classes. Also, the several athletics programs are definitely a rewarding part of high school and teach you teamwork and leadership skills that are valuable for the future. Lastly, there are many amazing clubs to join that are fun and can definitely boost your college application. Overall, Fair Lawn High School is a great school that teaches students the academics and the fundamentals to being an active part of society.', "You get a typical public high school education and are generally well prepared for college. They offer a lot of AP's, so if you put effort in you can make the experience more worthwhile."]

column6: ['Fair lawn high school is a very good school because it’s safe and fun and there’s a lot of diversity amongst student nationality and races the teachers are poor in my opionion however. Your success can determine which teacher you get... some are easygoing young and fun and will give you a good grade for a lot less work and stress than getting another teacher. In addition a lot of teacher pick favorites and will give extra credit to those students. And finally there are just some teachers who are very bad with kids and teaching and should not be teachers. The Adminstration must do a better job at picking their staff for the future.', 'Location is great because it is walking distance to River Road where there are a few places to go out for lunch. On top of that, those who drive can easily get onto the main highway where there are promenades. About the teachers, there seems to be a mix. There are very few who have a passion for teaching and educating their students, few who teach well but hate what they do, many who are subpar at teaching but generally have an okay attitude, and some who hate teaching and have the worst attitude. So overall, the teachers are okay. The best janitors! So friendly and helpful.', 'I really like the classes and most of my teachers. Some teachers don’t seem to care much about the students but that is found at every school. There are a lot of club options and sports are pretty important. The one big thing I wish I could change is how unexcited everyone is when it comes to school events.', "It tastes good. Very very good. There's a lot of umami. You can taste the chef's love. The amount of soul put into it is incredible. Lots of attention to detail. Very very nice.", 'The fair lawn experience is very good. The teachers are excellent at teaching their subjects and are very supportive of the students', 'A fairly good public school where how much effort you put in will determine where you will be placed academically. Some teachers are questionable in their ability, but for the most part, teachers do their jobs to a degree of acceptability. If the student puts their foot forward to learn, most teachers will reciprocate it back.', 'Fair Lawn High school is an average suburban high school. It excels in sports and clubs, with the school having over one hundred clubs and afterschool activities. On the other hand, the school is average in academics. The school provides a handful of A.P courses and a number of honor courses. The teachers and staff are friendly, and are reliable.', 'Fair Lawn High School is and overall great school. There are countless clubs, sports, and activities to participate in. And, as an AP and honors student, there were plenty of classes for me to choose from to pursue my interests.', "Fair Lawn High School is an amazing school with very few flaws. Great academics and a very large extracurricular program makes this school a place for learning and fun. As a recognized school of excellence and consistently ranking high among New Jersey public high schools there is not much left to desire. It's all wrapped up by excellent school spirit and sports teams and a student government association that is so good other schools come in the watch how we operate.", 'Although there are some teachers that are absolutely horrible, my overall experience in terms of academics have been positive. There are plenty of teachers willing to help students-some going so far as to sacrifice time outside of office hours to do so-and many opportunities to improve academics are offered.', "This school has an increasing amount of clubs that fits every student's interests, and it is easy to make one if you are unable to find one that suits you. Many members of the faculty are incredible people and often grade fairly. However, many faculty members are hired based upon just their education level, but when in a classroom environment, prove to have a lack of understanding in the subject they teach and clearly play favorites which influences their grading systems.", 'My overall experience attending Fair Lawn High School is very good. I liked being involved in sports when I was and there is a club for everyone. The teachers at the school are good and very supportive. There is not anything that jumps out at me that Fair Lawn High School needs to change.', 'Fair Lawn High School provides students with readily available resources to further pursue their educational goals along with desired careers in the most optimal and efficient manner.', 'Fair Lawn High School offers great academic programs and education to young students. It provides good teachers for each subject, as well as subjects that will provide an insight into the future.', 'FLHS is a good school overall but it has its flaws. It is hard to move into honors math if you are not already on the honors track. Some classes are geared toward passing the tests and just passing the class. FLHS has terrible food but  upperclassman and sophomores can leave the grounds for lunch. FLHS offers a lot of art classes they have a Mac lab, a 3D printer, many great field trips, great band, great drama club, they have a duel enrollment program to get college credit as a senior, they have a middle college credit program, they have a lot of clubs that sponser events and field trips, all kinds of honor societies , EF tour trips available for students to go on during breaks, scholarships that they offer to seniors, a lot of sports teams and a wide variety of classes to take.  At the end of the day FLHS is what you make of it, you can get as involved as you want or you can detach yourself from school as much as you want too.', 'Great music and theater program. Some quality teachers that I will always thank, others not so much. Great support from faculty.', 'There are lots of reasons why I really like Fair Lawn High School. I like how well all the staff and teachers prepare you for college and the academics are great. I also really like how many after-school activities including clubs and sports are available to the students. There are probably about one hundred clubs that you could join, where you get to have lots of fun and make new friends as well. I also feel very safe in the school, as their are cameras everywhere and we even have a police officer that stays at our school to make sure we are safe.', "High school wasn't my favorite place, but Fair Lawn High School has great teachers, strong academics, and many opportunities.", "Fair Lawn High School is a very good school that offers a lot of clubs, sports teams, etc. The teachers help to prepare you for the future, care about how you are doing in their classes, encourage you to do the best of your abilities, as well as take into consideration that you have other classes to worry about. The school provides various amounts  of extracurricular activities that help include everyone's interest.", 'Fair Lawn High School has treated their students with great respect and care. They allow their students to express themselves with a multitude of after school activities, including music, performing arts, debating, academic competitions, and a variety of sports. Their college preparation from their guidance department is stellar. They give students a multitude of resources for college applying, standard test taking, and scholarship applying.']
