column2: ['The diverse atmosphere of Yorktown High School is what makes it so refreshing. There are many different cultures and ethnicities present, creating an entire learning experience just from meeting new people. The wide array of extracurricular activities and clubs available enriches students, allowing for higher learning and social experiences outside of the classroom. Also, the teachers are certainly qualified and are passionate about their jobs, creating a desire within students to succeed. It is a warm and welcoming community, breeding success and a substantial education for all.', 'The school is very great. The campus is beautiful and the teachers are focused on making sure that you pass! I would like for there to be more diversity and maybe a small improvement in the food quality.', 'My experience was extremely good at Yorktown high school. The past 4 years have flown by in such ana amazing way.', 'Academically, an amazing school. However, My friend has been getting bullied for a almost two years. She eventually dropped out of this school and took online classes due to the lack of punishment and care for the bullying going on. If you want to be safe, or if you want your kids to be safe and happy, I’d recommend to not come here.', "Academically, there are a plethora of challenging classes for students to take, and it is very easy to register for these classes. The majority of the teachers are both kind and intelligent, and can teach their courses at a very high level. They are also quite understanding and receptive when students need extra help or they need to make up work. There are various clubs and sports for people to participate in, and there's a high emphasis on extracurriculars in the school community. As a whole, I feel it has prepared me very well for college.", 'Yorktown High school is the perfect school. Moving from Yonkers to Yorktown was eyeopening. The resources are excellent and the availability of staff to help or support students is remarkable.', 'Yorktown High School is a great place to be. The staff and students are very welcoming and friendly, and no one feels out of place.', "The campus was quite dull. They used most of the money for irrelevant things such as bean bags in the library which they ended up removing only a few months later (btw we still need air conditioners). There was a garden which had withering flowers and a gigantic clock tower that the school enclosed and it was an eyesore. Parking is horrible. But despite all of that, YHS has some of the best teachers you will ever find. Now by best I definitely mean personality wise--um teaching is so so. They hired some thirty year old guy that reuses powerpoint presentations from the very first time he ever started teaching. Yeah... you can already tell he's not that good of a teacher. But because of how approachable many of the teachers where, I have many memorable experiences with them and they definitely will help you because they will never leave their students behind.", "My experience here is going great. All the teachers are open  to the students and are able to provide help because they have that connection. The faculty is amazing and are very kind. This school is very safe and secure and I have no worries going to school here. The food is great, especially since it's coming from school.", 'YHS has wonderful academic opportunities. Many of the teachers are absolutely fantastic, however, the student body can make it a difficult place to find where you fit in. There are so many different cliques that making new friends can be extremely difficult. Overall, though, the school provides great academic and athletic opportunities.', "I absolutely love all of the staff at Yorktown High School as they strive to help all students achieve their goals and dreams so they can be successful after High School. They truly care about all of their students here at Yorktown High School and they stay after school every day to help their students. The only thing I want to see change is bullying prevention. I don't see students get bullied as much anymore but when I do see it, I think to myself that this should not be going on still. Students need to be reminded about random acts of kindness.", 'What I liked the most about YHS are the teachers and the vast amount of electives there are to chose from. One thing that has been a problem for several years is the lack of student parking spots.', 'While attending Yorktown high school I was very involved with sports. I had a lot of fun with lacrosse and track and field. I enjoyed the library and the faculty that worked there. The environment was nice and easy access to books. The history department were so nice and truly made the subject fun and easy to learn.', "Yorktown High School was a great experience for me. I had lots of great teachers and met many great people there.  There was always something going on that kept people busy and just not sick of school.  Some of the administrators weren't that great and they definitely could have handled some situations better that occurred during my time there.", "Yorktown High School is close to the center of the town of Yorktown. It is very safe, over the years new rules have been put in place. Students are watched closely, but at the same time given freedom. Sports teams are excellent, and often win, or almost win, section titles. Teachers overall are good, except a few who are known to be awful. Clean, decent food, many options in the cafeteria. Friendly administration. Not very diverse, but Westchester isn't in general. Nearly all students go to college after YHS, not going is considered odd. There are many resources during your junior and senior year to help with the college process. Lots of clubs and opportunities for everyone in sports, music, etc.", 'I loved seeing friends everyday and the lessons that were learned I will carry with me for my entire life. The school was full of spirit which made every sporting event a blast!', 'The teachers were overall pretty good. I must say that my teachers got progressively better each year.', "Great teachers, great academics, and a great educational experience. One extreme flaw is the lack of freedom students have. We were not allowed to leave campus or walk in the hallways 5 minutes after the period begins. Want to go to the library after eating lunch? You're not allowed to.", 'Yorktown High School has offered me a wonderful education experience with plenty of opportunities to excell. It is a vert welcoming and engagging environment witha principal and guidance counselors that have nothing but smiles on their faces.', 'As a student attending YHS, I can confidently say that I am proud to be a husker.  YHS is where I\'ve built lifelong memories and friends, all while maintain an "A" average (which will look great to colleges). We have top tier sports programs, especially in Lacrosse (even if I am not athletic), uplifting our school spirit. Our science research program (which I have been so lucky to be a part of) dominates in county/local competition and has enabled many bright young minds to present research on the international level. Yes there will be exceptions, but in general the teachers are great. I feel as though I am treated as an adult (and friend) by many of the teachers. The student body is very friendly and clearly mature. I can only say the same things about the remaining staff and administration. Overall, I love YHS and couldn\'t imagine my life in any other school district!']
column4: ['The diverse atmosphere of Yorktown High School is what makes it so refreshing. There are many different cultures and ethnicities present, creating an entire learning experience just from meeting new people. The wide array of extracurricular activities and clubs available enriches students, allowing for higher learning and social experiences outside of the classroom. Also, the teachers are certainly qualified and are passionate about their jobs, creating a desire within students to succeed. It is a warm and welcoming community, breeding success and a substantial education for all.', 'The school is very great. The campus is beautiful and the teachers are focused on making sure that you pass! I would like for there to be more diversity and maybe a small improvement in the food quality.', 'My experience was extremely good at Yorktown high school. The past 4 years have flown by in such ana amazing way.', 'Academically, an amazing school. However, My friend has been getting bullied for a almost two years. She eventually dropped out of this school and took online classes due to the lack of punishment and care for the bullying going on. If you want to be safe, or if you want your kids to be safe and happy, I’d recommend to not come here.', "Academically, there are a plethora of challenging classes for students to take, and it is very easy to register for these classes. The majority of the teachers are both kind and intelligent, and can teach their courses at a very high level. They are also quite understanding and receptive when students need extra help or they need to make up work. There are various clubs and sports for people to participate in, and there's a high emphasis on extracurriculars in the school community. As a whole, I feel it has prepared me very well for college.", 'Yorktown High school is the perfect school. Moving from Yonkers to Yorktown was eyeopening. Students need to be reminded about random acts of kindness.", 'What I liked the most about YHS are the teachers and the vast amount of electives there are to chose from. I must say that my teachers got progressively better each year.', "Great teachers, great academics, and a great educational experience. One extreme flaw is the lack of freedom students have. We were not allowed to leave campus or walk in the hallways 5 minutes after the period begins. Want to go to the library after eating lunch? You're not allowed to.", 'Yorktown High School has offered me a wonderful education experience with plenty of opportunities to excell. YHS is where I\'ve built lifelong memories and friends, all while maintain an "A" average (which will look great to colleges). We have top tier sports programs, especially in Lacrosse (even if I am not athletic), uplifting our school spirit. Our science research program (which I have been so lucky to be a part of) dominates in county/local competition and has enabled many bright young minds to present research on the international level. Yes there will be exceptions, but in general the teachers are great. I feel as though I am treated as an adult (and friend) by many of the teachers. The student body is very friendly and clearly mature. I can only say the same things about the remaining staff and administration. Overall, I love YHS and couldn\'t imagine my life in any other school district!']
column6: ['YHS is a good school with solid academics. Teachers are a hit or miss but for advanced courses they are good and prepare you for exams/APs. Many people participate in sports as football and lacrosse are the most prominent teams. Nonetheless, there are many other sports and clubs to get involved.', 'Good teachers, high-level courses if you want them. Overall, nice atmosphere. Good sized school, with about 300 per grade, so not too big or too small. Very sports focused, but still good emphasis on education.', "I think my high school teachers were absolutely amazing, but may I just got lucky. They're so genuine in caring about their students -- they all want you to do well!", 'Good variety of clubs and activities available', 'Great programs and clubs, and high quality of education', 'Most of the teachers have a great attitude and teaching style.', 'to have the extra security is alright however it became difficult when certain door inside the building locked after 3pm when there were still extracurricular activities going on.', 'Dance Company. the Musical, and Science Research are excellent', 'The Yorktown Science Research Program helped my career as it allowed me hands-on experience outside the classroom.', 'Athletics department could use an overhaul or review of practices and procedures for selecting athletes.', 'There are a lot of different clubs at YHS and are very easy to get involved in.  Anyone can create their own club and the staff are always willing to help students out.', "I have really enjoyed my experience at YHS.  I've met so many amazing people and had the chance to participate in endless activities.  I have most enjoyed going to all of the sporting events with my friends and the pep rallies were great.", "Overall, the teachers at YHS are great.  Most of them are very knowledgeable and helpful.  With my experience, I've had some teachers that have taught me lessons beyond the classroom and others that do the bare minimum.  There is rarely a time when a teacher isn't available to stay after school and not be willing to help a student in need.", 'I feel very safe at the school', 'There are many different clubs and organizations students can be part of. There are meetings for clubs almost everyday after school.', 'Some teachers are better than others', 'Teachers are actively engaged with the students. They care about them. And Try to coordinate the teaching methods to help students achieve', "What makes this school unique is that there's so many extra curricular activities to choose from and overall the teachers and parents are very helpful and supportive through every child's education at this school.", 'The overall quality of the teachers at my school is pretty great. They stay after school in order to help struggling students and they genuinely care about the success of their students.', 'For health: the school is very clean, bathrooms are always being wiped down, and the cafeteria follows a health standard. There is a school resource officers on site on all times. There are also drills such as fire and lock down drills in case of emergency. The school itself is very safe and has many teachers such a social workers and school psychologists to help combat any problems such as bullying.']

column2: ['I loved the community of the school. We were very spirited when it came to sports and other activities. The food as alright, if there were more options that would be better. The diversity is very low but it makes sense because of the location of the school. otherwise, it prepared students very well for college.', 'The energy at Ramapo is indescribably amazing. It is a warm safe place with people waiting to greet you at every turn. The students bond and have a tight community that supports one another. They all come together for important things and no school has as much heart as Po.', "Like any high school student, I have had both good and bad experiences at Ramapo. Being an athlete in academically challenging courses, I am not going to say that this school has been easy for me. With large amounts of school work and not very much time to complete it, Ramapo High School has brought some stressful times upon me. However, I wouldn't trade it for any other school in the area. Although recently teachers in the district were unhappy with not having a contract, they didn't let this get in the way of their love of teaching and care for their students. I have also had an amazing experience running for my high school and continue to look forward to the second half of my high school experience.", 'I came to Ramapo with very low expectations, I started the year in October because I had been enrolled in another school at the time and all i wished to do was stay at my old school. The students and staff of Ramapo High School quickly welcomed me. I enrolled in some clubs, but my grades were suffering because of a I was going through difficult time. My teachers and fellow students helped me pick up my grades which helped tremendously. Overall my experience was very good.', "There were excellent academics overall and many of the teachers cared for their students and honestly wanted them to succeed. Has excellent safety and never felt like my safety was ever compromised. There were many resources given to students whether it be data bases, 3-D printers, or after school help with teachers. Technology also plays a huge role and provides an exceptional education and way to connect the school as a whole and privately within classes through schoology. Ramapo is known for it's amazing athletics and students show a lot of school pride. That being said the way that our finals are set up is very stressful on students. The first two marking periods consist of tests or essays while the entire other half is all projects. That means that towards the end of the year you will be doing a lot of projects with similar deadlines at the same time as opposed to spanning it out between the year.", "I moved during my sophomore year to Ramapo High School.  It is certainly extremely rigorous, but the teachers are very understanding and helpful.  There are numerous activities to get involved in, and the cafeteria would absolutely surpass any one's expectations in terms of food.  The diversity is definitely lacking, but they are welcoming overall.  I enjoy going to Ramapo!", 'I enjoyed the student body at Ramapo high school everyone treated everyone equally and respected each other.I enjoyed all the choices I had from clubs to sports to academics.', 'I enjoyed my time at Ramapo, especially my senior year. There was always a lot to do, whether it was activities in class or extracurriculars outside of school. I liked most of my teachers, the students were okay, and most of my classes went very well.', 'Though the student population was a bit pretentious, there was an abundance of school spirit. The academics are rigorous but many fun and educational electives are offered as well!', 'The atmosphere of the school is always positive. Athletics here are among the best in New Jersey. Almost all our sports compete for state championships each year. Academics can be tough for those who challenge themselves. however, teachers are always willing to stay after class and help out. Overall, an amazing high school', "Great school for athletics and academics. Very competitive, everyone's just trying to get a leg up for college. Was a much more spirited environment when previous Principal Dr.Moore was here.", "Ramapo High School serves a very affluent area, and so the tax money goes towards developing good programs like the sports, clubs, and keeping the technology updated. I find that even though I didn't like the people there (very preppy people), the school itself offered a good education with many options for AP classes to help prepare for college and help earn college credit.", 'Ramapo High School is a regional high school that offers a program known as the University Engineering Program. Having participated in this program as freshmen, I have experienced all that this school as to offer in terms of their academics and extracurriculars. The school while driven to being an academic environment is heavily involved in sports. The football and soccer teams, in particular, receive a lot of attention due to their performances. The academics certainly exist but are not outstanding. School spirit is definitely prevalent as many if not all students are proud to be attending the high school.', 'A great school with good school spirt and academics. Most teachers are very good at what they do and make the classes interesting.  A lot of homework your first three years but then senior year it tapers off.', 'Ramapo High School was a challenging four years. As a senior, I recommend for upcoming freshmen to be yourself, work hard, and challenge yourself everyday. Dedication is important for academics, sports, clubs and everything that encircles this great foundation of education. Sports are fantastic, the clubs are immensely creative and continuously growing and the student involvement is over the top with school spirit.', 'Ramapo is a great learning environment to push yourself academically and to get involved in extra ciricular activities.', 'Ramapo is a great school filled with great students and teachers. I loved my experience at Ramapo and would not change a single thing. All teachers are caring and want you to do your best.', 'I have really enjoyed my high school years at Ramapo. I feel that I have learned so much and are very prepared for college.', 'Very well-prepared for collegeLots of student involvement (clubs, volunteering, theater, sports teams)Diverse course offerings', 'Ramapo High School is a good school with overall good people. There are a lot of different classes, and the teachers are good.']

column6: ['Ramapo High School provided me with all the tools and resources needed to grow academically and personally. Everyone from my teachers and coaches all the way to the custodial staff were always caring and willing to help me succeed.', 'The school has a great education system overall, but lacks diversity. In the future I would like to see a Ramapo including all races and being accepting to all. There is a large divide between those of other races and the majority of Caucasions. Even some teachers end up saying racial slurs without even realize it.  There is no diversity in finances as well. There is a handful of people that do not meet the typical "rich kid"quota and are excluded from the general population. I want to see a more accepting Ramapo in the future.', 'The safety in Ramapo is great.', 'Ramapo has very good extracurriculars. The students and teachers work together to create opportunities and fun for all.', 'A large amount of the parents are very involved and make sure their kids get what they need.', 'The teachers are very great. They are always willing to help the students and make sure they understand what they are learning.', 'There has been no threats to security.', 'There is an after-school activity for everybody', 'I have never had a bad teacher during my 4 years.', "Extracurricular activities are very competitive and take over our school. You have to have a high level of commitment when participating in these activities. It consumes a lot do time and effort. Most of the time, you don't have enough time for school work. Our sports teams are most popular, especially football.", "I liked my experience but it wasn't the best it could be. My school is fun and has spirit but most of the kids are not that nice and only care about themselves. I feel everyone is self centered.", "The teachers are pretty good at my school. they teach well but are very boring with their lessons. They do not really provide real world examples to match the material we are learning. Overall, I wouldn't say the teachers are bad, but they could offer more interesting lessons.", "I always feel safe at my school. I've never been afraid at my school", 'I think there are a lot of activities but people mostly do sports over clubs', "I think a lot of the parents are nice but a lot of them are hard on their kids and argue with teachers over their child's grades", "Overall the teachers are really great. They're nice and engaging. There are some people that are boring or give too much busy work.", "Ramapo has been on a gradual downhill slide in state standing since 2007, per the American Council on Education (ACE) rankings.  My child experiences more problematic issues created by staff and teacher laziness, ineptitude and lack of consistency, on a regular basis, then I can count anymore.  My time in being involved with first teachers, followed on to executive administration on a regular basis for issues caused by teachers and staff, is completely overwhelming to me as a full-time employed single parent.  In EVERY case, the executive administrator (Principal/VP/Head Guidance) agreed with me, and had to fix the problem, when the staffer or teachers were refuting they had fault to fix at all.  The quantity of continuous issues grew beyond my ability to address them all, and my child and other children suffer that.  If a parent isn't engaged at this school, then their child is suffering it.  If every parent were engaged, the executive administration would get nothing done other than fix the problems, because there are so many.  This is a LEADERSHIP issue, first and foremost, and I blame on the Superintendent, and the Principal.  Both good people, but they're not cutting it for there over 1/4 Million Dollar income we pay them.  It didn't used to be this way.  There has been a changing of the guard from the prior generation teachers and administrators between 2007-2011, and it shows!  It is no coincidence that Ramapo has slipped from an ACE ranking of #13 HS District in the state in 2007, to number 30 something in 2015.", 'We have a phenomenal theatre program that is broadway-quality, but less attended than it should be.', 'The majority of our teachers are phenomenal, but a select few loose their temper for poor reasons, have more absences stocked up than their are days in the year, and complain about administration.', 'Ramapo High School is a overall great school and the students here are fortunate enough to have the things that we do here, but there are several aspects that HAVE to be improved.']
column8: ['Ramapo High School provided me with all the tools and resources needed to grow academically and personally. Everyone from my teachers and coaches all the way to the custodial staff were always caring and willing to help me succeed.', 'The school has a great education system overall, but lacks diversity. In the future I would like to see a Ramapo including all races and being accepting to all. There is a large divide between those of other races and the majority of Caucasions. Even some teachers end up saying racial slurs without even realize it.  There is no diversity in finances as well. There is a handful of people that do not meet the typical "rich kid"quota and are excluded from the general population. I want to see a more accepting Ramapo in the future.', 'The safety in Ramapo is great.', 'Ramapo has very good extracurriculars. The students and teachers work together to create opportunities and fun for all.', 'A large amount of the parents are very involved and make sure their kids get what they need.', 'The teachers are very great. They are always willing to help the students and make sure they understand what they are learning.', 'There has been no threats to security.', 'There is an after-school activity for everybody', 'I have never had a bad teacher during my 4 years.', "Extracurricular activities are very competitive and take over our school. You have to have a high level of commitment when participating in these activities. It consumes a lot do time and effort. Most of the time, you don't have enough time for school work. Our sports teams are most popular, especially football.", "I liked my experience but it wasn't the best it could be. My school is fun and has spirit but most of the kids are not that nice and only care about themselves. I feel everyone is self centered.", "The teachers are pretty good at my school. they teach well but are very boring with their lessons. They do not really provide real world examples to match the material we are learning. Overall, I wouldn't say the teachers are bad, but they could offer more interesting lessons.", "I always feel safe at my school. I've never been afraid at my school", 'I think there are a lot of activities but people mostly do sports over clubs', "I think a lot of the parents are nice but a lot of them are hard on their kids and argue with teachers over their child's grades", "Overall the teachers are really great. They're nice and engaging. There are some people that are boring or give too much busy work.", "Ramapo has been on a gradual downhill slide in state standing since 2007, per the American Council on Education (ACE) rankings.  My child experiences more problematic issues created by staff and teacher laziness, ineptitude and lack of consistency, on a regular basis, then I can count anymore.  My time in being involved with first teachers, followed on to executive administration on a regular basis for issues caused by teachers and staff, is completely overwhelming to me as a full-time employed single parent.  In EVERY case, the executive administrator (Principal/VP/Head Guidance) agreed with me, and had to fix the problem, when the staffer or teachers were refuting they had fault to fix at all.  The quantity of continuous issues grew beyond my ability to address them all, and my child and other children suffer that.  If a parent isn't engaged at this school, then their child is suffering it.  If every parent were engaged, the executive administration would get nothing done other than fix the problems, because there are so many.  This is a LEADERSHIP issue, first and foremost, and I blame on the Superintendent, and the Principal.  Both good people, but they're not cutting it for there over 1/4 Million Dollar income we pay them.  It didn't used to be this way.  There has been a changing of the guard from the prior generation teachers and administrators between 2007-2011, and it shows!  It is no coincidence that Ramapo has slipped from an ACE ranking of #13 HS District in the state in 2007, to number 30 something in 2015.", 'We have a phenomenal theatre program that is broadway-quality, but less attended than it should be.', 'The majority of our teachers are phenomenal, but a select few loose their temper for poor reasons, have more absences stocked up than their are days in the year, and complain about administration.', 'Ramapo High School is a overall great school and the students here are fortunate enough to have the things that we do here, but there are several aspects that HAVE to be improved.']

column2: ["Cold Spring Harbor High school has helped define who I am in more ways than just me education. Cold Spring Harbor High School for me is where I learned how to learn, where I learned who I was as a person, and where I learned how to make the friends that have helped me further become a better person. Unlike other schools Cold Spring Harbor's commitment to excellency and uniquely small neighborhood feel helps to establish a learning community within it. This environment than helps individuals thrive in the learning process of uncovering the challenging Honors and AP courses to which the school, and its students strive to achieve new heights within it. This two factors then helped me become who I am today. I can surely say that my experience with Cold Spring Harbor High School truly has been excellent.", 'Outstanding school overall: Academically, Student Quality, top Varsity Athletics including Lacrosse, Rowing/Crew, Fencing, XC, Valleyball, Swim; top student run clubs and activities, hosts Scouting activities on campus. Outstanding facility like a private school. Outstanding college readiness and placement. It is like a private school for its quality of teaching and campus facility, campus setting, and academic preparedness and college placement. The school has a small student body of 160 per class with a large school campus in an affluent suberb setting. Graduates go on to top schools including the Ivies and Service Academies with 99% college placement. About 20% go on to top 20 schools in the country. I am the school’s 4th graduate since the 1960s to attend a Service Academy, the U.S. Naval Academy at Annapolis.', "I am a relatively new student at this school, but my experience thus far has been considerably interesting. There is awful diversity on multiple different levels. Everyone comes from around the same socio-economic background, there is very little representation of different races and ethnicities. From what I can tell, their academics are excellent, with a plethora of AP's and honors classes. The resources and facilities are very good, especially considering the school is based in a wealthier area. It feels like a safe school, but I think its secluded location and small size lessens the amount of possible danger. As someone who came in from elsewhere, I would say that the school is poor in comparison to what it could be. I would recommend working harder to build up school spirit in any way possible because at the moment it is extremely poor. I would also try to improve the framework of the administration because I feel like its weakness spreads to other areas of the school.", 'Cold Spring Harbor is a welcoming community with strong qualities. Although the diversity is slim the school allows you to explore youre personal opinions. CSH prepares you for the world outside of the community, along with the strong preparation the school provides. The personal connection you are able to have from student to teacher elevates the level of understanding and knowledge you can obtain about the topic. With sports and clubs the school allows you to take youre own interest and commit to something you have passion about with their wide variety. Although there are some ups and down with CSH with diversity and preparation for the world beyond the community, it also allows students to test out their freedom and potential in the future.', 'My time at Cold Spring Harbor certainly prepared me for college with the challenging academics and the high level of accountability that teachers required of you. In terms of overall environment and diversity, the school and the surrounding community certainly was lacking. The diversity rate is ~4%, meaning that only 4% of the student body identifies with a minority race. Additionally, the town and its students are too often all consumed by their overall image and flaunting their high financial status.', "I loved Cold Spring Harbor. There are very small classes so your teachers get to know everyone and how they learn. Very small district, so you're with the same people from k to 12. A wide array of sports teams and acitvities after school, and an outstanding arts program.", "I love CSH. It's my home. It's a wonderful town with wonderful people. Some of my best friends were my teachers. I truly discovered who I was here. They helped shape me into the person I am today.", 'Academics are rigorous, yet yield results at Cold Spring Harbor.', 'There are virtually no health or safety infringements that are noteworthy.', 'There are plenty of after school activities for all types of students.', 'The school is incredibly competitive, and students are forced to give themselves way to many hard classes in order to outdo classmates.', 'The teachers at Cold Spring Harbor High School are engaging, kind, and there to help their students. They provide students with as much knowledge and preparation as possible to succeed on standardized tests.', "A lot of teachers are great, but there are a few who have no idea what they're doing.", 'I was recently diagnosed with Celiac Disease, and the school has an extensive gluten-free program and takes as many precautions as they possibly can.', "I'm involved with primarily performing and visual arts extra curricular activities, and the advisors are wonderful and we have some of the best equipment available to us.", "At Cold Spring Harbor, I've been given the opportunities to grow in so many fields are really understand who I am and what I want to do. I've met some of the best people during my years here, and they've stuck with me through thick and thin, and I don't know what I'd do without them. Although there are quite a bit of people who are very closed minded-arrogant, and just think the world revolves around them, there's always going to be someone you can relate to.", 'There are a very small number of teachers who know absolutely nothing, pick on specific students, and are unfair graders, but the majority are great people and extremely knowlegable about the topic they are teaching, very approachable, easy to talk to, and are always easy to get extra help from.', "Missing class will get you in trouble. Guidance counselors don't care too much about your personal goals, but the administration does have a reputation to uphold.", 'Tons of effort and money put into the athletics.', "Teachers all really know what they're talking about and will help you without question."]

column2: ["The High school has changed so many times but it was for the better. I can honestly say that the changes in safety technology clubs and activities and etc. as well as how the staff is has changed the school for the better. That is why i couldn't have been in a better High School.", 'I am very thankful to the school, teachers and administrators for helping me out in my four years of school. High school was hard for me because I did not know any English and I had great teachers, always helping me out, and especially Ms. Malula, every Hispanic/Latino student knows about her. It’s a great school.', 'White Plains Senior High School was a pretty good school overall. All the teachers and  counselors there were very helpful, supporting, and understanding. One main thing that should and could be improved is the preparation of getting students ready for college. Throughout junior and senior year that should be a main focus our admin has.', 'As my final year comes to an end at White Plains High School, I can tell my experience in this school. The public high school is very diverse and lively in school spirit, the school tries to create a good experience for students and teachers by updating technology and making sure the classrooms are clean and supplied with more than enough supplies to make the learning easy and helpful.  The security and police officers make sure the school is safe, and the administrators help with the students accordingly. The best parts of the school for me personally were the STEM classrooms in the school, the teachers in stem care very much about their students learning and make the classroom activities very hands-on learning experiences.', 'Overall positive experience. More open-minded and liberal than most schools. There were kids of all races and sexualities and there was minimal bullying. I just feel like there were too man social cliques that never interacted with each other. Everyone made their own own unique lives with their friends, but never branched out. Academically, amazing classes with amazing teachers. There were almost too many clubs and activities.', 'My school has provided me with many opportunities to strive in life. The school is in a great location and has many teachers that are easily available to talk to.', "I've had a really enjoyable experience at WPHS.  Most of the teachers are very easy to work with and make class enjoyable by implementing teaching strategies that keep students involved and that are relevant to our generation's interests and learning styles. The campus is organized in a way that makes it easy to get around and includes spaces for students to socialize.  There are plenty of clubs and sport activities to keep you involved.  If I could change one thing, it would be better prepared lunch meals.", 'I love the diversity of the school and it has a lot of courses to take to prepare for the future . I would recommend all students to join this school for a better opportunity.', 'This was an amazing high school and it’s very easy to get involved and succeed academically. The staff was great at getting they’re students involved.', 'I love how diverse the White Plains High School community is in terms of ethnic backgrounds and overall beliefs. Most teachers go out of their way to help any student who shows a true interest or desire in learning, and they are sure to help them succeed. I find that the College and Career Center is a valued part of our community, as it is a place for students to meet alumni or students from countless colleges and careers each year. It motivates and excites students from each grade to invest more time into their futures. However, I feel that updating our security around the school would make students feel more safe than now.', 'Besides the academic standards being outstanding, the community, staff and location is overall amazing. I loved being a student there because there was always support and a great environment to create your college legacy in. I would send my future children there if I stay in New York!', 'Very diverse and safe school. Guidance counselors are very involved with students and help students make the right decisions for a successful future.', 'The Science Research and Engineering programs are outstanding opportunities for students wanting to get into the STEM fields.  The Dual Language program has expanded at the high school leading the way for students to soon be graduating with the New York State Seal of Biliteracy (NYSSB).  The Music program is incredible with students receiving instruction every other day.  Combined with a rich diverse population, this district is INCREDIBLE!', 'Administrators encourage civic involvement in society and allow diverse ideas to be heard in a receptive environment. Teachers are dedicated and willing to go the extra mile in order to help students achieve.', 'The teachers are very intelligent and great at their jobs. WPHS provides myriad opportunities and clubs; lots of different involvements. The people are friendly, and overall, it was a pleasant experience.', "i like the fact that our teacher's in my school try hard to get student's to success. i also Enjoy the fact that my school offers classes during the year that can are what or where my interest lies in what i would like to study in college. It offers a lot of academic help for their student's if they are having trouble with their studies. My classes in school are a descent number of student's in a classroom. This is important so teacher can give more attention to their student's.", 'The teachers are excellent. They are very understanding. You can get free tutoring in any subject you want. The sports teams and clubs are amazing. Students are very friendly, and the assistant principals and principal do whatever they can in their power to make this school a safe place for kids to attend. We have some freedom such as leaving the campus to eat lunch to wearing hats in school. White Plains High School is a very diverse and an amazing school.', 'School does not have individual treatment.  It is a mass peple mover.  It is safe.  Class scheduling is done poorly.  1 quarter 8 classes, the next lunch and then 2 study halls.  When called and email do not care.  Teachers are late in entering grades.', 'White Plains High School offers many diverse opportunities and activities. However, some of these opportunities are not made known to you unless you specifically go out to find them. Mostly everyone is nice and the teachers are down to earth for the most part, but there are still occasional issues that break out.', 'My experience at White Plains Senior High School was not bad. Freshman and sophomore year were good.It wasnt until Junior year when things got a little shakey. My AP English teacher questioned my ability to excell in this AP course because of the color of my skin. I never proceeded to be disrecpectful towards her, for that would’ve just made the situation worse. I continued with a successful finish in the course. Besides that little incident, White Plains Senior High school is not bad. My senior year is going great. But one thing I do wish would change is out school activities. We do not have a homecoming, or things like prom king and queen. We dont do nominations in our year book for example like, “best smile, or funniest laugh” , things like that. I feel as though if a little more student involved activities were available, it would make this school much more enjoyable.']

column6: ['I love my school beyond much, my experience has been nothing but above average simply because of all the help I get in school. From teachers, to administration and to guidance, I have never felt more care than from these adults. The school spirit could be better from our student body but the clubs and extra curricular activities are amazing, my experience as editor in chief of yearbook, editor for The Orange and officer for Science Fiction club has allowed me to grow in so many ways.', "Very diverse school and city, a lot to offer academic and extracurricular wise. Very big school, can be scary at first but it's very easy to find a group of people to fit in with.", 'I had moved here almost a year ago and I think it is a great school. Education is great. Diversity is very well shown. This school helps you get involved and makes sure your ready for college and beyond. It has many clubs and activities that you can be involved in and theres a lot of freedom that the students have.If you ever need any help, theres always tutors around the school to help you out with any subject.  It has many options of classes for all students and has great academics. Compared to any other school, this is truly a school of excellence, and will leave you satisfied after your 4 years.', 'I love the sports and the academic opportunities. I would like to see better and faster computers at the school.', 'I loved the teachers at this school because their teaching methods helped me understand the difficult subjects.', "I've been at white plains high school for 4 year and have enjoyed every second of it. The  faculty really care about the students well-being. There's a place for everyone because of the amount of clubs there are. Love this high school!", 'Bad place run by a corrupt principal who conceals violence, cheating, and even that bomb threat and urine-filled water balloon cafeteria fight.  Bad reputation with principal and so-called board of education  members (tiny fish in a tiny bowl who think they are "movers and shakers" LOL) writing the bogus positive reviews. Going to WCC (takes anyone even without a sixth grade education) and lowly state schools from NY to MD, is the norm. For "first generationers" they go elsewhere, but give \'em a half a year at a good school and they won\'t last--just won\'t fit in.  This review is completely accurate and candid. The principal\'s favorite class is mealtime.', "I wouldn't be who I am without WPHS. I started my organization there; they were flexible with my schedule so that I could intern at the United Nations; they allowed me to start dancing - I owe a lot of who I am to them. And I still go back to visit at least twice a year! The teachers are incredibly supportive and basically family to me, still. Not to mention the diverse environment and challenging courses really prepared me for the real world more than what I have heard from other college students about their high school experiences.", 'The four years you spend at this school will flow like a breeze. There is a lot of activities to do and people to meet. The teachers are all nice and help out when asked to. There are some ups and down academically the classes are tough if you have trouble understanding material, and there are not a lot technology implemented into the class courses, but there are moments of relief and comfort.', "white plains high school, is one of the most diverse schools I've been. when people think or hear of white plains high school they always think of our music department and sport teams. This high school community is very strong and connected. Our Arts program are empowering and persuading to me and many other people in our school. White plains High School's theater production is Just spectacular its full amazing actors and singers, and full of people who are passionate about what they want the audience to get and what they love. We are full pf an optimistic, caring ,passionate, curios, and also a feeling for education.", 'I finished my last two years of high school here I had a great experience here and made a lot of friends.', 'Arts program is excellent. After school activities are well funded and creative. Staff is supportive and class selection is interesting.', 'Overall I my high school was pretty good. I made a lot of friends and kept up with my grades for the most part. I stayed on the swim team for all four years, i tried track for one but after sophomore year I did not go again. I was in three clubs, great potential, black awareness, and scholarship seekers. I think I was pretty involved in school but could always be more involved. I liked my high school but during Senior year I was ready to go . Overall White Plains High School is a good school, the only thing i would like to see change is more school spirit.', 'I liked the helpful and interactive relationship between myself and the teachers. They created a environment of learning and trust that I could rely on. When ever I needed to understand a problem or develop a paper the teachers were available to help out.', 'White Plains Senior High School is a diverse school with many opportunities for those whom actively seek them.', 'white plains high school helps students excel in their different ways, providing the classes for different interests that help a student establish a future plan and pushes the students to work towards their goals.', 'White Plains High School is very diverse and big. All of the teachers are very caring and the course catalogue is very broad. I love all of the classes that are offered. I would like to see more school spirit at the football games or any school games. White plains high school is a big school, and has the potential to become a big community.', 'I believe that the White Plains Senior High School does many things to support people of different origins and backgrounds. It supports everyone and does not exclude anyone for any reason. They take the safety of their students seriously and take pride in the aid of students whenever an educational obstacle comes along. There are many teachers that actually want to interact with their students and are interested in more of a learning experience both in and out of class rather than just making students take and memorize information. It is quite an honor to be able to attend this public high school.', 'I love the freedom of White Plains High School. You get to work with your counselor to build your own schedule and chose classes that fit your needs and goals. The arts department is amazing and there are countless numbers of clubs during school and teams to join afterwards. The campus is big and the landscape is beautiful. The only thing I would change is that I wish our school had a little more school spirit although I already am starting to see that change. ', "WPHS is a pretty good school. There is a lot of freedom for the students and its a really good thing, everyone stays in their place and so far I have only witnessed one serious fight, there hasn't been anything that made me feel unsafe. Some teachers are great and really care while others basically make you teach yourself.  There are a lot of electives for freshman and even more for 10-12 grade. There are no 'mean girls' or guys who beat you up because you're a nerd everyone has friends because in such a big school SOMEONE will share interests with you, there's no discrimination or any of that everyone is equal, there's even a trans bathroom that was added recently. Sports teams suck now but its a super fun experience!"]
column8: ['I love my school beyond much, my experience has been nothing but above average simply because of all the help I get in school. From teachers, to administration and to guidance, I have never felt more care than from these adults. The school spirit could be better from our student body but the clubs and extra curricular activities are amazing, my experience as editor in chief of yearbook, editor for The Orange and officer for Science Fiction club has allowed me to grow in so many ways.', "Very diverse school and city, a lot to offer academic and extracurricular wise. Very big school, can be scary at first but it's very easy to find a group of people to fit in with.", 'I had moved here almost a year ago and I think it is a great school. Education is great. Diversity is very well shown. This school helps you get involved and makes sure your ready for college and beyond. It has many clubs and activities that you can be involved in and theres a lot of freedom that the students have.If you ever need any help, theres always tutors around the school to help you out with any subject.  It has many options of classes for all students and has great academics. Compared to any other school, this is truly a school of excellence, and will leave you satisfied after your 4 years.', 'I love the sports and the academic opportunities. I would like to see better and faster computers at the school.', 'I loved the teachers at this school because their teaching methods helped me understand the difficult subjects.', "I've been at white plains high school for 4 year and have enjoyed every second of it. The  faculty really care about the students well-being. There's a place for everyone because of the amount of clubs there are. Love this high school!", 'Bad place run by a corrupt principal who conceals violence, cheating, and even that bomb threat and urine-filled water balloon cafeteria fight.  Bad reputation with principal and so-called board of education  members (tiny fish in a tiny bowl who think they are "movers and shakers" LOL) writing the bogus positive reviews. Going to WCC (takes anyone even without a sixth grade education) and lowly state schools from NY to MD, is the norm. For "first generationers" they go elsewhere, but give \'em a half a year at a good school and they won\'t last--just won\'t fit in.  This review is completely accurate and candid. The principal\'s favorite class is mealtime.', "I wouldn't be who I am without WPHS. I started my organization there; they were flexible with my schedule so that I could intern at the United Nations; they allowed me to start dancing - I owe a lot of who I am to them. And I still go back to visit at least twice a year! The teachers are incredibly supportive and basically family to me, still. Not to mention the diverse environment and challenging courses really prepared me for the real world more than what I have heard from other college students about their high school experiences.", 'The four years you spend at this school will flow like a breeze. There is a lot of activities to do and people to meet. The teachers are all nice and help out when asked to. There are some ups and down academically the classes are tough if you have trouble understanding material, and there are not a lot technology implemented into the class courses, but there are moments of relief and comfort.', "white plains high school, is one of the most diverse schools I've been. when people think or hear of white plains high school they always think of our music department and sport teams. This high school community is very strong and connected. Our Arts program are empowering and persuading to me and many other people in our school. White plains High School's theater production is Just spectacular its full amazing actors and singers, and full of people who are passionate about what they want the audience to get and what they love. We are full pf an optimistic, caring ,passionate, curios, and also a feeling for education.", 'I finished my last two years of high school here I had a great experience here and made a lot of friends.', 'Arts program is excellent. After school activities are well funded and creative. Staff is supportive and class selection is interesting.', 'Overall I my high school was pretty good. I made a lot of friends and kept up with my grades for the most part. I stayed on the swim team for all four years, i tried track for one but after sophomore year I did not go again. I was in three clubs, great potential, black awareness, and scholarship seekers. I think I was pretty involved in school but could always be more involved. I liked my high school but during Senior year I was ready to go . Overall White Plains High School is a good school, the only thing i would like to see change is more school spirit.', 'I liked the helpful and interactive relationship between myself and the teachers. They created a environment of learning and trust that I could rely on. When ever I needed to understand a problem or develop a paper the teachers were available to help out.', 'White Plains Senior High School is a diverse school with many opportunities for those whom actively seek them.', 'white plains high school helps students excel in their different ways, providing the classes for different interests that help a student establish a future plan and pushes the students to work towards their goals.', 'White Plains High School is very diverse and big. All of the teachers are very caring and the course catalogue is very broad. I love all of the classes that are offered. I would like to see more school spirit at the football games or any school games. White plains high school is a big school, and has the potential to become a big community.', 'I believe that the White Plains Senior High School does many things to support people of different origins and backgrounds. It supports everyone and does not exclude anyone for any reason. They take the safety of their students seriously and take pride in the aid of students whenever an educational obstacle comes along. There are many teachers that actually want to interact with their students and are interested in more of a learning experience both in and out of class rather than just making students take and memorize information. It is quite an honor to be able to attend this public high school.', 'I love the freedom of White Plains High School. You get to work with your counselor to build your own schedule and chose classes that fit your needs and goals. The arts department is amazing and there are countless numbers of clubs during school and teams to join afterwards. The campus is big and the landscape is beautiful. The only thing I would change is that I wish our school had a little more school spirit although I already am starting to see that change. ', "WPHS is a pretty good school. There is a lot of freedom for the students and its a really good thing, everyone stays in their place and so far I have only witnessed one serious fight, there hasn't been anything that made me feel unsafe. Some teachers are great and really care while others basically make you teach yourself.  There are a lot of electives for freshman and even more for 10-12 grade. There are no 'mean girls' or guys who beat you up because you're a nerd everyone has friends because in such a big school SOMEONE will share interests with you, there's no discrimination or any of that everyone is equal, there's even a trans bathroom that was added recently. Sports teams suck now but its a super fun experience!"]

column2: ["The students are majorly the problem, but admin is a close second. There are some talented administrators, but then again, there are a few who care more about what their job is than the students. It's a dog-eat-dog world here.", "I graduated from SPHS in 2018, It has a very heavy workload but colleges were impressed that I attended there. I think it was just an unnecessary amount of work but the college workload seems bearable since I'm used to it.", "Science Park, located in the heart of Newark, has a competitive environment which pushes students to doing very well. An amazing school at preparing their students for college, they have the best resources to help their low-income minority students go far. Being an Ecuadorian American female that aspires to be a Biomedical Engineer, I have taken advantage of the AP classes that they offer that are heavily concentrated in science and math courses. Not only have I enjoyed learning and working with the teachers, I have done well on the exams, although there are moments where the workload becomes stressful. Science is great concerning academics, but the social environment tells a different story. Over the years, students have pointed out the racial/cultural tensions that exist that the administration hasn't done much to improve. However, under a new administration for the 2019-2020 school year, those issues are being improved as well as bringing back school spirit to the students.", "Like every other. school, it has its ups and downs. I believe that it most definitely can be improved. In my opinion, the administration is worried about the minor problems and not addressing the major ones. I've only had about a handful of good teachers if not less. Our school is supposed to be math and science related but these subjects are probably the worst ones in the school. On the other hand, I've made some good friends and had the chance to take some good classes.", 'Science Park High was a good experience for me so far as I enter my senior year. I honestly cannot see myself going anywhere else. The diversity is a little intimidating at first but then you realize we are all just teenagers in highschool and can move past ethnicity. The teachers are great and are primarily there to help you.', 'It was a really good experience. I feel al though it has gotten better and easier over the years. Some teachers are great and super easy while other are the complete opposite and they are mean and overly strict.', 'Science Park prepares students for college level work. From the rigorous courses that begin in freshman year, they make sure that each student is well compacted with courses that will benefit them.', 'I like how in a community that lacks resources, it has multiple available in the school.  For example, guidance counselors post information on scholarships and programs that will benefit students.  Education is highly valued at this school but the school has alot of clubs available to students who want to interact with their community.', 'Challenging school, with great staff and very diverse. Encourages students to be their best, and support them with anything they need to advance their skills and make sure they all feel like they belong. Amazing teachers, some which will go out of their way to help you. Loved it.', 'As a student at Science Park High School, I experienced first-hand the rigorously challenging classes and diversity at that school. Although there are many racial tensions present, being around people and their culture is highly implemented in our everyday lives. Certain classes are very difficult especially if taking AP or IB but the challenge is always exciting. Science Park would be a greater school if the staff/faculty cared more about making the environment better for students, such as not making us feel as though we are falling behind when asking for help or actually caring more about our academics rather than our uniforms.', 'Academically, the school is very strong, especially in STEM fields. The music and art programs in the school are pretty strong as well, although that is more dependent on the relationship between students and the teachers', 'I think the only problems are 1) the inadequate science teachers and 2) disorganization on the administrators behalf.', 'I feel like Science Park has a great environment and culture that really allows students to learn and grow. The workload definitely helps prepare students for college but the downside of that is the stress level. The majority of the student body is extremely stressed out but the school has been taking steps to try and help decrease that level of stress and anxiety among students.', 'Science Park High School is a place where a student is exposed to several opportunities and where a student can be prepared and ready to go into college. This high school really challenges a student and allows a student to learn the best out of a specific subject/topic.', 'My community service began at SPHS. I had a great relationship with my teachers. The administration was very kind and wanted to help in any way they could. They allowed for expression. In my last year here I saw the school become more colorful with all the different art installations. Overall SPHS prepared me for college and allowed me to be myself in a safe space', 'The students are great but transferring and making new friends can be difficult. Administration needs some work. Students have a lot of opinions that should be heard.', 'The teachers are really down to earth. Very friendly and very comfortable to talk to. The students are friendly as well. It is not as hard as it seems but it isn’t easy either so you have to at least put some effort.', 'The thing about Science Park is although it does prepare you for college the environment is beyond stressful, and not much is done about it. Some teachers are beyond amazing and others are terrible causing students to have panic attacks constantly. Along with that there is a sort of dicrimination at this school and a lot of problems go unsolved while most of the school is left blind to the issue since the administration sweeps everything under the rug to preserve their reputation. Yes science Park is a good place to learn but it’s clearly lacking in many places.', 'I have had great 4 years. There have been trying times but the teachers care and want you to succeed but it can get frustrating.', 'This school helped me to find myself. It became a close family/community which I loved to attend every day. The teachers are true professionals, extra help is always offered. However, it is rigorous and will prepare students for college life. Overall, an amazing school.']
