column6: ['The administration while kind to your face actually do not care about the students. There was a suicide attempt during school hours and it was swept under the rug. Students are overworked and severely depressed yet no one cares because all that they are concerned about are test scores and publicity. Some teachers are good while the most do not care and barely teach.', 'I like that the teachers are very dedicated and eager to teach students. I wish that there were more AP classes available when I was a student.', 'I love the staff and the knowledge they share with us.  The culture is very diverse and the students are leaders, outgoing and friendly. The facility is always clean and open to all parents and there families. Overall it a great high school to learn.', 'Science has helped me really focus on my future and opened my eyes to what the "real world" has in store for me. It allowed me to compete with myself and pushed me to do my best in everything i do, to always put 100% effort and gave me somewhat of a path to chose with several options.', "Science Park has a diverse environment with a variety of academics and clubs. The teachers really do their best in order to help you and provide a comfortable place to learn. However, Science has been known to take very little care of its plumbing and overall physical appearance. The system at Science can be rather stressful for a few due to some teachers, at certain points, valuing grades more than academic growth in the individual. It isn't perfect, but it does have some flaws that suppress the pros.", "Science Park is a very rigorous school, but it prepares students for college. All the teachers I've had have taught with passion as they are passionate about teaching and what they are teaching. However, the students do get stressed easily as the workload is heavy. Having someone other than guidance counselors to talk to would be a good change to the school as the guidance counselors can be busy throughout the day and not be able to reach out to students.", 'Its a great school with a very demanding environment. The recent graduating classes have had to deal with competition amongst students making it a hard time. With all students striving for the best and the difficulty of the classes the students are stressed but more prepared for the future.', 'I like the building and staff, however the lack of diversity in terms of electives is the only thing that kind of bothers me', 'My experience at Science was overall great. It was tough at times, but your teachers help you get through it. There’s various after school activities that can fit anyone’s interests and the faculty help their students through every step of the college admissions journey, which can be very stressful. One recommendation I would give is to fundraise a lot and early on, so that you aren’t stuck during your senior year trying to pull enough money together.', "Science Park is a school that has received praise in the past due to their academic achievements. However, recently the school isn't really concerned to listening to the voices of the students. Science Park has become standardized test driven and that has taken away the magic of learning.", 'The academic part of Science Park is amazing up until the science teachers. The science department is the worst department in the school. The school environment is very toxic and everyone is constantly dragging one another down in the name of competition.', 'This school exceeds in academics, however, it could get better with sports such as increasing number of sport clubs and the funding for it. The college readiness also can improve it does prepare you for college but not as much as it should be.', "Being in Science Park since 7th, it was an interesting experience that I don't regret taking on. The teachers and guidance counselors know how to push us into challenges to get us ready with higher chances to survive college.", "Science Park High School is a great school because of the education you get there is very high quality in comparison to other inner-city schools plus there are other opportunities (AP courses, IB courses, honors, etc.) that can help you build your future for the college environment. There are some teachers who introduced students to different ways of thinking and a plethora of courses, necessary for success in the real world.  It is highly strict therefore you get exactly what you deserve. There are many activities to join so it's not all about academic achievements but also about enjoy the time spent at the school. Though the administration needs a little more work (for instance, they need to expel all those incompetent students that are making our school look bad), Science Park is the best thing that has happened to me. Extremely diverse, academically rigorous, comprised of intellectual and innovative students; Science Park shines the most out of all schools in the City of Newark.", 'I loved the diversity at Science Park High School. There were so many different cultures present in classes and I was able to learn a little about everyone. The courses and teachers were also very challenging which formed me into the student I am today. I am not afraid to take risks and I always try my very best in everything I do, inside and outside of school.', 'I graduated from Science Park High School recently. At the time, it was the best high school in Newark. I really felt like Science Park High prepared me for my years in college. The coursework that I had to complete and the courses that I took were very similar to ones that I took in college.', "My experience at Science Park High School has been okay. I had no problems making friends and getting along with teachers. I would like this school to be the way it was when we had a better budget with more field trips and more contributions towards sports budgets. I had played volleyball all four years to keep me entertained while I learned. I liked how different other sports were offered however I would want science to have it's own football team or wrestling team. That would be interesting. Academically well for the students, it is a pain but some teachers find fun ways to help us learn. That is Science Park in a nutshell.", 'Science Park High School is called the “Number 1 School” or The “Top School”, Wayne really it isn’t the best school. I’m some cases the school is alright, As Far as teachers, Sime teachers are really hard on students, I understand that their trying to prepare us for college but a lot of the work is unnecessary. As far as tests go, we get a lot of tests, we find it to be really stressful but have no choice but to deal with it because complaining doesn’t change anything. As far as building quality, There’s never and tissue in the bathrooms, There’s never and hand soap, The bathrooms are always locked...etc', 'Science park High school is the best because the staff members are nice and kind to parents and the courses their are good and their is a  diversity of people in the school and lots of good stuff.', "Science Park High School is a very diverse high school in Newark. It challenges students to reach their fullest potential. It prepares it's students for college, and life after college. This high school gives it's students to experience many different electives, and explore different career fields."]
column8: ["The school should treat their students like the scholars they are. The school accepts the best of the city but treats them like prisoners. Doesn't build capacity for leadership and polices them frequently. There is no culture for it to feel like a family. Some of the teachers could care less about the students.  The climate of the school is cold and detached. We can't even use the the stairs to our own school. I didn't enjoy my years there and I would never advise anyone to attend.", 'As a senior in the school, I have become familiar with everything that has to do with Science Park. It has a welcoming community from the faculty but there lack that same sense of welcomingness among the students. This being said, once you have found your group of friends it is when you begin to feel a sense of community.', "I loved my time at Science Park - we have a renown academic program, with students who go to Ivy League schools every year, but we also have great teachers, great clubs, and a great art program. Our school is extremely diverse, even for Newark, and it is very safe. The faculty and staff are largely friendly and helpful, and every one wants to see the students succeed. It truly is a gem of a school. It's only problems stem from its school district - decreasing funding over the years leads to more cuts to programs and worse school lunch. :(", "Science Park was great because it really prepared me for college. Because of it, I manage my time wisely and I'm really involved in my community.", 'What I really like about my school is the clubs. It’s for Colleges/Universities to see what we’ve done but besides that I love meeting new people everyday. The clubs are open for anyone, We have a Latin Dance Club and they perform at every pep rally. There is Band where students play their instruments in the auditorium or pep rally. Another one is GSA or LGBTQ+ club, it welcomes students who are or not out and allies. Something I would like to see change is the teachers. The administratives don’t check up on the classes most students complain about which is mainly the teacher. There are a few that I had and did not know how to teach a certain topic but I go after school to get extra help when I have time. Overall the school is very diverse and complexed.', "College preparation is great. I began this school in 7th grade. It takes some time to get adapted to the processes and the environment. Other schools in Newark don't match up", "The school is just okay. It doesn't have a lot of resources or money so that they can get things accomplished. There is bad lunch food and not much parent involvement. It isn't often you see parents advocating. The teachers and diversity is just okay. Really the school is not the best but it isn't the worse. So it is just average.", "Science Park High School is a college ready high school. Made to push individuals to be the best versions of themselves. Extremely diverse school not just ethnically but people from different backgrounds of learning and expertise. Highly recommend having someone's child attend if they are ever given an opportunity to attend such a prestigious school.", 'It is a great highschool. Will make sure that you are in the right direction to success. You learn alot and are able to connect with teachers.', "I love it here. The school's education level is a bit difficult but that's okay because I always love a challenge. The diversity here is great. There are Africans, Hispanic, Portuguese, Brazilians and some Indian", 'Science Park High is very great academically, however, it is located in a dangerous area. Also, the clubs and activities need improvement. The girls volleyball team does not have a coach and school starts in less than two weeks.', 'My alter mater is a amazing. It was and still is one of the best schools in Newark and in the northern region. I was apart of the first 7th or 8th grade class at Science and that was one of the best experiences of my life. They have the top teachers, counselors, assistants, and regular staff members to ensure that I received a quality education.', "Overall, my four years in Science were ones to remember. There were moments where I had my doubts about the school and its coursework, however all of it was meant to prepare myself for college and my life ahead of me. The teachers and students overall are really chill, and there's a lot of diversity within the student demographics. My only complaint about this school would be the school lunch they offer, as it usually looks like they just warm up cold food from a fridge. Other than that, the school overall was a good experience and one I would recommend for those entering.", 'I love going to science park high school every school day because it is a place with an exceptional environment. The faculty, staff, and my fellow students are always committed and want to see both the school and themselves succeed.', 'Great school that really helps the students along the way. Staff is nice and with so much security it feels very safe!', 'What was great about science was that it provided the students an opportunity to further their education by taking Honors, AP, and even IB classes.', "I liked that the teachers were very invested in the students. We were offered the best materials around to support our education. I wish swim classes actually taught me how to swim but I know it's difficult has we only had 40 minutes of class.", "Science park is an good school but in all honesty they are beginning to slack off. My last year I went half a school year without an biology teacher and all it did was bring me down academic wise. It was cool to have two free periods but it wasn't worth missing out on everything else my other friends learned. Other then that the school is fun, creative and very open to new things. My favorite part of my four years at science was participating in Art with Ms. Brewin. Not only did she help me open up creatively but she allowed me to just think outside the box. Thank you for that.", "Science Park isn't just another high school. It's a home to everyone.  There isn't fights or bullying but friendship and learning. Great teachers that help us our, early in the mornings, late in the afternoons and even at nights through online communications.", 'Science Park High school has a student friendly environment, nearly no cases of bullying have been heard. Not only it gives me solace as a freshman, it is in one of the safest neighborhoods in Newark, NJ. There is a clash of diversity, and everyone accepts each other. The Sports teams could be better in terms of funding, but everyone shows their school spirit. The classes and teachers are amazing, although the work is heavy and hard, it pays off in the end.']

column2: ['Great school, strong sense of community, good classes and lots of support. Because it is very small there is not a huge variety of courses.', 'Highland Park High School is definitely not the worst place in terms of public education, but it can be improved on a lot. This district is extremely small, resulting in a general lack of opportunities for students to excel. Without the necessary amount of students, course options, afterschool clubs, and sports are woefully limited. Special emphasis should be placed on the lack of college preparation provided to students. While the school boasts closer teacher and student relations as a benefit of the small size, counselors rarely meet and get to know the students they are guiding. This is at no fault of their own either, where three (3) counselors are responsible for the ~450 student body. Further, little information is provided to students regarding the process of applying. As for the school culture, the students are mostly Highland Park residents making social life really cliquey. Overall not a bad school but definitely not the best around.', "The environment is very welcoming and accepting, the teachers are helpful and friendly for the most part. I've never had a class I've hated. The schedule however makes music classes as the first period of the day (first period is optional) and is slowly killing the music department both in terms of numbers and quality. I've also heard they are taking away the home economics courses which is awful. Needless to say- even though this is my last year- I'm very unhappy with the changes they have been making. I wish they cared more about the arts. Otherwise it's one of the better public schools in NJ probably.", "It's a decent school overall, plenty of opportunities to succeed as long as you try. The small school size means you form closer relationships with teachers, who are overall supportive and amazing people. However, it also means limitations on some resources, like the funding for classes and clubs. But there is great diversity, and the school does try to push to succeed in many ways.", 'Highland Park is a school that values diversity. At Highland Park students are allowed to express themselves in a safe environment, through the Teen Center.  All teachers value education, however, the teaching skill of teachers here vary. You will obtain a decent education here, if you are taking most honors/ AP classes here. Most teachers here encourage all students to challenge themselves, and from this teachers are more involved in their harder classes. I also recommend to take the challenging classes here at Highland Park High School. I would say Highland Park is overall a good school with a welcoming atmosphere despite its small school size. My experience of Highland Park High School is not comparable to any other high school because of the small community, although, I believe because of its size there is more an emphasis on the student, and bettering the individual.', 'Highland Park High School is small, so people, including the staff, know each other. However, since it is small, class selection can be limited(variety), and friend groups are formed from way back.', 'Highland Park High School is small, and has all the benefits and drawbacks associated with its size. The school community is tight and all the students and teachers know each other, but the academic resources are limited. Larger schools offer more classes, and Highland Park lacks this variety. However, thanks to the variety of clubs in the school, students can learn engineering, acting, and philosophy at robotics club, the school play, and Philosophy Club.', 'Since Highland Park High School is a small school, students and teachers become really close. Teachers , advisors and counselors are able to focus on each student, enabling students to find their passion and what they want to become in the future.  Students and teachers have close relationships with each other which makes the school community act like a family.  HPHS also offers challenging classes (AP) which would help the students in college. Clubs and other group activities are also fun and encouraged.  Last but not the least, HPHS has strong sports teams! Go OWLS!', 'Highland Park is a diverse community which fosters acceptance and understanding of other cultures and communities.', "The scheduling is a lot better and more thought out than my last school. The size is very small so it's basically a private school although it is public. There isn't a wide range of options for Ap classes however.", "HPHS is a very diverse facility with different types of students/teachers. The student to teacher ratio is beneficial to fulfilling the students' needs.", "Principal is kind of power tripping. School board refuses to fund or approve field trips with the exception of a few specific clubs (the music department has not gone on a field trip since spring 2014). Superintendent doesn't delay openings when necessary, making the journey to school hazardous on occasion.", 'I like the open lunch privilege that upperclassmen are able to take advantage of. I like how many of the teachers are easily accessible if students need help or guidance. I like the environment of HPHS, as the school is very small, so everyone knows each other.', "Highland Park High School is great for students because of it's small size. This eliminates a lot of the horrid popularity contest culture in most high schools. The school is full of wonderful teachers.", 'I love the diversity of Highland Park High School. All of my classmates come from different backgrounds, either racially, financially, religiously, or culturally. The student body has a wide variety of interests represented by many student-run clubs.Perhaps we could use more resources for books and sports uniforms. The music department is also in need of better facilities and instruments. And I would love to see more language options in the future-- at the current moment, our school only offers Spanish and French. Overall, Highland Park is a great place to receive a high school education.', "Highland Park High School is a very small, tight-knit school. Everyone knew each other and it was easy to make friends. My school is incredibly accepting; we were the first school in our county to adopt the Transgender Policy. I'm proud to be a member of this school, everyone was such a forward thinker. The only reason I don't give this school a full five-star rating is because there wasn't much variety in courses offered. Since it was such a small school, they couldn't offer many classes because there aren't enough students. It would have been nice to maybe take a European history class or a Piano 101 class.", 'I had an overall very positive academic environment at this school, and I learned a great amount especially from my AP courses, which helped prepare me for college workload.', 'HPHS participates in the sports that most schools do, but do not have a swim team, lacross team, and just formed a volleyball and winter track team. Two of the most popular clubs are Model UN/Congress and DECA. A good portion of the student body, especially those who are academically outstanding, participate in either of these clubs. Other clubs include the art club, math league, and the various science leagues, battle of the books, newspaper, environmental club, SAGA, etc.', "I moved to a different town in 8th grade, so I had to start all over and make new friends. HPHS is very unique because the culture of the town is different and also because the school is very small. The student body consists of roughly 500 students. I run cross country, track, participate in Model UN/Congress, Mathletes, Battle of the Books, and orchestra. It is a very nice environment to learn. Some rooms don't have AC in the spring, so that's a bummer. There's a library across from the school so the location is also very convenient.", 'There are a few excellent teachers at my school, and also a few that are not that great. I have a history teacher who is very passionate not only about US history, but also about world politics and international relations. He heads the Model United Nations/Congress club in our school. My spanish teacher a great teacher as well, but is a bit biased, and it is very obvious to us students in class. Our marketing teacher is new, and she copies her textbook onto a powerpoint, and we copy the powerpoint into our notes. It is not really an engaging class, nor do we learn about marketing and business in depth. Overall, I would give my teachers a good rating.']

column8: ['Each teacher has their own teaching styles, however most are knowledgable in their field and are able to implant this knowledge into the minds of the students in effective and innovative ways. Communication and remaining on top of grading can be an issue at times, so it is usually up to the student to reach out and be very keen on notifying their teachers of any issues that may arise. In addition the teachers are very involved in the students activities and enjoy taking part in fundraisers and genuinely take interest in each students pursuits and well being. Teachers often take on multiple roles such as class advisors and sports coaches, etc. Also, because the school is so small, each individual has the opportunity to develop a close knit relationship with their teachers. The teachers are always available to offer support and make sure this is known among the students.', 'In this school the administration claims to have strict rules regarding the tolerance of bullying, and the students are fully aware that this is not completely true and do not take such things seriously because there are never incidents of bullying so we do not find that it is necessary. In addition, this is a very safe environment for students with a fairly competent school nurse. Also the school has an officer present in the building at all times,not as a result of an issue, just to further ensure the safety of the students. The students have grown to become friendly toward Officer Joe.', "I learn a lot in school, but sometimes that comes from self-teaching. In general, however, teachers are very available and I learn in depth about all the courses I've taken. The workload has not been too heavy lately.", "I feel safe, though there aren't many safety measures enforced. For example, we have a couple of fire drills and lock down drills each month, but nothing else. There are security cameras and alarm systems for locked doors. I never go to the nurse so I have no knowledge of the topic, but from what I understand the health programs are ok at HPHS.", "Save for a few, overall most teachers are excellent. They really seem to care about the students, their education, and their futures, as well as the subject they are teaching. They aren't all extremely extremely knowledgable, but they all carry their classes pretty well.", 'There is a wide range of extracurricular opportunities, though being such a small school, it is still lacking some.', 'The club variety is very limited, and not a lot of clubs get decent funding.', "The main unique thing about this school is it's size. Since it is so small and each class has around 100 students in it, the club and class variety is very limited. However, everyone knows each other and it is a very friendly setting in general.", 'The teachers are very responsible, and most of them are friendly. However, not all of them have total control over the class, which could be improved upon.', 'This is a very small school and being so you are required to be very interpersonal with another.', "I love my school it's a small school meaning you get to develop a lot of close relationships with people and you get to know almost everyone. The teachers are extremely helpful and want all their students to succeed. There are also numerous amounts of extra curricular activities to get involved in.", 'I love my experience at Highland Park High! I had an experience with a lot of bad schools in the past so once I came to HP, the idea of going to school and interacting with my peers scared the living daylights out of me. But, the students and staff were so welcoming and kind and even when I tried to shut them down and tell them "I don\'t do well with interaction", they still made an effort to bring this amazing part of me that I had forgotten about or hadn\'t even known I had to begin with. I came into HPHS a shy, scared, depressed little girl with no friends and no idea what she was going to do tomorrow, let alone for the rest of her life. Now, 2 years later, I\'m a blossoming, cheerful, energetic, ambitious young woman who would make friends with the entire human population if I could. The students really are allowed to get involved in their school and really feel like their concerns are being adressed, and I love that. I love that the school is small, and everyone is so close knit. One could get a family-like vibe from the student body and school really does feel like my home away from home, and that\'s what I feel a school should really feel like.', "Highland Park High School has been a pretty good experience. The smallness of both its size and numbers keep the community more close-knit. Most of the people I will be graduating with, I have known since kindergarten, or even preschool. Its extreme diversity is really unique, and sustains the school as an overall welcoming environment. I've learned a lot, and made amazing friends I hope to stay close with as long as I can. All ideas are welcomed at HPHS, and there are so many ways you can get involved with the community and those around you. So many students are extremely talented in a wide array of activities, in addition to very passionate about them. I would choose to go to this school again if I could do it all over because it provided me with many opportunities and ultimately allowed me to make the friends I have today.", "It's a small school where every student in the school knows each other or at least have talked to one another in several occasions. People are very friendly and supportive. There's a racial diversity where students from one race respect one from the other. Since it's a small school, it is easy for students to be recognized for their accomplishments. For instance every morning, students who made a goal in a soccer game or received awards from a competition will be announced.", 'I think I spent my four years well here. It was nice and small so I got to know most people and made some great friends.', "The food is pretty decent, there's usually a nice selection of it and you aren't required to take anything. The snacks can be a bit pricey but totally worth it.", "The school is pretty strict about its rules. You get in trouble if you do something very bad but usually petty thing like wearing hats or headphones in your ear you just get told to take them off or they'll confiscate it until the end of the day.", 'This school offers a wide range of sports and activities you can participate in. The coaches are very fun spirited as well as competitive.', 'The teachers are always there to help you when needed. They even confront you when they feel that you are struggling or slacking off.', 'There is a teen center that lets you start just about any kind of club as long as you approach them. They let you use their rooms and are very friendly and often help you out if you come to them asking for any sort of help.']

column2: ["During my first couple of weeks here, I wanted to transfer because I was not used to the high school atmosphere. However, after I got into the routine of coming to this school and had made friends, I realized that I actually enjoyed attending MHSHS. It's a very small school so almost everyone knows each other which allows for a tightknit community. The workload can get overwhelming at times but you can get through it.", 'Over the years at the high school, the teachers have helped me develop as a student and I have met some great people.', "I'm a junior at this school and I've hated every year of it. The other students in my grade are incapable of doing anything but study. Making true friends at this school was probably one of the hardest things to do. The classes are completely limited and hardly teach you anything, in fact more then half of the teachers here are rude and unqualified. The only class in this school students actually enjoy is the orchestra class. The MlK campus makes the school ten times worse, the student safety agents are incapable of being nice and like to provoke students. The learning environment is hard to be around and the principle is toxic. The only good thing about this school is the time that we get out and the fact that we go to the college for senior year.", 'Overall, I enjoyed my time at MHSHS. Most of all I enjoyed how diverse the school was and how hands on my teachers were.', 'MHSHS was a pretty good experience because I was able to learn in a diverse setting where everyone was so keen and focused on their own academic individual selves. In this sense, it created an environment that fostered learning in the best way through a growth mindset. The actual student body is very condensed and because of such, the setting is "everybody knows everybody," which almost creates this sense of unity and community. Everyone is especially excited for senior year, where seniors are able to take real college courses at Hunter College alongside their high school courses, which is really cool because it gives you the advantage of knowing what\'s to come in college before everyone else (early college experience).', "Although I transferred here in my sophomore year, I feel really close to everyone else. It's really easy to make friends here and the teachers are all really committed to helping students. As far as I know, nearly all teachers stay after school on most days for about a hour or more to help students with questions about homework, classwork, and even correct test mistakes. I feel as though they genuinely care about me and my peers.The few issues I would have with this school is the building since it is shared with other schools. During fire drills it can get pretty hectic and it takes a wile for classes to resume afterwards.", 'This school helps prepare students for college. It takes alot of hard work and alot of long nights but it is completely work it in the end. The teachers work closely with the students and make sure students understand the materials.', 'Teachers remain strong relationships with students. They care about their students and make sure they understand what is going on in class. Work load can be a lot, but manageable. The only complain I have is students have to go through scanning every morning.', 'I loved my experience here! All the teachers were so amazing and prepared me so well for college. I learned so much here and the teachers really cared for their students.', 'I am currently a senior at MHSHS, and it’s sad that I’ll be leaving this year. In just 4 years, I was part of a community filled with diversity. The student body is quite small compared to other schools, which is why everyone knows each other and gets along. MHSHS is like my 2nd home.', 'When I began attending MHSHS, the ceilings were drab and cell phones and drinks were never allowed. Throughout the years, painted ceilings promoted creativity and light. Phones were allowed to enter the school (but not on the student). The teachers are life-changing honestly. They strive to make their students learn. In addition, seniors head to Hunter College for their entire senior year, taking 2 classes for 2 semesters in addition to High school courses.', 'The class size was small about 100 kids in my grade, which I loved! All of the teachers were able to give their full attention to their students and make sure no kid is left behind. And the fact that we were able to experience college firsthand, by taking college classes at Hunter College in our senior year helped so much when I actually entered college.', "I like how it's a small school and all the teachers and students know each other, it creates a lot of strong relationships. I also like all the opportunities it has given me, like taking classes at Hunter College. I would very much recommend.", 'Great school, and teachers. However, the school building is among others so it can be really annoying to deal with others. The high school is worth it if you want to do your senior year in a college setting.', 'This school is great because the teachers are invested and want to see you do well. They care about your wellbeing and help you mentally and academically.', 'What I like about Manhattan Hunter/Science High School is that it is full of excellent students who can care for others and have interesting activities I can attend to. There is no changes I want from them.', 'Manhattan Hunter Science High School is a qualified and effective institution in preparing high-school students for College and has continued to provide alumni that has potential to change the future.Although, most students over there lack the drive and dedication to create Clubs/Organizations (Extra-curricular activities) given that they are heavily "burdened by the amount of Homework".', "I love how hardworking some of the teachers are and how they put so much effort into making sure their students are understanding the material covered in class. I love the school community. We are a small school, so everyone knows each other, everyone is comfortable with one another. We're like a little family. However, one thing I'd like to see change is offering students more options for classes.", 'I love the school and its easy-going and close knit atmosphere. Every day at this school was not only fun, but improved my education immensely.', "One of the biggest positives about my school is the exposure we get to college life in our senior years. After junior year, we leave the campus and finish our final year at Hunter College where we get to take college courses. I've been excited about this since I started, it's one of my favorite things about MHSHS. If MHSHS were to change anything I think it should be its method in keeping its students from engaging with other schools and working towards forming relationships with them instead. The only time you really ever see any integration between the schools is on the sports teams, but outside of that, I feel that MHSHS remains separated in their own bubble. I liked the sense of unity I felt as a campus once I joined a team and actually got to know students who went to the other schools. I think it's be good for MHSHS to try and create a sense of togetherness"]
column4: ["During my first couple of weeks here, I wanted to transfer because I was not used to the high school atmosphere. However, after I got into the routine of coming to this school and had made friends, I realized that I actually enjoyed attending MHSHS. It's a very small school so almost everyone knows each other which allows for a tightknit community. The workload can get overwhelming at times but you can get through it.", 'Over the years at the high school, the teachers have helped me develop as a student and I have met some great people.', "I'm a junior at this school and I've hated every year of it. The other students in my grade are incapable of doing anything but study. Making true friends at this school was probably one of the hardest things to do. The classes are completely limited and hardly teach you anything, in fact more then half of the teachers here are rude and unqualified. The only class in this school students actually enjoy is the orchestra class. The MlK campus makes the school ten times worse, the student safety agents are incapable of being nice and like to provoke students. The learning environment is hard to be around and the principle is toxic. The only good thing about this school is the time that we get out and the fact that we go to the college for senior year.", 'Overall, I enjoyed my time at MHSHS. Most of all I enjoyed how diverse the school was and how hands on my teachers were.', 'MHSHS was a pretty good experience because I was able to learn in a diverse setting where everyone was so keen and focused on their own academic individual selves. In this sense, it created an environment that fostered learning in the best way through a growth mindset. The actual student body is very condensed and because of such, the setting is "everybody knows everybody," which almost creates this sense of unity and community. Everyone is especially excited for senior year, where seniors are able to take real college courses at Hunter College alongside their high school courses, which is really cool because it gives you the advantage of knowing what\'s to come in college before everyone else (early college experience).', "Although I transferred here in my sophomore year, I feel really close to everyone else. It's really easy to make friends here and the teachers are all really committed to helping students. As far as I know, nearly all teachers stay after school on most days for about a hour or more to help students with questions about homework, classwork, and even correct test mistakes. I feel as though they genuinely care about me and my peers.The few issues I would have with this school is the building since it is shared with other schools. During fire drills it can get pretty hectic and it takes a wile for classes to resume afterwards.", 'This school helps prepare students for college. It takes alot of hard work and alot of long nights but it is completely work it in the end. The teachers work closely with the students and make sure students understand the materials.', 'Teachers remain strong relationships with students. They care about their students and make sure they understand what is going on in class. Work load can be a lot, but manageable. The only complain I have is students have to go through scanning every morning.', 'I loved my experience here! All the teachers were so amazing and prepared me so well for college. I learned so much here and the teachers really cared for their students.', 'I am currently a senior at MHSHS, and it’s sad that I’ll be leaving this year. In just 4 years, I was part of a community filled with diversity. The student body is quite small compared to other schools, which is why everyone knows each other and gets along. MHSHS is like my 2nd home.', 'When I began attending MHSHS, the ceilings were drab and cell phones and drinks were never allowed. Throughout the years, painted ceilings promoted creativity and light. Phones were allowed to enter the school (but not on the student). The teachers are life-changing honestly. They strive to make their students learn. In addition, seniors head to Hunter College for their entire senior year, taking 2 classes for 2 semesters in addition to High school courses.', 'The class size was small about 100 kids in my grade, which I loved! All of the teachers were able to give their full attention to their students and make sure no kid is left behind. And the fact that we were able to experience college firsthand, by taking college classes at Hunter College in our senior year helped so much when I actually entered college.', "I like how it's a small school and all the teachers and students know each other, it creates a lot of strong relationships. I also like all the opportunities it has given me, like taking classes at Hunter College. I would very much recommend.", 'Great school, and teachers. However, the school building is among others so it can be really annoying to deal with others. The high school is worth it if you want to do your senior year in a college setting.', 'This school is great because the teachers are invested and want to see you do well. They care about your wellbeing and help you mentally and academically.', 'What I like about Manhattan Hunter/Science High School is that it is full of excellent students who can care for others and have interesting activities I can attend to. There is no changes I want from them.', 'Manhattan Hunter Science High School is a qualified and effective institution in preparing high-school students for College and has continued to provide alumni that has potential to change the future.Although, most students over there lack the drive and dedication to create Clubs/Organizations (Extra-curricular activities) given that they are heavily "burdened by the amount of Homework".', "I love how hardworking some of the teachers are and how they put so much effort into making sure their students are understanding the material covered in class. I love the school community. We are a small school, so everyone knows each other, everyone is comfortable with one another. We're like a little family. However, one thing I'd like to see change is offering students more options for classes.", 'I love the school and its easy-going and close knit atmosphere. Every day at this school was not only fun, but improved my education immensely.', "One of the biggest positives about my school is the exposure we get to college life in our senior years. After junior year, we leave the campus and finish our final year at Hunter College where we get to take college courses. I've been excited about this since I started, it's one of my favorite things about MHSHS. If MHSHS were to change anything I think it should be its method in keeping its students from engaging with other schools and working towards forming relationships with them instead. The only time you really ever see any integration between the schools is on the sports teams, but outside of that, I feel that MHSHS remains separated in their own bubble. I liked the sense of unity I felt as a campus once I joined a team and actually got to know students who went to the other schools. I think it's be good for MHSHS to try and create a sense of togetherness"]
column6: ["This is an excellent college preparatory school.  Gives an early start to college through dual enrollment of senior year.  The intimacy of each class works to any student's advantage.", "Like any high school, it has its own ups and down. Mornings can be a little messy, especially with grumpy security guards and waiting in line to get your bags checked through the scanner. However, the teachers are all generally willing to help you as long as you are willing to put in the effort to help yourself. There aren't many interesting clubs, and few students even try to create new ones. Overall, the school is decent in education, but it's definitely not perfect. (Did I mention about how lunch isn't even for eating- it's for homework.)", 'My experience at Manhattan Hunter Science Highschool was amazing. The low number of students in the school made it possible for class sizes to be small and intimate, relationships with teachers and among students were genuine. Everyone in the school knew each other, all the teachers and staff knew me by name! There were many clubs available, I myself participated in a culinary club and teacher club. Thanks to this school being an early college school, I am pursuing my education at Hunter College.', 'Tell others about your experience. What did you like about Manhattan HUnter Science High School? What would you like to see change?', "The school is very small and shares the building with a few other schools. Interaction with those schools isn't the greatest and interaction is inevitable. Those students are rowdy and troublesome. Some of the teachers are extremely helpful and passionate while others are completely unorganized and don't teach.", 'Diverse community. Outgoing individuals. Great bonds with friends. Amazing teachers. Enriching classes like US History and Art History.', 'the school is good. the freedom we get senior year is great because we are at hunter college all the time and we have a college schedule.', "Generally, this school is actually above average than most schools in the city in terms of academics and community. The teachers are genuinely committed in the students' learning and the curriculum continues to expand although it is a small school. However, it is important to note that it is a small school, so there will be some discrepancies compared to a larger school. Nonetheless, it is still a high school worth attending for your four years.", "Overall, I very much enjoyed my experience at this school. There was never a point in my high school career where I stopped learning, and that's what made my time at this school unique. All of the teachers are well-versed in the subjects they teach, and the principal is determined to fight for what he wants for the school.  MHSHS has grown so much since I first started as a freshman, and I can honestly say that I have witnessed that growth. I have no doubt that this school will continue to thrive and be successful in the future. I have never felt so prepared for college, and I can't wait to see what my next 4 years in college hold for me.", 'I like it because it is very organized. Small population. The academics are very excellent. The atmosphere is positive and peaceful.', 'This school has a very tight community and diverse community. Being a student at Manhattan Hunter Science comes with a lot to resources and tools to help you unlock the best characteristics of yourself.', 'Manhattan Hunter Science High School provides a unique experience where seniors take courses as CUNY Hunter College. Although the education that is received is above average for a New York City Public School, the location of the school within MLK is not the best. Having to wait in line every morning to go through metal detectors to attend classes makes the commute much longer.', "My experience at Hunter has been absolutely terrible. Most of the teachers are terrible and underqualified, there have been numerous bullying incidents (both teachers bullying students and other students bullying their peers) which have gone without consequence, and the general consensus is that most if not all students either do not have the will to come to school every day because of how horrible it is or are miserable and unheard by staff. I truly believe my score was generous; there are very few key staff members that care about students and the truth is we all just can't wait to get off of MLK campus and get to the college.", 'Teachers are super caring and attentive.  However, there is a lot of pressure for students to pursue STEM careers.  The school itself only has activities primarily targeting STEM careers while neglecting humanities.', 'Hunter isna great schooo. The staff are good teachers and they help you understand a topic if you do not get it the first time. They will help you in any way they can in and out of the classroom. Even if you are at home all you have to do is shoot the teacher you want a message at a decent hour and they will respond. The school itself is great. There is artwork hanging around and the ceiling is painted in different colors in different hallways. It really livens up the space. MHSHS is a really good school.', 'As a student at Manhattan Hunter Science High School, I can personally state that this is a school that cares for their students. This is shown through the way teachers are always available for their students. In addition, this scholl helps provide college and career readiness.', "Our MHSHS family has always provided us with a safe and homely environment to grow and learn in. MHSHS truly believes that every moment of our life is a learning experience, and no matter what, education will bring unlimited opportunities for us. One thing that truly differentiates us from other school is our constant urge and yearning to learn and work hard. Being part of an early high school college is a very selective experience. Being a senior in high school, I am already taking classes and having a college experience in CUNY's Hunter College. MHSHS is a selective school. Of 7000 applications, only 100 seats are available. MHSHS has immense opportunities and a breathtaking effort towards all its students.", 'I didnt like how some scholarships required you to sign up for more emails or take surveys, but it gave me a bunch of ones that didnt so thats good', 'What I liked about my high school was that it was very small, and we had a close community with everyone, no matter which grade we were in. Another thing I enjoyed about my high school, was that it prepared me for college. Since this was an early college high school, we got to go to Hunter College our senior year, and experience college for ourselves. And from freshman to junior year, we are relentlessly trained, and shown, how to go about integrating into college. This was also a pretty diverse school, with many encouraging teachers and advisors. One of the only things I found negative, was how intense there was academic competition between students, and many kids stressed from five hours of homework every night. ', 'Honestly, this school is amazing. The environment is great and the teachers are so supportive. All students are treated with respect and provided with the help they deserve. ']

column2: ['I like that the school offers a big variety of elective classes and also the opportunity to attend Boces to that students can make a determination as to what they would like to do for the future before they even get into college.  They also have a great music program that enables students to expand their knowledge and work different areas of the brain.There is a great support system at the High School!', "My time at Suffern High School was one that I will truly never forget. I made a lot of friends as well as learned who in fact was not my friend. The food wasn't the best but unit lunch made up for it.", 'I really enjoyed the diverse student body as well as the wide variety of opportunities available, both academically and socially. There is a lot of opportunity to explore interests, both academic and non-academic, via clubs and other extracurriculars.', 'The teachers there work in your best interest. They are very helpful and try to get the best student out of you. The school is in really good condition and safe. There are a wide variety of classes that students can take too which allow students to make their schedule personalized to their interests.', 'Great school.  Most of the teachers will go out of their way to help you when you need it.  There are a lot of opportunities to do what you like, whether its sports, art, music, theater or even quidditch.', 'Suffern Senior High School is an excellent place to get an education and grow up. The school achieves for academic excellance. Overall diverse and contains a balance of education and extracurriculars. Excellent sports programs that are very successful at the court and sectional levels. Teachers are expeirienced and devoted to students to get better every day and achieve success. Unique block rotatin schedule and unit lunch that allows student interactions between all grade levels.', 'It was ok. The teachers were great with a few exceptions. The athletics, music, and other extra curriculars are all fantastic. Cafeteria food is bad', 'The teachers are very qualified in their fields. There is an immense variety of clubs and activities to join.', "My experiences at Suffern High School were quite extraordinary. The amount of clubs and varsity athletics the schools has to offer are remarkable. Through clubs like DECA, Spanish Honor Society, and many more, I have been able to create friendships and bonds that will last forever. I have also been able to acquire many leadership skills and confidence through success in these clubs. What is unique about Suffern High School is its diversity and the close knit relationships formed throughout the school. There is truly nothing I would change about the school, it's a great atmosphere with amazing opportunities, what's not to love?", 'Suffern High School is a place where everyone can be themselves and getting some of the best education in the country. Our teachers are there for us to help during or after hours.  Students work together with one another in their classes as well as independently to to achieve academic success. We have many clubs and activities that students can participate in and do the things they enjoy. They are able express their creativity and talents through these clubs.  Sports are a big part of suffern high school. Wins in games and athletic achievement are greatly promoted. One thing I would change in suffern high school is showing more appreciation for other clubs and activities around the school for example: art achievements, music achievements, engineering achievements and many other achievements through students extracurricular activities.  Suffern high school should be proud their sports as well as the many other activities that take place.', 'I like how diverse the school is and how helpful all of the teachers are. Whenever you need help the teachers are always willing to sit down and help you. I also always feel safe in school.', 'Skip to Main ContentNiche HomeReview Suffern Senior High SchoolSuffern Central School District, NY · 9-12Rate your overall experience with Suffern Senior High School100+ charactersTell others about your experience. What did you like about Suffern Senior High School? What would you like to see change?Rate the following about Suffern Senior High SchoolAcademicsN/ADiversityN/ATeachersN/ACollege ReadinessN/AClubs & ActivitiesN/ASafetyN/ASchool CultureN/AAdministrationN/ASportsN/AFoodN/AResourcesN/AFacilitiesN/AParent InvolvementN/AHow are you connected to', 'This is an amazing school. I was given dozens of paths to take on my way to graduation. If you are willing try your hardest here, you will succeed. I recommend that if a new family is looking for a district to move to, this is the one.', 'Fantastic academics, sports, and music and arts programs. Dedicated teachers who are available for extra help. A lot of opportunities to be involved in school activities and clubs.', 'Suffern High School is a very cliquey environment with no openness to change. Once a friend group is formed, no other person can join the friend group. You cannot change your reputation once established. Nobody will give you the chance to change because the school is close minded.', 'It’s aiii boring , principles care too much about unimportant stuff when there are currently way bigger issues. Teachers suck n bully the kids. Ehh would switch out.', 'Suffern is a very diverse and welcoming school. It gives great opportunities to get us ready for college with countless amounts of unique electives, AP courses from Seton Hall University, and an amazing staff.', 'Suffern High School has many resources available to the students. The technology is new and innovative, and the administration is always looking for new ways to prepare the students for college. There are many diverse clubs to join, and one can create his own club if he wants. Great school 10/10 recommend', 'The music department is my favorite past of this school. It’s phenomenal. The annual musicals are amazing.', 'Suffern High School, in spite of all its minor imperfections, provides superior stepping stones for college and life beyond high school. Teachers and staff make themselves readily available to guide students towards their college and professional careers. In addition to offering websites to help students navigate the college-hunting process, the administration also organizes a plethora of events such as college information seminars.That being said, there are some realms in which I find Suffern High School may be lacking; Namely, the school\'s business courses. Preparing for the "real world" involves garnering a very broad set of skills, ranging from interpersonal communication, certain educational backgrounds, and an understanding of the ever-expanding role of finance in one\'s everyday life. Suffern High School offers several Finance related courses, however it is my perception such courses are underfunded, understaffed, and given less attention than they deserve.']

Teachers and staff make themselves readily available to guide students towards their college and professional careers. In addition to offering websites to help students navigate the college-hunting process, the administration also organizes a plethora of events such as college information seminars.That being said, there are some realms in which I find Suffern High School may be lacking; Namely, the school\'s business courses. Preparing for the "real world" involves garnering a very broad set of skills, ranging from interpersonal communication, certain educational backgrounds, and an understanding of the ever-expanding role of finance in one\'s everyday life. Suffern High School offers several Finance related courses, however it is my perception such courses are underfunded, understaffed, and given less attention than they deserve.']
column6: ["I have had two boys graduate and one more to go. Can't say that every teacher is a winner but overall I am very impressed by the caliber and character of the teachers.", 'The health and safety staff are great at caring for the students needs and everything prepared for emergencies.', 'I got to join many clubs and honors societies such as National Honors Society, Science Honors Society, History Honors Society, Art Honors Society, etc.', 'I liked that we had a rotating schedule where instead of having all 8 class period in a day, we had 6 class periods and the schedule rotated throughout the week so we would get a chance to have each class at least 3 times a week. This allowed us to have longer class periods than if we were to have all 8 periods in a day. Also, we had unit lunch meaning that all grades had lunch together.', 'Great school! Taught me everything from education related things to social matters.', "I've never felt unsafe at school.", 'The amount of extracurricular activities available is amazing. I never knew there were high school bowling teams until I came to Suffern.', 'Parents of Suffern High School students are very supportive of the schools successes. From attending sporting events to holding PTA meetings, I feel that parents have had a great presence at school. The only reason I beleive that the parental presence is great and not the best is because sometimes students use thier parents to get what they want, to interfere in students problems.', "Comparing my experiences at SHS to other schools that I have attended, I feel that Suffern High School has truly great teachers. And these teachers are the ones who provide us with opportunities that weren't available at my old school in Lodi New Jersey. Therefore, I genuinely do appreciate all the teachers that I've had at Suffern because they've all taught valuable lessons not only for the class but for life. From Dr.Wilson's fun-filled AP Language and Literature class to Mrs.Greer's dreaded but exciting AP Biology class, I'm sure that I wouldn't have been able to discover who I am without all of these amazing teachers who have gone far and beyond to help each and every one of their students succeed.", 'The school has a lot of great opportunities.', 'School is pretty safe plus the security guards get to know the students.  I feel comfortable there.', 'There are about 400 clubs at the school varying in different subjects.  If someone can not find a club they would like to join they can always grab 2 friends and an advisor and start their own!!', 'There are a lot of electives, which allows you to learn about different things.  There is also a lot of school pride.', 'The teachers are knowledgable, supportive and approachable. They create a good environment for learning.', 'I love that this school has club and sports for everybody no matter what your interests are. I personally joined the Marching band and made some of my best friends from it.', 'I personally love the teachers that  I have had at this school. They always want to help the students do well, especially knowing that this effects their transcript for college.', 'Many people judge everyone. peer pressure is imminent', 'Challenging and strenuous at times. Brings out best', 'Enforced and resolute policies. Lenient but strict', 'Vigorous when it comes to sports and competitive']

column2: ["It's a good school that prepares you well for college. However, a few students here and there constantly get away with being discriminatory towards others. I wish my school would change this aspect. Other than that, the resources are great, the support is the best it could be, and even though there will always be the one or two teachers you don't like, most of the teachers are supportive as well.", 'East Brunswick high school has taught me many things. It taught me how to succeed in my academic life and in my personal life as well. When I was in East Brunswick high school, I was having so much fun and was learning so much about life. East Brunswick high school prepared me for the college life so that I may be successful and not be overwhelmed. East Brunswick high school is where I made most of my friends which can be like networking and might help me get a good job in the future and also making friends gives me a beautiful support system that I could not imagine.', 'Great teachers, great facilities, excellent extracurricular activities and sports available to students. Counselors and administration are very supportive of academic endeavors.', 'East Brunswick High School has been the home of my education for the last four years. East Brunswick High School, known as EBHS, has given me the tools to succeed to the best of my abilities when I go to college next Fall. The teachers that I have had over the years have been extremely supportive and encouraging and I feel like I could have turned to them to talk about anything. During my time at the high school so far, I have made friendships that I know for sure will last after high school. I believe that this was possible because of the culture that EBHS promoted, so that there is a balance between social and academic life.', 'I enjoyed the rigor of the academics as it forced me to challenge myself and expand my knowledge in the fields that interest me. Not only that, but it was a very diverse community, and I got to interact with many different students through the immense clubs offered here. On top of all that, this year, they issued new Lenovo Thinkpads for every student, as well as introducing the online resource Canvas, creating a more future/college ready environment for us students.', 'East Brunswick has a very dedicated staff that do their best to make the students experience as good as it can be.   There is a lot of focus on academics as well as many clubs and activities.   It is quite competitive with many bright students.   Most of them found that they are well prepared for college.', 'Great academics, would like to see more student collaboration and kindness. The teachers are very knowledgeable but many do not teach the material thoroughly, specifically in higher level classes.', 'East Brunswick High School is filled with healthy competition which pushes students to work harder in order to achieve their highest goals. Most of the staff is helpful, however, they can be intimidating and discourage students from asking questions. The environment is diverse and the counselors are very helpful when students need help with scheduling and college.', 'EBHS is hands down the best school in the area and has immensely prepared me for a successful future.', 'It has been a very good experience. It really has opened up lots of doors for me. For me I have always been a dancer but I really realized that I also love school.', 'East Brunswick High School is very academically and athletically driven. They never want to see you fail and push you to do your very best.', 'There are too many activities to count so it was very easy to get involved and meet new people. The staff also listens to the students and works with us to make it more of a student driven school. The school has a bigger population of students but is well managed in most cases, some class sizes may be larger depending on scheduling with around 25-30 students on average per class.  Opportunities such as late in and early out for seniors and co-op for students with jobs allow for more choices in how your high school experience is driven.', 'East Brunswick High School is overall a high achieving school with special focus on academics and the arts. The staff and administration try to provide students with the best opportunities for success, with numerous clubs and programs that enhance the educational experience. The athletic programs are also very distinguished, but they can be used more to promote school spirit. EBHS has only the best, most dedicated, and most experienced teachers. However, at times the administration ostracizes itself from the students, and the environment does not always feel 100% safe.', "While I did not have a poor time attending this school, I also did not have a great time attending this high school. There was no time for one-on-one after school learning unless you were a teacher's favorite. Other than that I was able to graduate by teaching myself the right things to do to graduate from the school. My sister, on the other hand, has been going to this school for some time now and they do not accommodate to anyone with a mental illness. They say they will help anyone because they are inclusive, but when someone has a mental illness, they don't really care. My sister suffers from chronic migraines which can be very debilitating. Does East Brunswick High School care? Not one bit. Unless you or your child is someone that can give the school numbers and a good graduation rate, you don't matter to the school system. Save yourself the trouble of fighting with a school system that doesn't even care about their children in the first place.", 'East Brunswick is a very diverse school, with great teachers and resources to help you grow as a student. The student body can, however, be a bit toxic, especially with the intense academic competition. Students are willing to go to extreme lengths for success, even if that is amoral or unhealthy.', "I attended EBHS for two years only since I moved from another country and it's been nothing but a pleasure to meet all the staff and students helping me out! They introduced me to the culture and supported me during the past two years. Teachers were responsible and responsive. They would answer any questions students had and provide extra feedback whenever is possible!", "My experience at East Brunswick high school was average. We are for sure a good school in terms of academics, but the school lacks in care for its students. There have been multiple times where the student body has had to speak out against administration, and it seemed as if the school only worked with its students to quiet them and protect its reputation instead of due to actual care. Most of the teacher's are fairly caring and nice, but the administration needs improvement. They care more about things such as dress code than real problems. In my opinion they need to better their priorities. However, the academic level is very high and I do believe the school has academically prepared me for college. I learned many skills from the AP and honors level classes at the high school. The level of those classes is very high and I know several alumni who have said ebhs classes really did help them once they reached college.", 'I ordered a salad from the Asian lunch lady. I did NOT order carrots. When I sat down and started eating the lettuce, I saw a carrot. Truly a sad moment in American history.', 'Its so boring here, Periodt. People are mad fake and toxic. A lot of racial issues. The rules are strict. Teachers are rude and mean.', 'I like how East Brunswick gives you oppurtunities. The harder you work, the more advanced classes that you may apply for. There’s always a harder level for those who are willing to explore their capabilities. One thing I would change is definitely the workload. I feel like it could be lessened.']

column6: ['East Brunswick high school is a very safe, diverse environment. It provides you with many clubs to interact with different people, it also prepares you for the future and you leave the school with long lasting friendships.', "So far, I have enjoyed my time at EBHS. I feel more than ready for college, and I genuinely feel as though I have learned a lot from my courses and from my teachers. There are several resources at hand for whatever it is we need help with, and there is always someone you can turn to for assistance, whether it be school related or something personal. If it's one thing that needs improvement, it is the sense of school spirit. Athletics are a pretty big part of the high school experience, and since most of the spirit lies here, it is important that the student body make more of an effort to support all that is great about the school.", 'This is a great school! The teachers are personable and the academics are valued greatly. It is clear the students are cared about. Also, the work load will teach the students responsibility and the rigor is comparable to college rigor.', 'This high school that is located in East Brunswick is without a doubt a school that I enjoy going here. The Academics and teachers that are present at EBHS certainly push you to be ready for and they are helpful when you are having trouble with an assignment. Generally, I feel safe going to school and whenever there is an issue, it is handled right away as the security guards care for our safety. The student body is very diverse with people from different cultures attending classes so it can make it really easy to befriend someone. Overall, this is a high school that I am proud to attend and I could not imagine myself being enrolled at a different high school.', 'I like how East Brunswick was so diverse in its students and academically rigorous. However, I would like to see more teachers who go beyond the expectation for their students. During my time at EBHS I definitely had teachers that helped me both in and out of the classroom. From discussing real life issues to general confusion EBHS definitely has teachers that will talk about anything to benefit the student. To contrast, there are teachers who are definitely the opposite and while they rarely teach their own subject matter, will not be understanding or helpful to the students in real distress.', 'East Brunswick High School\'s population of about 700 students per graduating class fosters an environment of competitive nature, pushing students to gain skills such as public speaking, effective communication, creative thinking, and problem solving. Despite all these academic benefits, the school\'s diversity is one of the most defining traits. Growing up in such a diverse community has taught me acceptance of other races, genders, ethnicities, and religions. Our classes have always offered challenges, each another step towards learning to handle any task or difficulty thrown at us.  Because we see that our diversity is a strength, not a diverging point, friend groups stray from the typical cliches in movies, often distinguishing between "mean kids" from the "nerds" or the "jocks". Rather, we understand that different mixes of cultures and interests make us unique. Though I may not know each of the 699 other people in my grade, I know each of us is set up with a foundation to succeed.', 'The academics here at East Brunswick High School were top notch having an edge over surrounding high schools. Despite such educational programs, the   school overall is deemed to receive a low rating because the majority of the teachers are not willing to aid their students and rely on the internet for student teaching. Additionally, the facility is run down with many leaks. Finally, the school spirit is lacking because the teachers rarely encourage the students to participate in student and teaching bonding.', 'East Brunswick High School is a place where students are able to grow and discover their own paths before college.   The resources available allow students to expand upon their education and use technology to create unique approaches to assignments. The adminstration are super helpful in guiding students through their high school career and preparing them for the future.', 'East Brunswick is one of the top school in the state of New Jersey and it is known for the high level and challanging classes that prepare students to take college classes.', 'My experience has been very benign with this high school. The staff  are very upstanding. They take education to a whole new level, especially the honors and AP teachers. However, the administration is very poor. They tend to lean towards the Jewish students with decisions. Classes they are hard to get in because of low scores are easily wavier for white students, much harder for Asians and Indians alike.', 'Here at East Brunswick High School students are offered plenty of opportunities ranging from high standard academics to competitive state-ranked sports teams.  Our motto, "Excellence in the academics, athletics, and the arts" is stressed with the utmost pride as we rank at #4 in https://www.niche.com/k12/search/best-public-high-schools/c/middlesex-county-nj/.', 'I really enjoy how many opportunities EBHS has for academically  gifted students.  The whole environment feels safe, fun and challenging.', 'East Brunswick High School truly prepared its students for college. The school was extremely diverse and everyone got along well . In addition, the faculty was outstanding and everyone was willing to help out.', 'East Brunswick High School was a great place to learn and prepare myself for what is to come in college. I always pushed myself to do my best and take the hardest classes, and EBHS enabled me to do this, utilizing a great faculty and syllabus to allow me to succeed in these classes and beyond.', 'I would like to see a change in administration and teachers. The administration kind of bullies students and faculty in submission. They threaten with all sorts of punishments if anything is bound to happen even on the last day of school. They don\'t help or review and give fair judgement to issues. I feel like they\'re extremely biased. Some of the teachers don\'t particularly help or teach, they give excuses like "I don\'t have time to you guys this" or "ask your classmates first" and even after they still refuse to help. Some just don\'t do a good job of teaching', 'A very diverse group of students who were friendly and helpful. Although there was a big mix of people everybody seemed connected in some way through friendships. Teachers heightened this experience by also being friendly and helpful. Allowing this environment to be full of only positivity.', 'I loved how involved the teachers and the staff were. When i needed help they would always find a solution for me that would work out. If i had a problem at school the administration would do everything they can to help me solve my problem.', 'As an alum of this high school I can see how well they prepared me for college and the work ethic they put into their students. That being said, it was not the best school for a student the academics were there but not much else in terms of facilities.', "It's a great community that has nice people but also a challenging atmosphere.  there are many opportunities to challenge yourself but there is also room to do what you want.   There are many clubs that anyone can join and it's a great way to meet people with similar interests.", "My experience at East Brunswick High School has been very positive throughout all my years. The teachers are very helpful and they care about our future. They support students in every way possible. The security is really good, there was not one time when I didn't feel safe in school."]
