Allowing this environment to be full of only positivity.', 'I loved how involved the teachers and the staff were. When i needed help they would always find a solution for me that would work out. If i had a problem at school the administration would do everything they can to help me solve my problem.', 'As an alum of this high school I can see how well they prepared me for college and the work ethic they put into their students. That being said, it was not the best school for a student the academics were there but not much else in terms of facilities.', "It's a great community that has nice people but also a challenging atmosphere.  there are many opportunities to challenge yourself but there is also room to do what you want.   There are many clubs that anyone can join and it's a great way to meet people with similar interests.", "My experience at East Brunswick High School has been very positive throughout all my years. The teachers are very helpful and they care about our future. They support students in every way possible. The security is really good, there was not one time when I didn't feel safe in school."]

column2: ['Great school, great teachers, great culture. Nothing to complain, all the teachers care about the students and makes sure each student as an equal opportunity to learn and grow, not only as students but as people.', 'Metuchen High School has many amazing teachers and students. There are various classes to choose from as well as clubs, sports, and extracurricular activities to help students to get involved.', 'Metuchen High School is the worst place on earth. It destroys students. It kills them. The staff cares nothing for what the students need. Even when the kids have done nothing wrong they will find something to get them for. And they have no sympathy. The students themselves are terrible. No one cares about each other. Everyone goes behind everyone’s back. They tell you that you should kill yourself and think it’s okay. And yet they receive no punishment for such things. I wish I could give it no stars because it deserves absolutely nothing.', "Metuchen High School is a great school for your child. The classes are challenging, the staff are very friendly, and the extra-curricular's are very fun.", 'Most of the teachers at Metuchen High are genuinely passionate about what they teach. They care to connect with students who come to school to learn.', "I had a fantastic experience at Metuchen High School. I was given the opportunity to branch out, explore my interests, and really develop my personality. The teachers here are really amazing - they are so invested in their students' learning and will go to great lengths to help them excel.", 'Mixed bag of good and bad teachers but overall when the teachers are good they are great and the atmosphere brings everyone together.', 'I enjoyed my time here at Metuchen high school, I would have liked a little bit more of a challenge  academically.', 'MHS is a relatively small school, but given its size, it still has a lot to offer. There are tons of different AP and honors level courses and a good share of electives. The teachers tend to be very passionate as well and make for great classes. However, there is much room for improvement such as new clubs, more classes,  promoting diversity more, etc.', 'I liked the wide array of available club options and ways to get involved at Metuchen High School. There are plenty of ways to get involved from music, to sports, to theater. One problem with the school is the size. Each year the class sizes grow and there is not enough room for everyone passing in the hallways between class and in the classrooms. Some of the teachers are amazing and will truly help and encourage you while others are not the best educators and make enjoying school difficult at times.', "The courses offered at MHS are varied, and they definitely allow students to explore any passion or interest they have. While I appreciate the school's effort to open a more encompassing Program of Studies, the faculty in some fields definitely have more experience and passion than others.", 'What I like about Metuchen High School is the atmosphere, due to how small it is everyone is friendly and kind and in bad and good times we all come together as a community.', "I love my teachers, but not so much the students. I've been bullied frequently but I absoutely adore my education and classes, they're a lot of fun. I just wish the art department got more funding.", 'I like the teachers at Metuchen High and I feel like they all have been the defining factor for my experience being as positive as it has been. They have inspired me to believe in myself.', 'Overall it was okay. There are some really good teachers, and many who are bad. The students pursue a diverse range of interests including music, sports, and academics, which enhances the school community. Unfortunately the sports coaches and Athletic Director are all biased. It is hard to score the school as a whole because there are some great things and other terrible ones.', 'I am currently a senior and I can say that Metuchen High School is an amazing place for students to learn. The teachers in the english and math department have taught me so much. However I would like to say that the Science department is not that great. Overall everyone at school is very friendly and welcoming. I have never once felt pressure or belittled.', 'The school offers many different clubs from art and academic to student council and volunteer opportunities.  The kids are able to start a club as long as they can get a teacher to be an adviser.', 'Most teachers do a great job.', 'In light of recent shootings around the country, all entry doors except the front door are now locked.  We live in a safe area, but you cannot be too careful.', 'Although it is a small school, students are given the opportunity to be involved in many activities, clubs and sports.  My children took advantage of this and as a result, learned valuable time management skills.']

column6: ['I have always felt safe here and have never felt threatened in any way. Safety drills are regularly practiced.', "There are a few things missing, but there's something for pretty much everyone. The teachers who advise the clubs are very dedicated and make it a great time.", 'The schools offers a variety of extracurricular programs and really pushes students to excel. While not everything is offered and the science department is lackluster, nearly everything else is above average. I would have no problem choosing this school again.', "Many of the teachers in the English, history, mathematics, and world language departments are very knowledgeable, helpful, and approachable. The only department where the teachers are seriously lacking is the science department. It's not that the science teachers are bad people, but the quality of their teaching leaves much room for improvement.", "This school is horrible. DO NOT send your child here if they are different. And by 'different' I mean if they don't like sports, band, or anything like that because they will be picked on mercilessly and the administration WILL DO S*** to help them. EVEN IF they do like these sorts of things they will most likely be picked on as well, because I saw it happen to kids you'd classify as 'popular'. Seriously if you can afford to send your kid somewhere else PLEASE DO. This school is THE WORST. There are drugs which the school and town is doing NOTHING to control, there's bullying, and the funding is going all to sports which is typical but still. Send your kid somewhere else PLEASE.", "Depending on the teacher you get you will either have an amazing experience, an alright one, or a completely horrible one. I will give three examples of each: I had an English teacher (took him for two different classes because I loved him so much) that was funny, engaging, and would go over all of the material needed for each book so you knew what was going on even if you didn't like English (wasn't the case for me but I still found it helpful). I had a Chemistry teacher who was alright, he couldn't speak very good English but he was very very nice, if not for the in class support teacher in the class though I would have failed. Now let's talk about the horrible... They have many horrible people working for them that should be fired and not made to work with children ever again, people who let students be picked on for no reason except for their own enjoyment. I had a math teacher for example who couldn't do math, and he has a degree in the subject. Myself and other people from his other classes would correct his calculations because he got them wrong. And when you did correct him he wouldn't care. These are his own math equations and he literally wouldn't care that he was giving out wrong answers to his students. I had him twice only because I was forced to, the second time he was supposed to do college prep and didn't. Thanks so much dude, you're the reason I'm paying $800 for Elementary Algebra in college. Should I send you the bill?", 'The school is safe and practices routine lock down procedures.  It requires visitor sign in upon buzzed in entry', 'The level of clubs and activities are diverse enough that everyone can find an interest.', 'Metuchen is a great school because it has a student population that is very diverse.  You have the ability to be involved in a number of clubs and sports due its student size.', 'Very small and very safe.', 'There is an emphasis on sports since the school is so small and most kids are multi sport athletes.', 'High school is whatever you make of it. There are great opportunities and teachers but you have to take advantage of it. The school is a small but very safe environment.', 'Everyone is incredibly nice and friendly, and for the most part they are all good teachers. Most are exceptionally knowledgeable in their field and give interesting lectures.', "Bathrooms are usually dirty. I feel safe in my school, you can sometimes see police officers roaming the hallways. Most teachers don't wear their IDs.", 'There are many clubs offered to students yet many are poorly organized by the teachers.', 'I love the small town vibe and how you know basically everyone in the school. There is a lack of school trips provided. Battle of the Classes is the best extra-curricular offered.', "Some teachers really care about you and that you are getting something out of the class while others shouldn't be teaching because they no longer care about their students.", "Many of the teachers that I had have made an impact in my life, in that I still hear their voices in my head when making decisions, whether it be regarding school or relating to life. Some of them took the time to understand where I was coming from before passing judgment or in order to better help me in my high school career. And so, I'm thankful for many of them and their dedication to the students.", "I have little to never noticed any bullying that goes on in school. We have a lot of programs and assemblies that target bullying and other forms of harassment. I can't give a full, 5-dot rating because there may be bullying beyond the school, whether it be in-person or online; I wouldn't know. And so, I think, from the limited experience I know, the Health & Safety within the school is great.", 'In my opinion, the food variety is great. There are an eclectic array of options, even healthy food options. Although it is pretty pricey, the food is still pretty good. You can get a lot for the standard price.']

column2: ['Had nice teachers and good school for the future. IT WAS nice to have all the resources you needed. Everyone is friendly so you will have a great time', "Smithtown High School West is probably one of the best high schools on Long island. If you look at US rankings, the high school is really low in New York. I think this is dragged down by unmotivated students because there are really intelligent and good teacher's in the district. And, the district continues to spend more money on the latest technology. I think this school deserves to be ranked higher for its premium level education.", 'I have loved my time at Smithtown West thus far and am excited to continue my junior year as I begin to think about college! Smithtown West offers ad an endless amount of classes, allowing everyone to explore their strengths as well as countless extracurriculars ranging from sports to clubs, to honor societies.', 'The music and theatre programs at West showed me that music is something I truly love. It introduced me to all of my best friends and has given me so many great memories over the past 4 years. The teachers in the department were welcoming and kind and overall made my high school experience so much better.', "Throughout my years attending Smithtown High School West, I have grown to love the campus. This is not only because of the long lasting friendships I've made with classmates and staff, but also I love the new architect of the building. This current year we invested in purchasing solar panels to power our school and the other schools surrounding. I believe that this is a very great investment to the Western Campus regarding our world's current environmental status. The one thing I believe we could improve on is including more field trips into the students curriculum.", 'Everything about the school is incredible.  I am always excited to go back because everyone is so friendly and welcoming.  The teachers are incredible and teach us very well.  There are so many clubs to choose from, such as Jazz choir and the Language clubs to student council and even a movie critic club.  Our Sports and Arts programs are some of, if not, the best on the island we always recieve multitudes of awards for various activities .', 'This school helped me feel prepared for college. The counselors really help you with the application process and give you step by step instructions and deadlines to ensure that you are staying on track. While it is not the most diverse school, it is still one of the best districts on the island and is very safe. It has a good academic program and the teachers are all very qualified and there to engage students in learning. The teachers that teach AP classes take their position very seriously and show students what to expect when taking college level courses while preparing them for the AP exam.', "My experience at West began in the 10th grade when I moved from the Caribbean islands, Trinidad and Tobago. It was a very different experience. First of, the environment always felt safe, and the security staff always made sure of it. All of my teachers continuously pushed me to strive throughout their classes all year. I made many friends of which I hope I will be friends with our entire lives. I am currently about to head into my senior year and I'm hoping however, that our school offers more activities and better lounge areas for the students. And maybe also better food ;)", 'I loved Smithtown High School West. They had great Teachers. They were very helpful especially the language teachers. They offered a lot of extra helps. They really help you prepare for college.', 'I had a great experience and everyone is so nice. The teachers really care and so do the administrators. Their is always someone to go to if you need help so you never feel alone in anything. Both me and my brothers were able to spend all four years there and I wouldn’t want to go to any other school. There is a tremendous amount of “west side pride” and it really makes your high school career. The only thing I would change is how early school starts', 'Smithtown High School West is a really good high school, particularly due to some particularly incredible teachers. If not for those teachers, the school would be average at best with a majority of teachers being unexceptional but the really great ones do an incredible job of preparing students for college and life in general. The school also caters to a variety of interests effectively from a very strong business program to science and art. One remarkable way in which the school caters to students interests is through its association with Wilson Tech, in which High School West Students can spend half of there day at Wilson Tech and learn a particular trade. I did not personally participate in the Wilson Tech program, but I have heard good things about it.', 'I have really enjoyed my time at Smithtown High School West. I love being apart of clubs and sports and we have a fun time. Most of the teachers are very nice and admirable. I love how we have a fall pep rally but it would be really cool if we also had a spring one too. While attending Smithtown High School West I have been apart of yearbook, student council, best buddies, freshman kick start and the captain of our cheer team. I have also taken AP classes and been involved in our leadership class where we partake in a numerous amount of charitable events.', 'Very nice school I love the structure of it and idea the towers. There’s a lot of school spirit and the students love to get involved in clubs and sports. The teachers are very helpful in offering extra help both in and out of school. I love west!!', 'The students at Smithtown High School West are fun and very friendly. We all care about each other and understand each other which is what makes us come together. The teachers here also deeply care for their students and their success and are real friends to us all.', 'Academics are a top priority to most people. Everyone cares about their work and you are not frequently surrounded by any negative energy. Even though West Side Pride is an emphasized concept, I’d love to see more school spirit in the future.', 'Pro tip: start caring about the music and theatre departments instead of your mediocre sport teams. Thank you very much.', 'Academic excellence.  Not diverse. District needs to place emphasis on acceptance of all race and various ethnic backgrounds. Teachers are great.', "Loved everything about this high school. Every teacher I've ever had at this school was great. They all prepared me for college and I couldn't be more thankful for that.", 'I went to school here from 2014 to 2018. This is a great place to go to school. The teachers and other faculty are amazing, and each one has been helpful from day one and continue to be now that I am in college.', 'Overall the Education you can receive here is top notch. As long as you challenge yourself and take advantage of the educational opportunities the school provides, you will be well prepared for college.']

column6: ['Smithtown High School West is a very good high school part of an overall strong school district. The instructors in the school are all teaching their subject of specialty so each student is guaranteed the best instruction in each of their classes. After school clubs are mostly student run but have faculty advisors who are dedicated to seeing the club and its students grow and expand their experiences. The sports have coaching staff that are fully experienced and knowledgable on growing each athletes skills and talent. The biggest complaint for the district would be how one of the middle schools are split between the two high schools. It makes it difficult for the transition between 8th and 9th grade.', "I have had a great experience at Smithtown High School West. I'm not in the popular crowd, sports, but I have found my way at SHSW and have been very successful and enjoyed my four years there.  I am grateful for all the experiences, good and bad. Going to SHSW has gotten me ready to go out into the world prepared to start college and live an adult life. I continue to learn about life experience and have an open mind to learn what's ahead of me.", 'Not once in my experience at Smithtown West have I felt threatened or unsafe. The faculty and staff goes above and beyond to create a very safe environment for all students.', 'Smithtown West provides students with great extracurricular activities of all kinds, from drama clubs, to sports, to arts and music: Smithtown provides it all.', 'The Smithtown school district provides students with a great overall experience, from academics to athletics and beyond. Great and safe environment.', "All teachers in the Smithtown Central School District go above and beyond to provide students with the best education possible. They genuinely care about the students' well-being and knowledge they are obtaining.", 'Some teachers are very difficult to work with because they put their subject ahead of others.', 'Bullying goes unpunished and administration is argumentative, rude, and ineffective. Nurses ignore sickness or allergies unless it is accompanied by a high fever, teachers act any way they please outside of class even if their behavior is highly inappropriate. Security is split between hardworking caring offices and complacent ones who allow any behavior.  Health courses are taught by either dedicated teachers or gym teachers who are not qualified and push religious beliefs over health facts.', 'All clubs are mostly positive environments as the students there are there because they enjoy it.', 'As an individual this school provided great oppertunites for growth and betterment.', 'Each teacher is an individual, and while some have varied methods, on the whole they are all fantastic, caring and helpful. They all excel in their fields of study and project an enthusiasm for their subject.', 'Many options are available, sports, academic, theatre, art, student run organization/politics. There is something for everyone and the school is accommodating for new ideas.\r I was on Kickline, practiced everyday and did competitions at NCC and Orlando FL.', 'They provide a lot of activities inside and outside of school hours such as student run programs, dances, field days, senior days. Sports events are well planned and very student friendly. The athletic program is great.', 'The teaching staff is always well prepared, approachable, and understanding. They work with the students and are very student centered. Very accommodating and provide appropriate assistance when needed.', 'We have so many different clubs. We have national honor societies and mock trial, sports and philosophy, theatre and music as well as community service clubs.', 'I would most certainly choose this school again. I love the drama department. We are such a close knit group but we are also very welcoming and accepting of new recruits unlike the sports teams. We all work so hard to create fantastic productions.', "We have such a wide variety of teachers that all teach with different styles so even if you do not understand something that your own teacher is trying to show you, you can go and ask another teacher to explain it. Most of our teachers are so nice and approachable and they really care about the students. For example, if you get a really bad grade on a test and you normally do well, your teacher will ask if everything's all right and will usually let you retake it. Plus, our teachers are so intelligent that you can ask a physics teacher about a history problem and they will know the answer. Most teachers give grades back within the week, if not the next day. It's wonderful to be part of a district with amazing leaders but it really is a shame that the clubs they advise such as the theatre club or the stage tech club do not receive nearly as much funding as we deserve.", 'There are many clubs and after school sports as well as opportunities for community service and awards.', 'I would choose this school all over again because of the friends I have made and getting to know their families was a huge part of my life.  Also, all of the sports programs were competitive and enjoyable to play in and watch.', 'The teachers care about the students to a certain extent but sometimes do not offer outside help.']
column8: ['Smithtown High School West is a very good high school part of an overall strong school district. The instructors in the school are all teaching their subject of specialty so each student is guaranteed the best instruction in each of their classes. After school clubs are mostly student run but have faculty advisors who are dedicated to seeing the club and its students grow and expand their experiences. The sports have coaching staff that are fully experienced and knowledgable on growing each athletes skills and talent. The biggest complaint for the district would be how one of the middle schools are split between the two high schools. It makes it difficult for the transition between 8th and 9th grade.', "I have had a great experience at Smithtown High School West. I'm not in the popular crowd, sports, but I have found my way at SHSW and have been very successful and enjoyed my four years there.  I am grateful for all the experiences, good and bad. Going to SHSW has gotten me ready to go out into the world prepared to start college and live an adult life. I continue to learn about life experience and have an open mind to learn what's ahead of me.", 'Not once in my experience at Smithtown West have I felt threatened or unsafe. Also, all of the sports programs were competitive and enjoyable to play in and watch.', 'The teachers care about the students to a certain extent but sometimes do not offer outside help.']

column2: ['Glen Ridge high school is overall a great experience. The food sucks, it is disgusting many people get food poisoning, the student body is great everyone goes to events and our sport teams are great , we win the section every year mostly for every sport', "I did not like Glen Ridge High School. It is incredibly competitive and the teachers give unnecessary work. Deforestation is primarily caused by these teachers, they give more busy work than papers that will benefit our education. Their substitute teachers are perhaps worse than the work. They are strict and rude. They do not seem to care about the students or respect them in the slightest. Speaking of respect, the teachers certainly look down on the students.  It's clear that the teachers have high egos and believe they are always correct. Of course, I have problems with school in general, so perhaps I am not being fair. My main problem with this school is that it is made for certain students. Kids who want to learn the facts and excel at standardized tests. There isn't wiggle room for creativity and culture.", "In my three years attending this school so far, it is just as clique-y and awful as the previous ones. The Guidance counselors are all awful and get too involved with students and don't give anyone space to breath. The school is too small to accommodate the students from all 6grades. The rich kids can get away with whatever & there is a lot of drug use and bullying that goes on at this school. You are pretty much stuck with the same 90-100 kids from ages 7-18 and it is awful because everyone knows everything about everyone so unless you're rich and popular, you end up with no friends by the time you're a junior. Most of the teachers can behave horribly and not get fired. There was a Sub who repeatedly said the 'N-word' despite being white and received no punishment", 'Extremely stressful environment. Lots of social and academic pressure that makes for a poor environment for the education of young adults.', 'Overall, Glen Ridge High School is a good school. The teachers are (mostly) fantastic and really seem to care about the kids. With a high rate of sending kids to college and lots of AP offerings, it pushes kids to take on high level classes. However, there is a big issue in that. Many kids are pressured into taking more AP/honors classes than they feel comfortable. On the flip side, the non honor/AP classes are a joke. This makes dedicated students wary of taking these classes, so they’ll take an AP. This makes the stress levels very high. Glen Ridge is also a bit of a party town—at least we think we are. That rigid social dynamic tends to blend itself into GRHS. Especially where jocks tend to think they’re extremely superior. The administration and teachers care deeply, you’ll be thouroughly challenged, and they will help send you to a good college. Though there are things to dislike, it’s a pretty good school compared to every other in America.', 'Very competitive school, but a small class size. Everyone knows each other, and most teachers are very capable, but in the recent years there has been a high turnover rate in staff and administration. The administration is often incompetent or out of touch, at every level.', 'It’s very nice school everything condsidered. Teachers are very good most students take AP’s. There are many clubs and activities. The school prepares you very well for college and for the SAT or ACT.', 'Was not happy there once. As someone who chose not to play a sport brushed off as an outcast. Music and arts programs get so little funding they had to start their own organization. Many teachers are unqualified in the feild they are teaching and just find PowerPoints from the Internet. Workload is insane even the seventh graders have at least 3 or 4 hours of homework and studying. Not much is done about violence, especially if the violent student plays a sport. Think i cried everyday I went there and Sundays as well', 'Great academics, really prepares you well for college and after that. The fact that it is a small schools allows for everyone to know everyone, work together, and teachers really care about students.', "My experience was definitely a good one, not the classic high school stories of getting pushed into lockers of the dreaded weggies every freshman fears. The truth is my high school was one where everyone was friends with everyone else, or at least in my case, I was friends with the 'nerds' and the jocks with the days being fun. The school was never decrepit but the locker rooms stunk like axe body spray. I had a great high school experience but it's one of those things that you look back on and say that was fun.", 'I liked how Glen Ridge High School is a small but interconnected community. Everyone knows each other well, and everyone looks after one another. Safety is taken very seriously and strong communication helps a lot.', 'I graduated from GRHS in 2014, and I think it was a pretty good school! Not a very diverse town, so that’s why I gave it 2 stars for that. I personally didn’t feel too ready for college because of the classes I took, but I am actually doing very well in my courses. I was in the band all four years, and the music program is HUGE here, so it’s taken very seriously. A lot of the teachers at GRHS are pretty good too, but honestly some aren’t.', 'Great school but very cliquey. School spirit is great. Academics is amazing. Prepare you for future.', 'Academically, this school is second to none. They prepare you AMAZING for college and your future. Teachers for the most part want to help you, and do. However, the student population is what made my experience somewhat awful. School is EXTREMELY cliquee. The "popular" kids rule the school and are genuinely mean people. They are arrogant, spoiled, judgemental, immature, etc. That being said, there are students who aren\'t like that, but not too many. The popular kids spend almost every weekend partying, drinking, and sometimes drugs. The parents allow the kids to partake in this. This school is run by peer pressure and I found it hard to fit in, as I never attended parties and wasn\'t part of a main clique. Overall though, I enjoyed the activities I did participate in and had a small group of friends who didn\'t party and drink. Like I said before, the academics are amazing and this school prepared me so well for my future I can\'t explain it enough.', 'There are a lot of high level, challenger courses.', 'I participate in a lot of different clubs and I find some to be better than others. Most of the main ones are great but smaller ones are poorly run and not as fun.', 'I came to this school because it is the public school for the town I live in. But if I got to choose where to go I would definately choose this school. It is what you make of it.', 'Some teachers are better than others. Some give busy work and unfair assessments, while others give interesting lessons. It is easy to seek out the best teachers. And the ones that are good are great!', 'Some of the administration is great--Ms. Kobalynski got me through my years there. English teachers are the best people in the world, especially Pollak, Balaschak, and Hackmeyer. Some of the teachers do suck, but you can get through it. Too much pressure placed on getting into an "elite college", however, and state schools are under appreciated. The underground queer community is great and super supportive, and the administration is openly pro-queer rights. (Gender neutral bathrooms are located by the gym) The administration (particularly Ms. Petrosino and Mr. Heitmann) are not sensitive to mental health issues and clearly need more education on the matter. Overall, amazing education, and even though the student body can be cookie cutter, the girls are all very nice. The boys are (mostly) all fratty and preppy, but you can find your people outside of them', 'Amazing English program, amazing art program, amazing social science programs.']

column6: ['So many activities offered here, and a great way to make friends if you feel alone. Drama Club, Feminist Club, and GSA are very welcoming, although car club is full of rude boys.', 'The English department is incredible, especially the honors teachers. The math and science departments are hit/miss, with some teachers (Dancho!) being amazing, and others (Tully) not so much. History department is full of superstars like Ms. Lynch and Ms. Cerone. Language department is 50/50, because the Spanish program is incredible, but the French program is lacking at the higher levels. Overall, if you stick to old favorites (Balaschak, Lynch, Dancho, Pollak, Price, Chiang), and avoid more questionable teachers (Batastini, Tully, Erickson), you should be fine.', 'The nurse sucks (never in her room) but everything else is good', "There are a bunch of options and it's not hard to start a club but student involvement and upkeep is weak", 'I felt quite supported for the most past', 'I only had 1 or 2 very bad teachers', 'Students are competitive in this school and strive to get good grades. Many students are pressured to take honors and AP classes by peers, teachers and parents which makes many students stressed and overwhelmed with the workload.', 'Most teachers are available during lunch or after school if students need extra help.', 'Nurse never seems to be in the office.', 'Very easy to get involved in extracurriculars.', "Good academics.. mostly based on the student's part. Teachers are usually there to help, but I feel that most of the learning comes from studying. Many tests... often upwards of three per week. It also leads to lots of stress and pressure. Students generally manage to get what they work for, and in a wealthy neighborhood, many students tend to do well. It's odd how a test taken in 6th grade will determine math placement for the rest of a student's schooling career.", "The nurse is often unavailable - and rude. Not that many security measures are taken at the school compared to others around the immediate area, but it's enough to make some students anxious. Many locked doors, many cameras, really makes the school feel like more of a prison than an education establishment. I don't believe it to be necessary, and at times, it can be intrusive. The school puts in too much of an effort to ensure the safety of its students, but I guess it makes some feel at ease. It's also what the state demands from the schools, which shouldn't be dealt with at a gubernatorial level, especially considering the vast socioeconomic differences across the state.", "There aren't that many clubs, but students generally tend to find their niche. Most of the clubs are well run, but have a high reliance on social media. The club advisors are understanding and reliable.", 'One of the things a newcomer will notice when entering the high school is the immense amount of pressure put on by their parents, as well as the teachers and administration. Common topics of conversation in the hallways include, "How did you do on Mrs. X\'s test? What did you get?" or "I always get an A plus on Mr. Z\'s exams". It\'s quite stressful, especially for students who aren\'t as confident. Parents have access to an online student data system, which gives them access to the child\'s grades and other info. Parents take utmost advantage of this and push students to do the best they can, often and the child\'s dismay. It all leads to a really stressful and competitive environment.', "Most of the teachers are there to help, but some are hard to find before/during/after school. There isn't usually enough time to visit teachers during the school day, which can be a problem for some students attending clubs/sports/band before and after. Overall, the teachers are pretty nice, but a lot choose favorites.  Fortunately, most of the teachers are respectable and will help the students.", 'There is a pretty rigorous bullying program in place, but it still happens. Overall it feels very safe in school and walking around town. There is a physical trainer on staff that is widely utilized. Nurse is acceptable.', "The extracurriculars pretty much cover the basics of things you would want to do. If the school doesn't have anything, it's easy enough to find it in the area.", "This school has been a pretty good experience for me. By the end, the smallness becomes tiresome but along the way you foster some really close friendships. Overall, there is plenty of opportunity to make the experience great and get what you need out of it. If you're looking to apply yourself academically, or excel athletically, or get involved in extracurriculars, there is definitely room for those things here. Because of the smallness, if you're committed to a club, by your senior year there's a good chance you can take a big role or a leadership position. There isn't as a big a range of ECs as a big school would have, but anything you can't find within the building can be found in the area via a Google search. My one complaint would be with the guidance department. Depending on which counselor you get, you either luck out or are at disadvantage applying to college, getting schedules, getting internships, getting employment. But this can be pretty much remedied if you're willing to fight for yourself. In general the administration is willing to accommodate, but sometimes there does need to be  some application of pressure.", "There were several teachers that were just really exceptional. The other teachers were all acceptable, there were only 1-2 that I've had a bad experience with. One great thing is that you can strike friendships with teachers if you want to, which has really added to my experience.", 'The teachers at GRHS vary greatly, however, for the most part, are kind and willing to help students if necessary.   This school has lots of smart boards and other technology which result in very technology-based teaching styles.  In my personal experience, I like and enjoy 7 out of 8 of my teachers.  Though there may be out-liars who include older, boring, teachers who seem to have given up, the majority are extremely intelligent and overall great.']
column8: ['This a a very safe environment.', 'There are a variety of clubs available which appeal to every interest.', 'I received an excellent education. The school is diverse and interesting.', 'Teachers are knowledgeable, fair, and approachable.', 'Despite the homogenous student population, the high school is pretty nice.  Teachers and administration all know you by name and are very supportive of all students.  My favorite experience at Glen Ridge High School was when I took a class trip to Spain.  Overall, this school has been a comfortable learning environment for me and although it is comprised of people with the same backgrounds.', "this school is great and I love it however some teachers don't care, and you barely learn in their class. Other teachers, are obsessed with their own class and don't realize the students have other work to do. These two types of teachers are a minority, however. The teachers are good overall.", "Ok so the drinking/partying/drug use isnt noticible during school hours, but I won't deny that there is a party culture. As for the nurse, she's alright, BUT SHE IS NEVER THERE. She has breaks at the most inconvient times and as I said before, is almost never there. When she is it is really easy to have her just call your parents to have you be picked up.", 'Most are willing to go out of their way to help students. However, there are some issues with the dress code, as it focuses more on female attire than male. But other than that everything is pretty good.', "I've participated in the Student Council, School Newspaper, Drama Club, and Jazz Band, all of which are excellent programs. Many girls in the school also participate in the Glen Ridge Girl's Club, which is also a wonderful expereince I highly reccomend. As far as funding goes, the school recently cancelled the one event that a majority of clubs use as their main fundraiser, so I'm not sure what direction the clubs will be going in after this year. But other than that. :)", "It's alright. Though none of the smart boards work and it will be either freezing or sweltering in the summer. there is rarely an in between.", "I loved it, but it's not for everyone. The academics can be difficult, but if you choose your classes based on your ability and not what guidence/parents want from you you will be fine. My personal favorite experince has been in the drama club. It's a really tight knit comminity that is welcoming of everyone and anyone. It's a great place to meet friends and also build self confidence and skills you won't be able to pick up in other classes, like working lighting equipment or building furniture.", 'Meh. It would be nice if there was an actual choice of healthier foods. Pretty much everything is fried.', 'All of the english teachers are amazing. The history teachers are very strong as well, and taking APUSH with Ms. Lynch pretty much garuntees you a 4 or 5 because of how well she prepares you. Mr. Erickson is a very smart man, but his teaching style only works with a select few students. The rest will complain about him. relentlessly. The foriegn language department is excellent as well. Sra. Price is a fantastic teacher, and really engaging about her lessons.', 'As far as academics are concerned, the English and History departments are better than the Science and Math ones, but all departments have a fairly strong, reliable teaching staff. Like any school, there are some really good teachers and some that your student will just not get along with. I did not participate in any sports during my time at GRHS, and did not feel like an outcast because of it. I did however participate in the music program under Mr. Lagos, and it was an experience that helped me grow as a musician and as a person. Though he is leaving this year I am sure the music program will contiue to be amazing. The Theatre program had a new director this year who did pretty well considering the students were expecting our old director who we knew and loved, but nonetheless this program will go on strong as well. The academics at this school are pretty good, but the only issue is that the 12th grade English classes are limited. There is no 12th grade honors English class, only the choice of AP Lang, AP Lit, and college prep. Many students are pressured into taking more AP courses than they are capable of by parents and guidence counselors due to the importance on academic excellence. Each grade has a different dynamic but overall everyone is friendly enough and welcoming of new or different students. VERY safe for LGBTQA+ students.', 'The police are just down the street, and some of our classmates are EMT\'s. However, the nurse- while polite and well-meaning- is NEVER in her office. I can recall several times where we went days, or even weeks without a school nurse at all. She has too many break periods, which teachers call "prep periods" but I have no idea what she\'s prepping for. I think she could use some assistance.', "I was born and raised here, so I don't know much different. That being said, it's hard to imagine a high school experience much different from the one I've had. I don't think I'm unique in saying that I hated almost all of school while I was living it, but now, upon entering my last semester here, I have fond memories. I was exposed to racial and political diversity at places other than my school, so I think some classmates of mine are really lacking that experience.", "Every teacher is different, that's for sure. The grading is extremely inconsistent, though, and teachers often have trouble grading the amount of work they give--which should say something about the workload they give.", 'Students typically choose honors or AP classes just "because", not because they\'re particularly interested in the subject, they can just pass assessments and regurgitate information that\'s given to them. Grades often have two sets of kids; the all-honors-and-APs kids and the college-prep kids. The latter are often seen as stupid or lesser, despite the fact that they still do a good amount of work.', "The guidance department has been fine-tuned throughout my time at GRHS. It was good to begin with, and it's even better now.", 'Glen Ridge High School is known for their greatness in sports and obtains the motto of "A tradition of excellence" over their trophy cases. Although some sports may not be as accomplished as the girl\'s soccer team or boy\'s and girl\'s lacrosse teams, Glen Ridge always pushes through as hard as they can making sure to never fail.']

column2: ['I like how administrators of the school make it feel like you can tell them anything and it can be safe with them.', 'This is a pretty good school that makes up for its poor facilities with great teachers and staff. They really need to stop closing the bathrooms so I don’t have to walk across the school to use the restroom.', 'It is a great school where you meet new people and learn a lot from great teachers. It’s a good school filled with a lot of great school spirits and fun events and clubs  that help engage students to attend and participate.', 'Parsippany High School provides me with a safe space, where I feel part of a community rather than feeling as if I am being forced to go to school everyday. I enjoy everyday at school and the administrators make every extracurricular fun and engrossing for the attendees.', 'We came from Dubai and thought that it will be tough to get aligned with the school and environment but it has been wonderful studying here in PHS', 'Parsippany High School is a pretty average school. What I like about it is how the guidance counselors are very helpful and flexible to care for their students needs and interests. The student life is what makes the school the most enjoyable because of the large amount of clubs it has to offer. There is always something for anyone to participate in and have fun which is always great.', 'This school is perfect if you look forward to a small community of loving personalities, precious guidance and one of the best preparations towards high school. Fellow students and staff are very welcoming once you enter the world/premises of Par High. The academic level expectations are moderate/high leaving the students to decide whether to focus on studies or anything else relating to sports as it is time consuming. Maybe the only lack in the community would be the food which is simply below average and does satisfy one who requires school lunch everyday. I would personally recommend students to pack their own lunch rather than to dread them selves with the food provided. Otherwise, an ideal school in an ideal location with so much to offer just as any other private school.', 'Overall ParHigh is a really good highschool. The teachers and staff are all nice and care for the students.', 'My experience at Parsippany High School was great. The choice of classes gives you the opportunity in preparation for college. You have a vast selection of clubs and sports to choose from giving students an opportunity to get involved.', 'It is a great high school with excellent academics. The teacher, counselors, and staff are very welcoming and nice. The students are very friendly and make the educational environment very nice.', 'They definitely need to invest more into the school itself and the academics rather than improving everything on the outside', 'Parsippany High School is a wonderful high school. Personally, I feel that the science and mathematics departments are lacking, but the English and History departments more than make up for it.', 'Schooling at PHS has been a great experience to me so far. The teachers are very helpful and co-operative. The school makes me better and better every day by challenging me with problems I have never solved before.', "Overall, all of my teachers and the faculty here were amazing! There were many clubs I joined and most sports were great. However, the school really need to fix its tennis courts, because it's always embarrassing for the team when other schools come to games.", "The classes are great at preparing you for college-level courses. The faculty and staff are very nice and supportive. They genuinely care about students' lives and wellbeing. There is a great variety of extracurricular programs. The school's sports and music program are fairly competitive. I liked how diverse the student body is (race, ethnicity, socioeconomic background, etc.). Though the facilities are not the greatest, the school felt very safe and homey.", 'Great school, with close family like atmosphere.  Not too big, teachers are all great, helpful and easily approachable.  Many sport and activities to get involved with.', "Students feel welcome with clubs and sports at the school. Teachers always put 110% effort to help students voice their ideas on for better learning. Students can also join clubs such as school drama, dance club and trivia club. These help students destress themselves, and prepare them for careers in the arts and other areas. By knowing everyone's name, the administrators create a more personal experience for the students. In addition, the guidance counselors are very helpful in helping students destress themselves with the sometimes overwhelming amount of work. However, they  rarely give the help needed for college applications. The coaches train students mentally. For example, if players are playing unfairly, our players are taught to not retaliate and continue playing.", 'Parsippany high school was a very diverse environment and I had great memories. I wish they prepared me with college and the real world.', "As a senior at Parsippany High School, I have watched it both grow in some aspects and deteriorate in others over the last four years. While we do have some amazing programs such as our National Championship winning Marching Band, and our Student Council, which is ranked one of the largest in the state, other programs seem to be failing. Our football team has been on a downward spiral for years now, but this season we've hit rock bottom, winning zero games. Our food is also a conflict, due to the fact that the company we use only has to meet a quota of a certain percentage of real meat in their chicken, the rest is bi-product.  Despite some flaws, the staff at Par High is incredible and our principal is absolutely amazing, he knows everyone's name and is always there for the students. The AP and Honors level courses really help with college readiness, and the extensive amount of clubs and sports that are offered are sure to boost resumes.", 'Not the worst school but not the best... teachers are very helpful but the workload is tough to manage at times. lots of changes to get involved in extracurriculars.']

column6: ['The honors and AP classes are well-taught classes, and teachers and administrators are very dedicated and talented. I can’t speak much for the regular courses, because I haven’t taken much of those in my time here, but I’ve rarely met a student who doesn’t love their teachers. The extra curricular programs are somewhat under funded, but the school spirit and sense of community make up for it.', 'PHS is very great school. It prepares you for your life and college. The staff try to work with you as well as they can. There are many clubs and activities that you could get involved in and to make new friends. The people in the office are always helpful. The guidance helps every student if they have a problem. Overall Parsippany High School is a great place to go.', 'The Honors program at PHS is excellent. I found supportive teachers who cared and were passionate about their subjects, dedicated peers who worked together collaboratively to study and tutor each other, and an overall sense of academic community among students who shared the same goals. Socially, there is an array of clubs that range from theatrical to charity-related organizations. The principal himself is an exemplary model of integrity, commitment, and genuine concern for the well being and education of all students.', 'The things I like at this school is the fact that everyone is always happy to help you with anything you need. Everyone is so friendly and I have learned so much at this school and made so many friends. I would never want to change anything in this school.', 'I transferred during my junior year of high school. I was afraid of being left out, but I was proven wrong. Ironically, my first day was my best day so far as a high school student. The administration were all so caring and the principal stands out to me as a friend. The education provided consist of high level thinking and it definitely was a challenge for me. There are a lot of chances given in this school to improve countless skills. As for me, I was able to strengthen my social skills. I feel safe and secure in Parsipanny High School.', 'Brilliant, passionate teachers who really do love their jobs. Lovable principal who genuinely cares about his students. Overall, a wonderful community.', 'Many of the teachers are well prepared and knowledgeable in their areas of study. The staff is generally friendly and kind, especially the principle. However, the students can be loud, disrespectful, and inappropriate at times.', 'As a freshman, my first year of high school has been great! I have made a ton of new friends and the staff here is amazing. My teachers are wonderful and they keep me motivated to do good in school.  I am looking forward to my last three years of high school.', "Parsippany High School was filled with various extracurricular activities which made it a great place to learn. The teachers were all willing to further the knowledge of their students. I'm looking forward to seeing more improvements.", "Taking an honors-course schedule all four years, most if not all teachers were engaged and genuinely cared about furthering my and my peers' success. Many other students I've met from out of district or state are surprised at the lack of horror in this public school.", 'Very great learning environment. Would hope to see a change in the following years in regards to certain teachers and the school lunches. Overall,  the experience is what you make of it.', "I like the environment and I like that our principle really puts the effort to try to know every student. It's a smaller school so I would've liked to see classes have lesser people in them.", 'I just moved to Parsippany High School a year ago so far my experience has being great really friendly environment.', 'All the staffs are fabulous. The students are very friendly and the school Principal is the best. Different levels of classes are offered and even help class is available for depressed and sad students.', 'Teachers are good but too much workload, which is managable. Variety of classes are offered.', 'People come from different races and countries and everyone is accepted fairly.', "People show a lot if interest in clubs during beginning of the year but later, they just don't care. Although, the advisors of club always has that same effort.", 'Students are pretty involved in all activities and they strive for more.', 'It really depends on how many honors classes you are taking. Regular classes are a joke compared to honors in every way', "There's a lot to choose from from afterschool clubs and sports, but many times they conflict with each other, and most activities are only offered a certain time in the entire year"]

column2: ['I atened for all four years, and in that time I went from all regular classes to honors and AP classes during my last year. I like to think that the hard-working teachers and my peers helped me achieve the level of success that I finished my high school career with. As a whole, if you can afford to live in the town, do so. It is a quiet neighborhood to live in, with a wonderful downtown scene.', 'No cultural diversity  in the school. Teachers were good. The town is nice but there is no diversity. The ethnicity of the school students are mostly white. Not many Hispanics or African Americans. Other than that the school is ran well. Academics are good.', 'I thrive at NPHS because of the great music and marching band programs and the sports. You have to get involved to enjoy yourself. The only complaints I have is the lack of a larger social circle since it is a small school and the lack of diversity. Having less people can be seen as an advantage because I get more attention from teachers and play on more varsity sports since there is less competition.', "New Providence High School is a small school. If you weren't in the town from the beginning, you'll hopefully be able to find other newbies, as the natives are sometimes maddeningly oblivious to how life is outside their bubble. Otherwise, the people are nice (fake or not), and it is an endurable experience.", 'I thoroughly enjoyed the tight knit community within each grade in New Providence High School. While others may dislike such a small community, it allows me to feel more comfortable with my peers. I also love the teachers and the curriculum as it continue to challenge me and prepare me for college and my future career. One thing that I would like to see change in New Providence is the diversity within the school. I believe that there needs to be an increase in diversity in which it is lacking right now. I also believe that the school needs to be expanded and maybe separated from the middle school even though we may not have such a large high school population. But, I do believe that New Providence has offered me a wonderful education these last four years.', 'New providence High school is super tiny. but its a safe environment to be in, the teachers care about all of their students, their stem program is fantastic. The food sucks, and so does the sports but thats probably more of a student issue more than faculty.', 'New Providence High School has really good academics and extracurriculars. Some teachers are better than others, there are a lot of APs offered, and the curriculum is well above average. However, the college counselors are really a joke.', 'Good academics, some teachers are worse than others but overall they are accommodating. The size of school makes it so that everyone knows everyone, which could be a good or bad thing depending on what type of person you are.', 'I really like all of the clubs and after school activities/sports that are offered. Also, I like how some of the teachers are really invested and genuinely care about their students', 'It is a great school system where kids are prepared for college. It is very easy to make your mark by creating a club or hosting a fundraiser. The teachers are very hands on and the administration wants to see the students succeed.', 'I liked the size and atmosphere of the school, and most of the teachers are very nice and approachable.  However, some of the substitute teachers were a bit off and the addition of iPads did a lot more harm than good.', 'Overall, New Providence High School was a solid experience. We excelled in many aspects, such as academics, athletics, and music, and that is something many other students and I am proud of. While there were some teachers who were irritating, or simply awful at their job, there were other brilliant teachers who more than made up for them. I attribute a lot of my successes and who I am today because of what this school provided for me, and I am very proud to be from New Providence High School.', 'Not enough for students interested in business', 'The size of school makes it a community', 'Most are teachers are good. The support they provide varies by teacher, however.', "I'm in band, choir, and GSA and I love all of them.", "Obviously everyone's parents are different but most are fine.0", 'Most of the teachers are good whether the classes are easy or hard but some of them are totally incompetent.', "Our school isn't racially diverse", 'Teachers are willing to give extra assistance']

column6: ['There are many extracurricular activities to get involved in. Sports are the most common extracurricular activity. Then it would be drama/theater and music.', 'My school has great events and ways to get involved. Our parents work hard along with our teachers and ourselves to raise money for events like the Prom. Our school is small so we are unique in many ways. I would choose my school over again because of the quirky things we have as tradition.', 'My school is rated very high and for good reason. The teachers work very hard to teach their students. They care about how we do and they genuinely want us to succeed. They are usually very good at communicating what they expect from us. They are pretty reasonable with grading too.', 'If someone says the word harassment at New Providence, the entire foundation of the school gets shaken.', "There are a few smaller clubs that don't get recognized.", "This school is unique because of it's small size.", "Some of the teachers don't have a strong presence.", "There is constant support from everyone in the school and town no matter what the students decide to do. Some of my favorite experiences include the Every 15 Minutes program. This program occurs every two years and the purpose is to show the dangers of drinking and driving. It's always very moving and it's a huge success every year the program runs.", 'The teachers are very knowledgable. If you are willing to go to teachers to ask for help or any guidance, most are more then happy to help outside of the classroom. They may give you more practice problems or direct you to websites and books that could help further your knowledge on a topic. They will prepare you to do the best you possibly can.', "There isn't much bullying occurring at New Providence High School. People who don't get along, mostly stay out of each others way and for the most part everyone gets along. I would say the school is pretty safe. We have never had any issues with personal safety. The school nurse does a great job to help sick students.", 'Sports are extremely important at New Providence High School. The student athletes and coaches are very committed to their work and are extremely dedicated. The community as a whole is very supportive to the sports teams at our school. Clubs are also important at our school. There are so many different options to choose from, such as the Photo Journalism Club, Future Civics Leaders, and many more.', 'New Providence High School is unique because it is a community. The students and parents come together at sporting and community events. Students look out for each other and everyone is pretty outgoing. Although it is a small school, it can be a good thing because it keeps the community closely knit.', 'The teachers at this school make sure each student does not struggle. The teachers always offer extra time to aid students and take the time to help during class. Although they all have different teaching styles, they are, for the most part, efficient and effective.', 'Outstanding education, lots of great teachers.', 'Overall, New Providence is an excellent school which offers its students a top notch education.', 'A few teachers have been a BIG disappointment.', 'The courses challenge you and most teachers push you.', 'I loved my high school; the teachers and environment were perfect for learning.', 'Always have felt safe in the school.', 'Overall experience at the school has been very good.  Would highly recommend to any student starting high school.']
column8: ['There are many extracurricular activities to get involved in. Sports are the most common extracurricular activity. Then it would be drama/theater and music.', 'My school has great events and ways to get involved. Our parents work hard along with our teachers and ourselves to raise money for events like the Prom. Our school is small so we are unique in many ways. I would choose my school over again because of the quirky things we have as tradition.', 'My school is rated very high and for good reason. The teachers work very hard to teach their students. They care about how we do and they genuinely want us to succeed. They are usually very good at communicating what they expect from us. They are pretty reasonable with grading too.', 'If someone says the word harassment at New Providence, the entire foundation of the school gets shaken.', "There are a few smaller clubs that don't get recognized.", "This school is unique because of it's small size.", "Some of the teachers don't have a strong presence.", "There is constant support from everyone in the school and town no matter what the students decide to do. Some of my favorite experiences include the Every 15 Minutes program. This program occurs every two years and the purpose is to show the dangers of drinking and driving. It's always very moving and it's a huge success every year the program runs.", 'The teachers are very knowledgable. If you are willing to go to teachers to ask for help or any guidance, most are more then happy to help outside of the classroom. They may give you more practice problems or direct you to websites and books that could help further your knowledge on a topic. They will prepare you to do the best you possibly can.', "There isn't much bullying occurring at New Providence High School. People who don't get along, mostly stay out of each others way and for the most part everyone gets along. I would say the school is pretty safe. We have never had any issues with personal safety. The school nurse does a great job to help sick students.", 'Sports are extremely important at New Providence High School. The student athletes and coaches are very committed to their work and are extremely dedicated. The community as a whole is very supportive to the sports teams at our school. Clubs are also important at our school. There are so many different options to choose from, such as the Photo Journalism Club, Future Civics Leaders, and many more.', 'New Providence High School is unique because it is a community. The students and parents come together at sporting and community events. Students look out for each other and everyone is pretty outgoing. Although it is a small school, it can be a good thing because it keeps the community closely knit.', 'The teachers at this school make sure each student does not struggle. The teachers always offer extra time to aid students and take the time to help during class. Although they all have different teaching styles, they are, for the most part, efficient and effective.', 'Outstanding education, lots of great teachers.', 'Overall, New Providence is an excellent school which offers its students a top notch education.', 'A few teachers have been a BIG disappointment.', 'The courses challenge you and most teachers push you.', 'I loved my high school; the teachers and environment were perfect for learning.', 'Always have felt safe in the school.', 'Overall experience at the school has been very good.  Would highly recommend to any student starting high school.']

column2: ["Well rounded students and teachers. The administrators really care for the students' health and safety. School offers the senior experience which allows students to experience what it's like to work in a business environment. Not many schools have this program. The sports teams are well-taken care of.", 'Mepham is a great school that is very welcoming, with amazing people, students and staff alike. I have grown considerably and learned more than I have expected to. The teachers are very helpful and are always willing to help you because they feel everyone deserves a great education. There are so many opportunities to meet new people with all the different sports and clubs you can join.  The friendships I have made in Mepham are meaningful to me, and I will always cherish the memories I have made there.  I could not have asked for a better high school experience.', 'As a senior I don’t think Mepham  was very accommodating for students  but I do think it makes it up and it’s academic ,sports ,arts and clubs programs Also for an old-school it’s very updated other than its Wi-Fi', 'I have 2 children that have/ are experiencing Mepham. The older child went to an awesome college after 4 great years at Mepham that prepared him for the next phase ofhis life. My youngest is a senior and except for a few hiccups w being bullied she has been enjoying her time at the school. They both are honors students!', 'Mepham is a great place to grow up and find where you belong. Some of my favorite, most memorable memories took place at Mepham. I loved going to football and soccer games, as well as school events like Battle of the Classes and So They Think They Can Dance. This is a great, close-knit community to be a part of, but it is important to stay involved- otherwise, you may not get the full Mepham experience. This school is not extremely diverse, however, Mepham is growing the community and is a very accepting and comfortable atmosphere. We host Culture Nights and run several clubs that benefit the community. I am very grateful to have had the opportunity to fully experience Mepham High School!', "Wellington C Mepham has been a part of my family and extended family for over 50 years.    My parents, Aunts, Uncles, Cousins and Brother have all graduated from Mepham.   My sister and I currently attend.     Mepham is an amazing school with a high ranked academic program with an amazing educators that preps their students to be college ready upon graduation.  Their community building environment is equipped with a wide range of clubs, activities, JV and Varsity sports to meet every students needs.   Their facility is clean, welcoming and updated inside and out with their recent turn over to turf fields.  The school has always had a welcoming aura not only for the students but fore the parents as well.   It's a safe and fun environment to be a part of.", 'overall pretty good for a high school, most people are nice and there are a lot of options for classes', 'Very welcoming school with great teachers, coaches, and staff. There is a good variety of courses offered and students are kept to a high standard.', 'My experience at Mepham high school has been pretty good. I have learned a lot and it has prepared me for life after high school. I have had some amazing teachers who have helped me a lot.', "My overall experience at Mepham was enjoyable. The staff was helpful and encouraging. Most things at Mepham are in good condition, the only thing I would hope to improve is student parking. There aren't enough spots for the seniors.", 'Great Teachers and staff. Every teacher is there for the students success. There are countless opportunities for students that makes the school stand out', "I started high school at an Islamic private school in Suffolk County. I had been attending this school since the second grade, and it was a nice school except for the fact that the high school wasn't quite developed. I left the school before my junior year because I wanted to have more extracurricular and academic opportunities. Wellington C. Mepham High School had offered me many opportunities such as clubs and a variety of subjects I could choose to take. The faculty have been nothing but helpful at every step of the way, which was especially important for me because I was taking the SAT the year I joined and then I would be applying to colleges the year after. To sum it all up, the two years I've spent at Wellington C. Mepham High School have been phenomenal and I will definitely never forget my time there.", 'I love all the great teachers and support staff.  I think these teachers have helped  me be become the best student that I could possibly be. The one thing that  I would like to  be changed in our school is having all the bathrooms open  on all floors and not be locked all the time.', 'Academics play to the lowest level (no student left behind).Administration does what is had to by law but are too busy for the individalCurriculum focuses on passing a test not on try learning to learn and grow.Lack of creativity in most classes means simply memorizing and regurgitating information', 'I think Mepham is a great school overall but its definitely lacking in diversity. The clubs and activities have amazing advisers who want to see the students involved in community service.', 'My 4 years have been great and the teachers are very helpful.  School and its teacher are supportive and always available for additional help if needed.', 'Mepham is more than a school.  MEPHAM IS FAMILY!!  Everyone is friendly and shares a common love for the school.  There is so much to get involved in from clubs to sports.  Students and staff are happy to be there and you can feel it as you walk through the halls each day. The school spirit is like no other!!!!!!  It is a place that wants all students to succeed.Once a Pirate, Always a Pirate!!!!!!', 'It’s a privilege to attend Mepham High school because there are so much resources to help you in the future. It helps students find their path and help them be more focused on their future. Something I would want to see change is too see more help and support over students because it won’t make them feel as if they were failures', "My experience at Mepham High School was definitely one to remember. The community at Mepham was so welcoming. The clubs at the school were very interesting and being involved in sports is an amazing experience. I try to be very involved in the Mepham community and participate in all the activities I could. This was a great decision , because without all the activities and sports I participated in I don't believe my experience would be so memorable.", 'Great school with great teachers and staff.  Everyone is friendly.  Many programs, sports, and activities.  Available assistance if needed.  Parents and community involvement.  Great place to go to school.']
