column6: ['Mepham is a great school in a great area close to lots of prestigious universities and NYC where so many great opportunities for young people reside. The great athletic department and several artistic outlet programs make it a great place for students to round themselves out in a friendly environment with a dedicated faculty and staff.', 'Mepham High School has solid support from the parents in the community. The sporting events are well attended. There is always extra help available for students. Mepham High School is regarded highly in the amount of charity,volunteerism and fundraising for those in need that is done.', 'I feel the school is doing well in preparing me for college.  My teachers, as well as my guidance counselor are very motivating and supportive.', 'My experience at Mepham Highschool was overall a great experience. I moved here freshman year & I can say that the teachers here are amazing and the students in this school are funny and friendly. My years at  Mepham High-school will definitely be an memorable experience!', 'My experience at Wellington C. Mepham High School was overall one I can not forget. Mepham high school is one of the most school spirited schools around. That is what most students love about it. Mepham has a large variety of events, which brings all different people together. Sports, plays, events, shows, clubs, and services, are all largely enjoyed and each receives their own recognition. To a student, these become very important. If there was one thing I would like to see change, it would be the relationship between the student and the administration. Students and teachers have an amazing relationship at the school. Many students go to teachers for advice,  to talk to you, and spend time with. Along with other faculty members, like guidance counselors and security guards. Students and administration do not have as good of a relationship because the administration are the ones who have to give students disciplinary acts which upset the students receiving them.', 'It seems impossible to be a Mepham student and not have pirate pride. There are always great events going on. The teachers are amazing. The school as a whole makes you feel right at home.', 'As a senior a at Mepham I can say that I have felt extremely prepared throughout my college admission so process. My guidance counselor has helped me so much and the faculty truly wants their students to thrive after high school. There is a club for everything, and each grade is there own big community.', 'this school is not very diverse however, the teachers here and very helpful and if you make the most of it your time here can be very good', 'The thing I loved most about mepham was how involved my teachers and principle was in the school! The teachers and principle cared so much about the students that went to mepham! Absolutely loved attending mepham!', "Mepham was overall a very good school with very helpful and involved teachers and administrators and a very good selection of in-school and extracurricular activities.  I will miss it and the friends I've made there when I leave for college next year.", 'All of the teachers here are outstanding, and deserve more praise than they get. I have had nothing but a positive experience with all of the teaching faculty at Mepham. Only problem is a lack of diversity.', 'The coursework is challenging - lots of AP courses are offered as well as college credit for certain honors courses. Excellent guidance department.', 'Excellent high school.  Wonderful teachers.  Good sports program and after school activities.  Located in a wonderful neighborhood.', 'The faculty and staff of Mepham High School were amazing.  My teachers always inquired about my sport and helped me when I needed to miss school for meets.  The principal also followed my varsity performances and even attended meets!', 'During my time at Mepham High School, I noticed that there were many opportunities for students to become enriched in the culture of the school and engage in extracurricular activities. I enjoyed being on the volleyball team from 9th through 12th grade. It helped me to learn sportsmanship, how to be on a team, how to lead a team since I was captain and how to take the good with the bad.', 'The teachers are so kind and caring and really want to see you succeed. The classes being offered are new and exciting like advertising and design, music compostion, and business classes.', 'This is a good school and people should look forward to going here. There are many kind teachers and students here willing to learn new things.', "I met so many people during the 4 years of high school. It isn't about who you meet during those years but rather who stays with you when you graduate.", 'Mepham is amazing. There are a decent amount of "vineyard vines" people but overall everyone is amazing. Most of the teachers are great and helpful. Some security guards are rude and even a little creepy but other than that it\'s great. I wouldn\'t want to go to school anywhere else.', 'I liked many things about Mepham, the faculty, the courses and the extra-curricular activities they provided there. My time there was 4 years which felt long while living them, but in the end went by too fast.']

column1: Rumson Fair Haven Regional High School
column2: ['Rumson Fair Haven Regional High School really gets you ready for a life in college or the work place. They have many programs for learning but also for parent education of hot topics. Financial Aid and admissions nights are regular events and I know they have some outside study opportunities for half day in school and out.', 'Rumson Fair Haven is a small tight knit community.  I would not change anything about my time spent there.  Teachers are caring and go above and beyond their teaching requirements.', 'It was a small school that advanced learning and excelling at what you wanted to do. Fun teachers that made me want to come to class every day and studies that were fun', 'Rumson schools are the reason we moved here. The education is excellent, and the extracurricular are as good as most private schools. It is a very affluent community which has its pluses and minuses.... some kids are very spoiled, sheltered and over-parented. However, overall, most kids and families are terrific, and it’s a close community.', 'Great school. Strong academics, great sports. You get what you put in. They offer a variety of AP classes.', 'rfh is a great high school, especially for athletes or kids who really want to work hard and go to a good college', "Overall, Rumson Fair Haven Regional High School is an amazing place. Between the location and teachers, my high school experience couldn't have been better. The teachers and staff have truly helped me grow as a student and individual through my four years and helped me to succeed in the areas where I had difficulties. One thing that did lack was diversity.", "My overall experience with RFH was pretty good. There are a lot of things the staff and administration gets right, but there's glaring issues that they seem to overlook. This often has to do with the teachers, some staff members should definitely not be employed for such a job. But the most irritating thing that I found with RFH is its rules are often based around the exception. Cell phone policies & homecoming are just two examples of how the administration made a choice because of an exception and the the whole student body.", 'RFH is a phenomenal school because it prepares you for college and beyond. The school has such a high grade average, that I believed a 3.67 was not good enough at the time. Because of this, something that could be improved for RFH is the overall prep for the real world. It is not a diverse school, so providing more opportunities in clubs and after school activities would be great.', 'I loved my expirence at Rumson Fair Haven. I was an athlete there and got to experience the wonderful sports they had. I also got to expirence their high level academic classes, especially the sciences. RFH had a wide variety of ap and honors courses available so any student could challenge themselves if they wanted. The teacher and community at RFH was super welcoming and I enjoyed the past 4 years there a lot.', 'The academics are very rigorous and it allows students to be looked at by colleges that they may not have the option of going to if they went to other high schools. The rules around the school are a little unnecessary and don’t always make sense though. Good kids get in trouble over nothing at times.', 'I moved to the area the summer before freshman year. It was a completely new area where I did not know anyone. Overall, it was probably the best thing that could ever happen to me. I was able to get an amazing education where at the end of the four years, I felt that I was 100% ready for what college had to bring. RFH was a place where I met some of my best friends that I was able to grow with over that time. Never in my mind did I think that I would love high school as much after hearing horror stories from others. I had such a positive and uplifting experience after going to RFH.', 'I love how RFH is a super tight-knit community, everyone knows everyone, and the teachers get to know you as well and you aren’t just a number to them. The sense of school spirit everyone has is amazing, and at the football games everyone is united in cheering for the team. The academics are good, but guidance tends to push you to take less AP/honors than you are capable of.  The only things I would change are to upgrade the technology since my teachers couldn’t get the computers to work half the time and to have more lunch options. The school stresses eating healthy for sports and stuff meanwhile the only choices are pizza, french fries, and an entire snack bar consisting of overpriced bags of chips.', 'Small, blue ribbon school. Lots of great professors who were willing to help. Beautiful area right near the river and ocean. Friendly staff and students.', 'The sports are incredible, the community is close and everyone comes together to support the school!', 'The school is located in a family friendly neighborhood and presents a comfortable sense of community.  The academics and teachers thoroughly prepare the students for college.   Less is done for those pursuing other post graduation options, such as vocational training or year off employment internships.  I would like to have seen more effort by the administration in fostering some type of buddy system to help shy students become involved by having someone to attend extra curricular activities and social events.', "I liked how much of a family RFH is. Teachers know your siblings if they went through the high school, they know about each student's sports, and they are always available to academic assistance. If I could see anything change it would be for the school to improve the administration's relationship with the students.", 'I liked the sense of pride everyone has who atttends the school. Knowing every person you pass by is incomparable and help maintain a positive social experience. The teachers at RFH are very invested in the students and put forth an effort that I cannot imagine many others are willing to. The only change I would suggest is lessoning the workload because while our teachers care about our learning, some don’t take into consideration how much work we receive from other classes.', 'Rumson Fair Haven Regional High School has excellent academics with teachers who truly care about the curriculum. It is a very competitive school that encourages students to do well in their classes as well as participate in extracurricular acivities. There is too much of a focus on sports as many of the arts programs are neglected.', 'I had a great time at RFH. The teachers and staff helped me a lot getting ready for college. There are many amazing opportunities at RFH and a lot of good sports and club opportunities for students as well.']

But the most irritating thing that I found with RFH is its rules are often based around the exception. Cell phone policies & homecoming are just two examples of how the administration made a choice because of an exception and the the whole student body.", 'RFH is a phenomenal school because it prepares you for college and beyond. The school has such a high grade average, that I believed a 3.67 was not good enough at the time. Because of this, something that could be improved for RFH is the overall prep for the real world. It is not a diverse school, so providing more opportunities in clubs and after school activities would be great.', 'I loved my expirence at Rumson Fair Haven. I was an athlete there and got to experience the wonderful sports they had. I also got to expirence their high level academic classes, especially the sciences. RFH had a wide variety of ap and honors courses available so any student could challenge themselves if they wanted. The teacher and community at RFH was super welcoming and I enjoyed the past 4 years there a lot.', 'The academics are very rigorous and it allows students to be looked at by colleges that they may not have the option of going to if they went to other high schools. The rules around the school are a little unnecessary and don’t always make sense though. Good kids get in trouble over nothing at times.', 'I moved to the area the summer before freshman year. It was a completely new area where I did not know anyone. Overall, it was probably the best thing that could ever happen to me. I was able to get an amazing education where at the end of the four years, I felt that I was 100% ready for what college had to bring. RFH was a place where I met some of my best friends that I was able to grow with over that time. Never in my mind did I think that I would love high school as much after hearing horror stories from others. I had such a positive and uplifting experience after going to RFH.', 'I love how RFH is a super tight-knit community, everyone knows everyone, and the teachers get to know you as well and you aren’t just a number to them. The sense of school spirit everyone has is amazing, and at the football games everyone is united in cheering for the team. The academics are good, but guidance tends to push you to take less AP/honors than you are capable of.  The only things I would change are to upgrade the technology since my teachers couldn’t get the computers to work half the time and to have more lunch options. The school stresses eating healthy for sports and stuff meanwhile the only choices are pizza, french fries, and an entire snack bar consisting of overpriced bags of chips.', 'Small, blue ribbon school. Lots of great professors who were willing to help. Beautiful area right near the river and ocean. Friendly staff and students.', 'The sports are incredible, the community is close and everyone comes together to support the school!', 'The school is located in a family friendly neighborhood and presents a comfortable sense of community.  The academics and teachers thoroughly prepare the students for college.   Less is done for those pursuing other post graduation options, such as vocational training or year off employment internships.  I would like to have seen more effort by the administration in fostering some type of buddy system to help shy students become involved by having someone to attend extra curricular activities and social events.', "I liked how much of a family RFH is. Teachers know your siblings if they went through the high school, they know about each student's sports, and they are always available to academic assistance. If I could see anything change it would be for the school to improve the administration's relationship with the students.", 'I liked the sense of pride everyone has who atttends the school. Knowing every person you pass by is incomparable and help maintain a positive social experience. The teachers at RFH are very invested in the students and put forth an effort that I cannot imagine many others are willing to. The only change I would suggest is lessoning the workload because while our teachers care about our learning, some don’t take into consideration how much work we receive from other classes.', 'Rumson Fair Haven Regional High School has excellent academics with teachers who truly care about the curriculum. It is a very competitive school that encourages students to do well in their classes as well as participate in extracurricular acivities. There is too much of a focus on sports as many of the arts programs are neglected.', 'I had a great time at RFH. The teachers and staff helped me a lot getting ready for college. There are many amazing opportunities at RFH and a lot of good sports and club opportunities for students as well.']
column6: ['My time at RFH has been an unforgettable experience. The transition from middle school to high school was as smooth as possible, with teachers, counselors and administrators helping me through every step of the way. The academics were challenging, but the teachers were always involved and available to help. Being a part of RFH truly introduced many new aspects of society into my life. From the importance upon volunteering, club activities, and sporting events, RFH students are motivated to be true, fully functioning, members of society. The family-like feel of the whole RFH community was not only radiated at sporting events, but even within the very halls. RFH has taught me everything I need to embark on the next chapter of life with confidence.  I will always be a bulldawg forever!', 'Tight knit community with a very helpful and caring staff.  A safe place conducive to learning and growing.', 'Teachers are amazing.  Administration is horrible and out of touch with reality.  Superintendent is horrible and nasty to students and staff.  It is the land of no because administration is afraid of being sued.  No cell phones, zero tolerance, and a superintendent who believes it is his job to raise your child.  Guidance office is worthless.  Most parents hire outside help for their kids to plan college.  School also is not supportive of the vocational schools.', 'An ok school. not a lot of diversity. really good academics. fun sports and clubs. everyones pretty preppy and wealthy. teachers are pretty good, but some are bad.', 'good asf the teachers were pretty good and the sports are sick the food zucks but other than that everything else is great', 'Over all, I have had a great high school experience at RFH. The teachers are very helpful and always available to meet with for extra help.', 'Going to Rumson Fairhaven Regional High School, located in the Rumson Fairhaven School District  is one of the major reasons I am able to apply for colleges today.  Without there up to date technology and other equipment, I would have been lost.  Their exceptional teaching staff coupled with the best teaching methods are why I believe I am capable of anything I set my mind to.', "I just graduated this past June and I have to say that I miss it already! There was always such a friendly environment at the school and you could find help anywhere you looked. RFH is definitely in its own little 'bubble' but, I would not  consider that to be a negative at all because you have all the resources you need to succeed readily available to you!", 'Rumson- Fair Haven Regional High School was good in the sense that there are small class sizes and a wide variety of courses offered to students. Something Rumson-Fair Haven lacks is diversity. A strength of Rumson-Fair Haven is the wide variety of resources you have as a student. You will never feel left behind or limited as a student at Rumson-Fair Haven.', 'RFH has been an amazing experience!!! I feel completely prepared to go to college! From day 1 the teachers have done everything to help you do your best!!!', 'The school is among the highest ranked public schools in the nation, and I personally believe that the student body is a testament to that ranking. Parents in the district put immense pressure on their children, and are willing and capable to pay outside sources to make it happen. As a result a large majority of students work hard with tutors and other forms of outside prep, to get exceptionally high state and standardized test scores. While the academics are beyond exceptional, the school does suffer in the diversity catogory, due to the fact that the school district is a "bubble". Many in the student body wont interact with other culture until college, which is a big problem.', 'Teachers at RFH are of the absolute highest quality. They all care about their students and are extremely knowledgeable. Even in high level courses most teachers will address any question a student has and answer it sufficiently.', 'We have regular drills and assemblies on safety.', 'It is a relatively small school so the community is very involved.  Many of my friends parents went to the high school and continue to support it.  My senior class got into great schools because of hard work and the great reputation of the school.', 'Most teachers are very dedicated to the students in class and for athletics.  They are readily available and try to get to know each student.  I feel the teachers as a whole want each student to succeed.', 'I believe that this school is extremely safe and well-monitored. In light of recent incidences in other schools on the east coast, measures have been implemented to ensure the safety of students at Rumson-Fair Haven Regional High School. Students are no longer allowed to walk outside to get to classes and instead must remain in the building. Locker rooms are now constantly locked and are only able to be opened with the supervision of a teacher or administrator; security cameras have also been added to every hallway. We also have frequently unannounced lock down and fire drills to simulate every possible situation that could arise and endanger the safety and well-being of the students. We have had these drills so often that we are all now accustomed to and aware of the procedures of each drill and how to handle the situations effectively if they ever were to occur in a real emergency.', "I am an active member within my school's chapter of the National Honors Society and Spanish National Honors Society, as well as Vice President of Psychology Club, editor of the school yearbook, Student Ambassador, and avid participant within Gay-Straight Alliance, International Club, and Drama Club. These are just a few examples of the plethora of opportunities for after-school involvement within RFH, and are all well supported by the school administration and parents. Everyone who demonstrates interest to a club is immediately accepted and welcomed into its fold, and have the ability to be committed to multiple clubs at once, like me. Some require more commitment than others, however, as they have requirements to be a recognized member. For example, it is required for NHS and Spanish NHS that I tutor freshmen once per week for each respectively, and volunteer my time at all club sponsored events.", 'I believe that this school is unique in its variety of activities and welcoming atmosphere. We have clubs ranging from Yearbook to Psychology Club to Gay-Straight Alliance, and I have the ability to have an active involvement in these three and more. I would come back to RFH if I could relive my high school years a second time simply because it has a very accepting and inclusive atmosphere. There is minimal to no bullying or hazing, and people are accepted for their differences and uniqueness as opposed to ostracized or harassed at other schools. There are no set or defined cliques or groups, people are friends with anyone they so choose, and it helps to foster the welcoming and safe environment that I have grown fond of.', 'I believe that the teachers at Rumson-Fair Haven Regional High School are exceptional in their handling and instruction of the classroom, and all are extremely passionate about their chosen subjects. Some are more effective at instruction than others, but regardless of ability every teacher makes themselves available for after school/additional help upon request of the students. Every teacher that I have encountered within my four years at this institution have all graded fairly and have based their student evaluations upon evident dedication, hard work, and effort devoted towards the subject. Each teacher has their own teaching style tailored towards their given subject, and effectively communicate information through powerpoints, collaborative activities, lectures, written assignments, and more.', 'put 4kids through this HS.  Overall wonderful experiences']

column2: ['Irvington High School has been great academically and in terms of opportunities to volunteer, start and participate in clubs/sports, and focus on education.', 'Irvington High School is a small school, one with a very rooted background. The teachers care about their students and make themselves available to help them at every turn, which should not be taken for granted. Irvington High School is a community, it is supportive, and provides a great education.', 'there were many good teachers and no diversity. I wish there were more people who went to the school as it was also very small. However, it was quite academically challenging and offered many honors courses. they also have  a lot of electives which is nice.', 'I started Irvington in 10th grade and the switch h from private to public school was great. The kids have been with each other since kindergarten to they open up to so you make friends easily. The teachers are understanding and work with you to make sure all your work is in.', 'great variety of classes except for foreign language. should be more languages offered. AP classes are very intense but teachers are helpful and supportive.', "While there are a decent number of clubs there could certainly be more (although we're small school). It would be great to have a little more teacher involvement.", 'Most teachers are great. They are accessible and dedicated. They will often meet outside of regular school hours. Grading is inconsistent but mostly fair across all departments. Some teachers are incredibly passionate and that translates to happy, engaged students.', 'very safe, bullying is not tolerated. police are always close by.', 'teachers are caring and helpful. The principal and new assistant principal are superb. They are passionate and supportive and treat everyone with respect. Student body is mostly great kids, very involved and non-judgemental.\r Sadly our athletic fields are horrible and are awaiting approval process to begin replacing them.\r Foreign language is limited to French and Spanish. It would be great to have more- Italian, Japanese, Chinese etc to be more competitive with some other elite high schools.', "There are numerous clubs and they do get support, but they don't get as much student support as they should.", 'There are wonderful teachers at Irvington, as well as so-so teachers. Some are very enthusiastic and can teach to a range of abilities, but others teach only to the middle. Grading is consistent and fair.', 'There are numerous anti-bullying campaigns and action is taken quickly.', 'Students are a tight-knit group, many having been together since kindergarten. Many teachers have a great relationship with students.', "Really it's ok and that's it.", 'The school community is really small and tight. Had a har time fitting in and making friends as a transfer student.', "Some does care about their students' learning, but some does not at all.", 'The school is unique because of the past and current principals who had a los of sense of community and were/are very enthusiastic.   Principals are concerned, teachers are for the most part concerned and knowledgeable. \r Guidance counselors are hard to communicate with by email.\r Chorale and orchestras are the main reason I chose this school, besides the excellent core academics. \r The trips the school organize are wonderful. I would choose this school again.', 'I have had a good experience academically because I respect my teachers and do my best always. One thing that may be tempting is getting involved in social drama, but avoiding it has gotten me very far. This school is unique because there is a strong sense of community. I would choose this school again if I could do it all over because I have grown as an individual and have had amazing teachers.', 'The school district is very top heavy. There are a handful of teachers that really care. The college process is lacking.', 'never feel unsafe, and people are healthy']

column6: ["foof is TOO healthy and people stick to the wraps and sandwiches instead of the hot food. Everything is whole grain and vending machines aren't a go-to anymore.", 'The Gym is great and we have an extra one ( the MS one) in case we need to adjust to something.', 'SOme are lazy and dont try while others work very hard and are passionate', "Some people are very committed to their clubs and activities while a small amount of students aren't involves in any clubs and organizations, and there are some student, the majority, who are not TOO involved but do participate in them.", 'We recently hired security at our school', "I don't enjoy the students or families but the teachers are nice.", "We have a new administration and sometimes they aren't understanding, but they hold kids accountable for going against the code of conduct. They are easy to talk to, but being a student who has gone under the transformation of new administrations, some of the rules have been strengthened and became more strict than in previous years.", 'We are currently under construction for a turf field', 'Most teachers are genuine and go out of their way for students but there are a couple that hold students back from their full potential.', "It is truly unfortunate students don't participate in the drama club as much as they should. There are so many new and innovative ideas the drama club can help contribute with and not many students or parents contribute nor take advantage.", 'In school safety is great. Outside of school people get drunk, not me, but plenty of idiots do.', 'We have smartboards in all the rooms, and just got new computers. The bathrooms kind of suck.', "I run track and cross country. It's competitive and very fun.", "no one's racist, but everyone's white so that doesn't really count for much.", 'For the most part, we have a very well-rounded community. bullying is rare. There is something for everyone', 'Most teachers put in effort to show they really care about each student. This includes extra help hours.', 'Guidance counselors are at meetings a lot, making it difficult for students to meet with them. Senior college meetings should come before the freshmen meetings in the fall.', 'Depends on the classes. Some teachers really know how to engage a class. Workload is manageable; teachers are considerate of others.', 'Facilities are for the most part good. Only downfall, is lack of fields and the fact that they are not in the best conditions.', 'For clubs, not all the teacher supervisors are fully committed, which is unfair to the committed students']

column2: ['I enjoyed my high school experience very much. The teachers at Chatham High School are kind, supportive, and helpful. They really prepared me for college and I am grateful to have gone to such a good school.', 'Overall, great academics, sports, student environment, helpfulness of staff. Bathroom maintenance needed.', 'Chatham High School is an okay school, but it has a lot of flaws. One of the big problems is the diversity, there simply is none. There is a lack of minority teachers aside from the language teachers. There is a lack of space for eating lunch and kids are forced to eat on a tarp in a gym or on the bleachers. This coming year has been disorganized being that students coming are unaware of the schedule and have not received bus passes.', 'Great school spirit and sense of community. Encourages students to do their best and strive for success.', 'One of the best schools in New Jersey; amazing teachers, great clubs, and outstanding academics. Communication is always clear, and safety is always a top priority.', 'I have been here since 3rd grade and felt very welcomed and whenever I needed help teachers would always be there!', "Chatham HS is struggling sadly. Has become overcrowded and the situation is only getting worse with the 500+ new homes going up on river road. I just pulled my daughter and moved her to Mt St Mary's. She loves it, small classes. Teachers know who she is, wow, that's a novel idea! A low level of teenage girl BS which is not tolerated. Loves her friends and she is happy! What more could I ask for. My advice, make the right decision for your child before it's too late!", 'Is anyone aware that 700 new homes are now being built in Chatham on the site of the old Christmas tree farm on River Road? Does everyone know that the Freshman children in the HS eat their meals in the hallway on the floor!?  40 plus students per class, bullying is at an all time high. Overcrowding is currently a major issue at Chatham HS. The school is not designed to have a second floor built on it. Students are now taking classes online as a "creative solution." The administration and board are lost and have no idea what to do.  Do you think you\'re the only one who thought, "Chatham has good schools we should move there!" Forget it, the secret is out. Summit HS, Bernards HS, Madison HS, Mendham HS all now are much better solutions.', 'Student Safety is a major concern and it should be for you too. I asked my daughter if there are any children she thinks could "go postal" she responded, "oh yeah!!!" and proceeded to name several students. I am now looking into private schools for my daughter. The HS has seen a massive increase in students and bullying incidents and as a response they added another psychologist to the staff. Seriously??? Great use of our tax dollars. How about metal detectors and a police officer! I\'m not waiting for the 36th school shooting this year. Administration is inept!', 'Guess who I am. Rumors are that I had an affair with a student, I have my lab assistants do my errands for me during school (dry cleaning pick-up), I had another student go to my condo wake my child feed and dress him and take him to school and I was fired as a coach of one of the girls HS teams. Yet...I still have a job! :-)', 'SB #57-98 IN THE MATTER OF THE ISSUANCE OF : STATE BOARD OF EDUCATION A COUNTY SUBSTITUTE CERTIFICATE : DECISION ... now I know why she was fired as our swim coach! Who made the decision to hire her!? Her brother!?', "Chatham High School not only offers one of the best academic curriculums in New Jersey, but also offers activities for everyone. From sports teams, clubs, organizations, and performing arts, there is a place for everyone to feel accepted. There is seemingly a place for everyone, but each group tend to become very exclusive which creates cliques. This is common among young people this age, but there are steps our community can take to diffuse this issue. I would like to see more collaboration between all different types of students outside the classroom. One annual event that helps with this is Challenge Day. About 200 students are selected each year to break into groups among peers of freshman to seniors to share their highs and lows, allowing them to feel like they aren't alone and to understand to not judge everyone by their outward appearance. More events like this may help diffuse the divide between groups and create a more accepting and inviting community.", 'The teachers are very accommodating and passionate about their respective fields. Chatham is an environment that inspires creativity and catalyzes innovation through the offers of its faculty and departments.', 'Great school with amazing teachers. Ranked #1 by NJ.com for 4 years. The growing population needs to be addressed, and food could be better. Because it is in a rich white town, there is not much diversity to the student body.', 'I am very thankful for everything that Chatham High School has done for me. I have had great experiences in their track and cross country programs. I have also had many teachers who have taught me much much more than just necessary curriculum. My freshman year English teacher helped me fall in love with reading and writing with how devoted he was to the subject. Many teachers have experience in the fields they are teaching in. The computer science teacher has experience coding for Bell Labs. The college and career counselor was once an admissions counselor at Ithaca College. Another great thing about Chatham High School is that the principal has an open door policy. CHS prioritizes reducing stress among their students. One way this was done throughout my high school career was the switch from midterms and finals to cumulative tests, which are spread out to 3 times per year. Also, the school often has homework free breaks during holidays.', 'Chatham High School gives me many opportunities to excel in my academics and extra curriculars like sports and clubs. I have had the chance to choose a variety of electives ranging from different arts to academic electives such as marketing strategy esstials. CHS also gives students the choice to take a numerous amount of AP classes. The teachers are extremely helpful and will take time out of their breaks to help students with anything they are struggling in.   Although there is not as much diversity at this school as others, as a minority student I still feel welcomed and appreciated by the community. Overall, Chatham High School is a well rounded facility and throughout my high school career I have had an amazing experience from the start.', 'Chatham high provides you with an amazing education, and really prepared students for the future. All of the teachers are highly educated, and are determined to provide each and every student with the best education possible.', 'Chatham high school is a very welcoming and open-minded school with excellent academic opportunities and dedicated teachers.', 'Students- competitive and entitledAcademics - best of the best Teachers - range from involved and amazing to poor and apathetic Sports and activities- many offered', "I loved the acceptance that students have towards each other. There's little to no bullying, and there's many activities that can be done. You'll find the most unlikely friendships between people, and everybody there tries to do something for one another. The teachers are all qualified, and allow you to listen to them not as an instructor, but with the natural tone of a friend while composing the necessary knowledge needed for the students."]
column4: ['I enjoyed my high school experience very much. The teachers at Chatham High School are kind, supportive, and helpful. They really prepared me for college and I am grateful to have gone to such a good school.', 'Overall, great academics, sports, student environment, helpfulness of staff. Bathroom maintenance needed.', 'Chatham High School is an okay school, but it has a lot of flaws. One of the big problems is the diversity, there simply is none. There is a lack of minority teachers aside from the language teachers. There is a lack of space for eating lunch and kids are forced to eat on a tarp in a gym or on the bleachers. This coming year has been disorganized being that students coming are unaware of the schedule and have not received bus passes.', 'Great school spirit and sense of community. Encourages students to do their best and strive for success.', 'One of the best schools in New Jersey; amazing teachers, great clubs, and outstanding academics. Communication is always clear, and safety is always a top priority.', 'I have been here since 3rd grade and felt very welcomed and whenever I needed help teachers would always be there!', "Chatham HS is struggling sadly. Has become overcrowded and the situation is only getting worse with the 500+ new homes going up on river road. I just pulled my daughter and moved her to Mt St Mary's. She loves it, small classes. Teachers know who she is, wow, that's a novel idea! A low level of teenage girl BS which is not tolerated. Loves her friends and she is happy! What more could I ask for. My advice, make the right decision for your child before it's too late!", 'Is anyone aware that 700 new homes are now being built in Chatham on the site of the old Christmas tree farm on River Road? Does everyone know that the Freshman children in the HS eat their meals in the hallway on the floor!?  40 plus students per class, bullying is at an all time high. Overcrowding is currently a major issue at Chatham HS. The school is not designed to have a second floor built on it. Students are now taking classes online as a "creative solution." The administration and board are lost and have no idea what to do.  Do you think you\'re the only one who thought, "Chatham has good schools we should move there!" Forget it, the secret is out. Summit HS, Bernards HS, Madison HS, Mendham HS all now are much better solutions.', 'Student Safety is a major concern and it should be for you too. I asked my daughter if there are any children she thinks could "go postal" she responded, "oh yeah!!!" and proceeded to name several students. I am now looking into private schools for my daughter. The HS has seen a massive increase in students and bullying incidents and as a response they added another psychologist to the staff. Seriously??? Great use of our tax dollars. How about metal detectors and a police officer! I\'m not waiting for the 36th school shooting this year. Administration is inept!', 'Guess who I am. Rumors are that I had an affair with a student, I have my lab assistants do my errands for me during school (dry cleaning pick-up), I had another student go to my condo wake my child feed and dress him and take him to school and I was fired as a coach of one of the girls HS teams. Yet...I still have a job! :-)', 'SB #57-98 IN THE MATTER OF THE ISSUANCE OF : STATE BOARD OF EDUCATION A COUNTY SUBSTITUTE CERTIFICATE : DECISION ... now I know why she was fired as our swim coach! Who made the decision to hire her!? Her brother!?', "Chatham High School not only offers one of the best academic curriculums in New Jersey, but also offers activities for everyone. From sports teams, clubs, organizations, and performing arts, there is a place for everyone to feel accepted. There is seemingly a place for everyone, but each group tend to become very exclusive which creates cliques. This is common among young people this age, but there are steps our community can take to diffuse this issue. I would like to see more collaboration between all different types of students outside the classroom. One annual event that helps with this is Challenge Day. About 200 students are selected each year to break into groups among peers of freshman to seniors to share their highs and lows, allowing them to feel like they aren't alone and to understand to not judge everyone by their outward appearance. More events like this may help diffuse the divide between groups and create a more accepting and inviting community.", 'The teachers are very accommodating and passionate about their respective fields. Chatham is an environment that inspires creativity and catalyzes innovation through the offers of its faculty and departments.', 'Great school with amazing teachers. Ranked #1 by NJ.com for 4 years. The growing population needs to be addressed, and food could be better. The computer science teacher has experience coding for Bell Labs. The college and career counselor was once an admissions counselor at Ithaca College. One way this was done throughout my high school career was the switch from midterms and finals to cumulative tests, which are spread out to 3 times per year. Also, the school often has homework free breaks during holidays.', 'Chatham High School gives me many opportunities to excel in my academics and extra curriculars like sports and clubs. The teachers are extremely helpful and will take time out of their breaks to help students with anything they are struggling in.   Although there is not as much diversity at this school as others, as a minority student I still feel welcomed and appreciated by the community. Overall, Chatham High School is a well rounded facility and throughout my high school career I have had an amazing experience from the start.', 'Chatham high provides you with an amazing education, and really prepared students for the future. All of the teachers are highly educated, and are determined to provide each and every student with the best education possible.', 'Chatham high school is a very welcoming and open-minded school with excellent academic opportunities and dedicated teachers.', 'Students- competitive and entitledAcademics - best of the best Teachers - range from involved and amazing to poor and apathetic Sports and activities- many offered', "I loved the acceptance that students have towards each other. There's little to no bullying, and there's many activities that can be done. You'll find the most unlikely friendships between people, and everybody there tries to do something for one another. The teachers are all qualified, and allow you to listen to them not as an instructor, but with the natural tone of a friend while composing the necessary knowledge needed for the students."]
column6: ["Chatham High School consistently ranks as a top school, but let's face it, are the rich kids really smarter or better athletes? There is a lot of stress in this school (much of it parent-driven), and most (not all) kids who take any advanced classes have tutors to go with it. Most athletes also have private coaching. If your child fits the Chatham mold they may have a great experience. The school is too small for the student body, kids eat in the gyms with tarps down, folding tables, and on the bleachers. The teachers are average. Some teachers blame the entire class if they don't understand something. There is zero diversity here. There are so little students of color that everyone knows who they are. Students drive BMWs and other luxury cars to school. It's just not a school that fosters confidence or individuality.", 'The school spirit an atmosphere is what makes Chatham great. The school is very well rounded as academics, sports, and clubs/activities are all great. There is also a great community feel at Chatham because of its smaller size.', 'Chatham High School is school which allows a student to discover themselves in a new light. As they move onto the next year, they change and become more mature. It is a school where I am proud to say is against bullying and you will never see it as you walk throughout the school. I am proud to have spent four years here as I have learned so much from my amazing teachers in such a loving environment.', 'Many of the teachers are very good at Chatham High School, however some are much worse than others. I have had teachers that have sucked all the fun out of learning, but I have also had some amazing educators that made school interesting. Also, some classes, despite being at the same level, have much different standards due to different teachers teaching the same class. For example, some teachers give a much greater workload and do not provide study guides for tests, while other teachers educating at the same level do. I feel that this must be changed.  One thing I would not want to change about  Chatham High School is the amount of clubs it has. There are all different clubs students are able to join from Robotics to Art; everyone can find their niche.', 'Really love the environment here. And the students and teachers as well!!!! Strong overall programs.', 'I graduated last year, and it was a very great high school. I felt very ready for college due to the high level of demand that is instills in their students.', "Great school with great teachers. Lower schools' administrations seem to be getting worse given how annoying an cliquey the incoming freshmen get each new year...", 'You go to Chatham for the education and the teachers because just about everything else is subpar. There are a lot of great AP courses and electives that you can choose from which help if you are trying to figure out what you may want to major in later in college.', 'The academics are challenging but the teachers are all very good.  In general, the school is great and supports its students for the future.', 'So far my experience has been great. I moved to Chatham from out of the state and with all faculty gave a very warm welcome and helped me get through the long and far move, as well as making me feel welcome at the school. There were a variety of things that Chatham High School did to ensure the new kids had friends one of them having a new kids orientation, to give everyone the chance to make friends. Also, being a freshman and a new kid they assigned me a mentor and buddy who was becoming a senior. My mentor reached out to me a few times during the year to make sure I was doing ok and aways had my questions answered. The one thing I would like to see change is the honor roll system. Throughout freshman year I got honor roll every marking period taking normal and regular classes. But I did find it a little unfair that the other kids taking concepts and foundations classes were able to obtain high honor roll even though they were taking easier classes.', 'i like the school. but it could be cleaner and they could hire better teachers and make more food because they always run out of food during c lunch', 'Ok. Truth be told. Chatham high is an adequate high school. Good for very high achievers and for those with special needs. For all others, you get lost quick and there is zero support. Rumor has it shady issues around AP courses to "fluff" profile.', "Chatham High School has put the up most effort into helping make students succeed. THe school has provided numerous types of learning environments as well as plenty of helpful learning tools such as Chrome Books. I've never seen a teacher give up on a student before. I believe the teachers have faith in us that we have the greatness to be amazing.", 'CHS makes me feel loved, and wishes to make me feel successful. There fantastic faculty and facility makes me feel safe, confident, and encouraged to succeed. There are hundreds of clubs and different courses to take part in, ensuring that each and every student is able to find activities to do that seek their interest(s).', 'The teachers and students in the Chatham community are very motivated and dedicated to academics. The coursework is difficult and challenging, as well as hefty. However, students learn quickly to cope with the large amounts of homework. Students have a lot of pressure to take many AP classes and score well as getting into a competitive college is the main focus in this community. There are cliques in the school, but this is typical of many American high schools. I have never experienced any bullying and the high school is a very safe environment. However, the student body is primarily white with little diversity, so many students do feel pressure to conform to the behaviors of their classmates.', "Chatham High School is definitely not for everyone. Personally, I don't not like it at all. Everyone was so focused on getting above average scores, so getting bad grades if frowned upon. I feel very stressed every day, while I have friends in other schools have it easy (as easy as high school gets). The teachers here mean well but some  are very strict.", 'The atmosphere at Chatham High has been very good. The academics are challenging, but the teachers are always willing to help you out of class. Everyone is competitive, but it doesn’t go to extremes unless you want it too. For the most part, it drives you to be the best you can. The town is mostly upper-middle class and white, and the majority of people wear clothes from Vineyard Vines and Patagonia. It can get cliquey with the students, but there will always be a group to accept you and the teachers are the kind of people that you can sit down and have a conversation about everything from existentialism to dabbing with. Overall, I am enjoying going to Chatham High School and I would recommend going here.', "I was bullied back in highschool and although Chatham prepared me for college, I was still left with some emotional scars from the push of everyone around me to go to college even if it wasn't something I wanted to do", 'Chatham High School is ranked 316 best public school in America by New US. US News ranks it as the 16th best school in New Jersey and it is ranked at 145 for the the best STEM schools high schools. Chatham is a fantastic school that provides a rigorous education that prepares students for college. Chatham provides a variety of classes from regular to AP levels. It help students prepare and apply to the college of their choice.', 'Overall, I loved my experience at Chatham High School. The school has a rigorous and interesting curriculum. There is support within the school and the community to help each student succeed. The school spirit and sports keep a happy and involved student body. Students here are involved with everything from various clubs, sports, theater, band, and more. Everyone does something they love on top of school work.  ']

column2: ['I loved how ready I felt for college and how involved school guidance counselors are in college readiness. Students are better off here when it comes to preparedness. Only issue is that lunch periods are not mandatory therefore leading to students either having to lunch or eating every other day.', "I would say that my education at North has been good and there a lot of great teachers who really care about their students and make class enjoyable. However, the school spirit at north is terrible and the administration doesn't care about improving it. There are also problems with led in the water and a cockroach infestation.", "I liked the rah rah school spirit but people aren't the nicest. Pretty diverse and has lots of fun traditions.", 'I think that, generally, Clarkstown North High School is a good high school. There are a lot of clubs students can join and activities you can do.', 'My experience  at Clarkstown North was great.  Teachers went out of there way to help when needed.  On the other hand the school MUST be renovated and updated.', "Overall, North is an excellent school. I love the number of academic options offered (AP & IB classes). The teachers are very supportive and encouraging to the students. Our school store, the Ram's Cave, is a great source of nutrition for hungry students, as well as apparel. In addition, there is a variety of clubs at North, however, many of them meet infrequently and lack adequate structure.", 'In my four years of high school, I experienced a lot at North. Not only was it a very good school academically, it is big and has a lot to offer. The school is amazing with sports as well. I appreciate the hard work the administration and teachers put in. They really do a great job. In 4 years I have had many different teachers and I have never had a bad experience with any of them. Awesome school!', 'It’s a good high school that prepares you very well for college. Teachers care a lot about their students and students get along well for the most part.', 'The education at the school was extremely beneficial, the school really did a good job of helping students learn and being better prepared for college and also being ready for standardized tests. no real problem with fights or bullying when I was in school there.', "I liked that  I had lots of support between my guidance counselors and other counselor's at school. I just wish the teacher's were more understanding of the other classes we had with how much work they give and all the tests they give in one week because sometimes it can cause lots of stress.", 'To improve the athletic facilities for all sports.  Update the classrooms and buildings.  Exterminate. Provide air conditioning in all classroom during the spring/summer months', 'Clarkstown North Senior High School is undoubtedly one of the best high schools in New York. This is mainly because of the level of college readiness and academics the school offers. The average act, sat, gpa, and ap scores at CHSN are some of the highest. In addition, the clubs, sports, and culture at North makes the school one of the best. We also have IB courses, SUPA, and at Albany courses, which really help students in getting ready for college. It is also worth mentioning that recently, the school turned an unused classroom into a "senior lounge," where seniors can sit during their lunch periods. On the other hand, the facilities might be considered a little old, and cockroaches can be seen very frequently.', 'At this school, it’s very much what you make of it. You can pursue honors & college-level classes and come out w/ a ticket to an ivy and 30 college credits, or you can do the bare minimum. There’s a very wide range of classes for those who excel and for those who need a helping hand, which is great. That being said, I think their IB Diploma program is a stretch too far. Students in that graduate burnt out & bitter. Not worth it, at least here. TEACHERS: great, although you may get landed with the stray terrible ones. Happens. MENTAL HLTH RESRCES: I can personally attest that they do a really good job. BUILDINGS: vary in quality. No air condition, no heat. It’s not dingey, but not pristine. The roaches are still around. They’re the unofficial mascot.ARTS: Very good. The teachers in the art department are passionate and wonderful at their work. There are lots of classes available and a very active honors society that’s done a lot of work worth being proud of.', 'I had an amazing experience at Clarkstown North High School, yet I wish to change the building itself, as some parts of the school are very old and could use some retouching and fixing up.', "I love this school! Before freshman year, I was scared of going into high school because I hated my time at Festa, but since then, I've made so many amazing friends and I've had the chance to go on several trips to places like Yale and Washington D.C. Your experience at North is what you make of it. If you're struggling with a class, attend an extra help or get peer tutoring. Joining clubs is also a great way to meet new people. I have loved most of the teachers I've had at North in the last two years and I know I'll be bawling when I leave after senior year.", "It wasn't that bad of a school. The teachers were good at their jobs, they taught well. Of course, some had their favourite students but it bothered me none. Most of the people there were nice and inclusive. Nothing bad ever really happened while I attended, so that's a plus. Just added a senior lounge too which is actually pretty cool because now the seniors had another place to hang out and be with friends in a relaxed environment. Classes were fairly easy and fun at times.", "Everyone enjoys school activities! Foot ball games against south are definitely something everyone looks forward to in the fall. Unfortunately the sport teams aren't as good as south but I heard they have gotten a lot better. The groups of people aren't really open minded about meeting new people so there is outcast.  Would love to see people being more out going and friendly.", 'Minority is not the biggest crowed. Most people that go there have been going to school with each other since pre school so when it comes time to make new friends people aren’t really open minded about it. When applying for colleges I feel like guidance could do so much better guiding and explaining students their options.', 'My experience so far at Clarkstown North Senior High School has been amazing. Teachers and staff are unconditionally kind and their good intentions definitely shine through! I feel as though this school has prepared me for future college experiences by exposing me to a rigourous schedule that forces me to focus on time management and organization. Although this school has an overwhelming amount of positive attributes, one aspect of this school that I would like to see change is the music program. Personally, as a member of the school concert band and marching band, I felt as though as a school we could have contributed more to our community as a whole.', 'The academics, teachers, support and advantages students have at North are astounding. The facilities however are run down and old. Freshman sports should come back. Overall, pretty happy with the high school.']

I just wish the teacher's were more understanding of the other classes we had with how much work they give and all the tests they give in one week because sometimes it can cause lots of stress.", 'To improve the athletic facilities for all sports.  Update the classrooms and buildings.  Exterminate. Provide air conditioning in all classroom during the spring/summer months', 'Clarkstown North Senior High School is undoubtedly one of the best high schools in New York. This is mainly because of the level of college readiness and academics the school offers. The average act, sat, gpa, and ap scores at CHSN are some of the highest. In addition, the clubs, sports, and culture at North makes the school one of the best. We also have IB courses, SUPA, and at Albany courses, which really help students in getting ready for college. It is also worth mentioning that recently, the school turned an unused classroom into a "senior lounge," where seniors can sit during their lunch periods. On the other hand, the facilities might be considered a little old, and cockroaches can be seen very frequently.', 'At this school, it’s very much what you make of it. You can pursue honors & college-level classes and come out w/ a ticket to an ivy and 30 college credits, or you can do the bare minimum. There’s a very wide range of classes for those who excel and for those who need a helping hand, which is great. That being said, I think their IB Diploma program is a stretch too far. Students in that graduate burnt out & bitter. Not worth it, at least here. TEACHERS: great, although you may get landed with the stray terrible ones. Happens. MENTAL HLTH RESRCES: I can personally attest that they do a really good job. BUILDINGS: vary in quality. No air condition, no heat. It’s not dingey, but not pristine. The roaches are still around. They’re the unofficial mascot.ARTS: Very good. The teachers in the art department are passionate and wonderful at their work. There are lots of classes available and a very active honors society that’s done a lot of work worth being proud of.', 'I had an amazing experience at Clarkstown North High School, yet I wish to change the building itself, as some parts of the school are very old and could use some retouching and fixing up.', "I love this school! Before freshman year, I was scared of going into high school because I hated my time at Festa, but since then, I've made so many amazing friends and I've had the chance to go on several trips to places like Yale and Washington D.C. Your experience at North is what you make of it. If you're struggling with a class, attend an extra help or get peer tutoring. Joining clubs is also a great way to meet new people. I have loved most of the teachers I've had at North in the last two years and I know I'll be bawling when I leave after senior year.", "It wasn't that bad of a school. The teachers were good at their jobs, they taught well. Of course, some had their favourite students but it bothered me none. Most of the people there were nice and inclusive. Nothing bad ever really happened while I attended, so that's a plus. Just added a senior lounge too which is actually pretty cool because now the seniors had another place to hang out and be with friends in a relaxed environment. Classes were fairly easy and fun at times.", "Everyone enjoys school activities! Foot ball games against south are definitely something everyone looks forward to in the fall. Unfortunately the sport teams aren't as good as south but I heard they have gotten a lot better. The groups of people aren't really open minded about meeting new people so there is outcast.  Would love to see people being more out going and friendly.", 'Minority is not the biggest crowed. Most people that go there have been going to school with each other since pre school so when it comes time to make new friends people aren’t really open minded about it. When applying for colleges I feel like guidance could do so much better guiding and explaining students their options.', 'My experience so far at Clarkstown North Senior High School has been amazing. Teachers and staff are unconditionally kind and their good intentions definitely shine through! I feel as though this school has prepared me for future college experiences by exposing me to a rigourous schedule that forces me to focus on time management and organization. Although this school has an overwhelming amount of positive attributes, one aspect of this school that I would like to see change is the music program. Personally, as a member of the school concert band and marching band, I felt as though as a school we could have contributed more to our community as a whole.', 'The academics, teachers, support and advantages students have at North are astounding. The facilities however are run down and old. Freshman sports should come back. Overall, pretty happy with the high school.']
column6: ['The school is great, as old and sad as it may look. I learned a lot there and I had a lot of great resources available to me. They make sure that you get into a college of your choice.', 'I had an amazing high school experience filled with spirit, friends, sports, and academics. I would not trade it for the world.', "Clarkstown North High School  is undoubtedly, the most absolute average school to ever exist. Just its complete lack of anything interesting should make it exceptional, and yet, it fails at even that. North has its quirks that balance with its flaws, making a nice even playing field. There are cockroaches scattered through the halls, and festive decorations and posters on the walls. There's a cafeteria so old the tables could fall apart with one misplaced lunch tray and a PTA run school store that sells the best raps. I could go on and on about how great and how terrible North is, but in the interest of wasted time I'll leave it at this. North taught me not to have high expectations, but that expectations are important. North is not good and it is not bad. It is average, but that isn't necessarily a bad thing.", 'I loved clarkstown for amount of programs and activities it gives you for after school. It allows you to participant in multiple activities by creating new relationships and friends through high school.I would like them to get rid of cockroach problem they have though.', 'The teachers care very much about their students. However the food serves is terrible and too pricey. The bathrooms and hallway are very gross and there are often cockroaches in classrooms. Class money spent very poorly. Clubs are not as active and encouraged as they should be. Overall the teachers care way more than any of the administration.', 'challenging  classes, engaged teachers. opportunities to excel.    kids are friendly and involved in social causes.', 'The only good part about North is the academics. The teachers are usually stellar, and guidance is extremely helpful. However, everything about this school is awful. It is extremely cliquey. I have had a horrendous social life here, and no one seems to accept different people into their friend groups. There is a culture of disdain and exclusion fostered by the principal himself; the teachers sometimes make kids feel unloved too. Clubs here rarely meet and it is hard to find friends even there; no one gives others the time of day. Even the kids who are socially powerful hate our school; everyone here is depressed and/or anxious and can be overloaded with hours of work and studying a day. Sports teams are extremely difficult to make - every sport from baseball to volleyball has cuts, and it takes years to play varsity. If you want your child to have a good life outside of academics, don’t send them here. This place is the level of hell that Dante forgot about.', 'I like the teachers, they are extremely helpful. They all have extra help and make sure that no-one is confused. There are also a lot of clubs and other activities to get involved in at the school.', 'Attending Clarkstown North High School has been the best four years of my life.  I have enjoyed all that my school offers, including academics, sports, clubs and friends.', "During my teen years my family had sent me to three different high schools due to my parent's jobs. Clarkstown North was my favorite out of all. The school was welcoming and offered many activities for their students. Parents were highly involved with school events. Made incredible friendships while attending there.", "Clarkstown North has a wide array of clubs and activities. However, some of these clubs seldom meet and have any information regarding them and the sports teams are difficult to make because an enormous group of kids try out. 140 KIDS tried out for track and of course I got cut. The teachers are helpful but the English teachers especially are challenging, even at a regular level. Hours of homework and the student body is extraordinarily cliquey. Hard to make friends when fitting in is an issue. Diversity include 70% white people, Jews, Asian-Americans, and a minor percentage of African-American and Latino students. It's difficult to ask for changes because the superintendent and the board don't listen to students. Cockroaches and pollutants rampant.", 'There i a huge bug problem that needs to be fixed. Food needs to be better with more variety.  There is no salad bar and also we should of had more drills for lovk downs.  We had only2 this yeAr', 'The one aspect of Clarkstown High School North that I would like to see change is the cleanliness. There are cockroaches that are seen from time to time in the school and it would be a better learning environment if there were no cockroaches as distractions. One of the good aspects of Clarkstown North is the community it provides. One can easily find their group of friends and fit in.', "I love the teachers at my school. They're so invested and attentive towards their students. The facilities are sub-par, but the amazing work put forth by the teachers  makes up for it. The sports get a lot of focus and sometimes overshadow the other clubs and teams (Debate etc..), resulting in the latter not getting the attention they deserve. School spirit is primarily shown at sports games. Every morning before a football game, the cheerleaders and marching band march through the halls before class. Our amazing school counselors help prepare you for college early and mostly everyone has some idea of what they want by Sophomore year, but if you don't put any effort in you won't see the same results. Wide variety of clubs, so there is something for everyone. We have a very mixed student body and GSA is a very prominent club. Security is very important and they take threats of violence and any bullying seriously. I'm enjoying my time at North and will look back on it fondly", "I'm currently a senior at Clarkstown High School North. I think academically speaking, we excel. Most of the teachers will stay after even after their extra help hours to see to it that you get a good education. CHSN also offers a lot of extracurricular activities such as clubs and sports. The people in the school can be a little clique and tend to stay within their own groups. The school however, can be improved.", "Clarkstown North High School has definitely demonstrated to me how diversity can be undermined by many in society. While still being a senior at Clarkstown North, I feel like I have not yet gotten the readiness I need in order to attend college next year. The guidance counselors weren't very helpful in the college process, and were hardly ever available to speak with students. The administration has never been understanding towards a student's needs and goals. However, the teachers are always willing to help their students strive in their classes. They are always there for each of their students, even if the student is having difficulties outside of the classroom.", 'Clarkstown North Senior High School provided me a great experience throughout my high school career.  ', 'I had a good time at my school. The teachers were nice and there were a lot of different courses provided. ', "I loved my high school experience, and there is little I would change about it. I was always given resources to solve my problems and ample opportunities for help whether it be for college, or for academics. I would change the amount of student imput though, despite the fact that it is growing, I think the student council should be able to make more sound decisions and the administration should stop taking all the credit for the student body's achievements. ", 'Most teachers are dedicated to their students.']

column2: ['Great. I have no complaints with the teachers I’ve had in the past and the social workers really help make it a place of comfort if your new to the school.', 'Lynbrook Senior High School is a great school but I do wish they were better at hiring replacement teacher. They focus a lot on safety, although, they have an open campus. The other students are really nice and so are teacher and coaches.', 'Friendly and supportive staff and teachers with a plethora of extracurriculars offered. Student environment is mostly friendly. Quite a few fun student events occur including class night.', 'I love Lynbrook High School! It has given me so many opportunities in clubs, classes, and the student culture. This schools offers a variety of AP classes, many of which I have taken, that help prepare the students for college. All of the extracurricular activities are such a great experience and so much fun!', "Lynbrook is a great school with the perfect amount of students. There aren't too many where you can get lost in a crowd, and there aren't too few where you're limited and everyone knows each others business. The teachers know everyone's name and genuinely care about their students.", 'Lynbrook High School prepared me for the rest of my academic career. It has offered me many tremendous opportunities that I will be forever grateful for. Without the help of my teachers, counselors, and friends, I would not be where I am today.', 'Lynbrook High School is a great high school for its academics, college preparation and emphasis on student safety. Classes are rigorous (as long as they are AP or Honors-level) and academics are emphasized only slightly less than athletics. Lynbrook athletics, while mostly unsuccessful, help the community come together around our sports teams and build a sense of school pride. Many classes at Lynbrook are more difficult than college courses and I often find myself helping my friends in college with their homework in subjects like Biology and Calculus. Overall, Lynbrook is a place to grow and the administration and safety policies here definitely promote that growth.', 'I love that the school is open campus and all the teachers are super great but, the students are very cliquey and its hard to make friends here.', 'I transferred to this school sophomore year from a private school, and it granted me many opportunities that I did not have in my old school. Academically challenging but worth it', 'A great high school! Very dedicated, talented, close knit staff who care about their students. Average infrastructure, but very safe and in a convenient area. Overall a good experience.', 'Lynbrook was full of very caring and encouraging teachers and staff. The school is relatively small compared to some other towns but there is certainly a lot of pride surrounding this community.', "My favorite thing about Lynbrook High School is how many activities we have like Class-night, Sports-night, lots of concerts and trips and so many other activities. But I would love to see the School grow bigger, like it would be amazing if the Chorus Room wasn't in the auditorium but a real Chorus room with lots of stands and space to properly sing.", 'If you want a school that can provide a decent education for you then you will be satisfied with lynbrook. The school is extremely cliquey and, coming from the city where diversity is huge, the student body seems awfully white. Its honestly hit or miss, you either love it or hate it.', "Throughout my 4 years at Lynbrook High School, I learned a lot. With the help of the great teachers and kids I pushed myself to limits I wouldn't believe were possible. The great staff and people accompany the outstanding atmosphere.", "My experience was very smooth and easy going. Environment is very nice with friendly people that are always ready to help. One of the best high schools to go to. I wouldn't really change much.", 'At my High School, Lynbrook Senior High School, all the teachers are very interested in you and your life and do anything they can to help you succeed the best way you can. I am a visual learning and most teachers will sit with me and show me visually what im learning so that i can grasp it better.', 'LHS has been a good experience. Some teachers are better than others and the you learn nothing in AP classes and just fail. ', "There are various clubs including GSA, an award winning newspaper, cooking, Spanish, Italian, poetry, and others. They are all supervised by staff members. If you don't like any of the clubs available, students are allowed to get some friends, and one staff member to start up a new club.", "I would choose this school again because the students and faculty made coming from another town very easy. The people were very approachable and finding people to talk to was relatively easy. This school is unique because everyone seems to care about everyone. There's no discrimination between jocks, actors/actresses, artists, etc. Everyone has friends with a variety of interests. Athletes aren't only friends with athletes and so on.", "I think the staff at this school does a truly remarkable job at trying to get their students to understand the content. They give extra help hours that are very flexible. All of the teachers I have ever encountered have never let a struggling student in any of my classes just slide. They always try to help them out, even if they don't want it and don't really seem to care."]
