column6: ['The workload is usually manageable but sometimes teachers need to coordinate more with each other.', "Sometimes the school gets too involved in the student's life", 'For the most part, everyone joins the cliche teams like football, lacrosse and kickline', "For a small school, LHS has a lot of school spirit. You'll always find kids at the football and lacrosse games.Some of the best school  events that go on are homecoming, lax day and of course, Classnight and Sportsnight. At times the school can be cliquey, but eventually everyone finds their own groups.", "Most of the teachers at LHS generally care about their quality of the student's education, but occasionally you'll get a lazy teacher that just assigns busy work.", 'I feel safe in the school.  the school takes excellent precautions to keep us safe and healthy', "The school is outdated and has not been renovated since 1970.  A recent bond to upgrade the school failed in a community vote.  We don't have the space to introduce new programs to our school.  My robotics team went from 1 team to 4 teams but we don't have room for our entire club.  I feel like many of the teachers in our school are alumni students.  I feel the school needs outsiders and fresh ideas.", 'I feel very safe at the school and we have security guards at all the entrances', 'The clubs usually have events that aim to include the entire student body.', 'Lynbrook is a great community where the families put their all into making our high school experience amazing!  The students are like family and the teachers are always looking out for our best interest!', 'Teachers are always willing to help and put in extra time if needed.', 'Once college attendance comes it is a dog fight', 'They help the students that want to do well', 'A wide variety, with interests across all areas - arts, music, science, journalism, athletics, etc.', 'This school gets a great deal of support for music and arts, and they are attempting to increase the STEM programs, including upgrades to STEM facilities, hiring more qualified teachers in those areas and adding classes.', 'In general, the teachers are friendly and helpful.  There are a very small handful that are unapproachable and downright rude.', 'Great teachers and help all over', 'Most of the teachers work hard and have close relationships with their students. A lot of homework is given. No phones are allowed during school hours including the cafeteria, where kids go to eat, relax, and do work.', "Made me very prepared and educated. Helped form me into the person I am today. Lack of a lot of diversity, but it is full of a lot of people who I call my friends and good people. Cliques can be annoying, but overall, I didn't have much trouble having friends in all different groups, even if we didn't hang out too often. The guidance department could have been a lot more helpful at times.", 'My overall experience at this school has been great, on my first day of school when I was new, everyone made me feel welcomed and it felt sort of like home a little. I felt like I could fit in and I made a lot of friends. I would still choose this school if I could do it all over because it has helped me grow in my independence and I have become more confident in myself.']

There are a very small handful that are unapproachable and downright rude.', 'Great teachers and help all over', 'Most of the teachers work hard and have close relationships with their students. A lot of homework is given. No phones are allowed during school hours including the cafeteria, where kids go to eat, relax, and do work.', "Made me very prepared and educated. Helped form me into the person I am today. Lack of a lot of diversity, but it is full of a lot of people who I call my friends and good people. Cliques can be annoying, but overall, I didn't have much trouble having friends in all different groups, even if we didn't hang out too often. The guidance department could have been a lot more helpful at times.", 'My overall experience at this school has been great, on my first day of school when I was new, everyone made me feel welcomed and it felt sort of like home a little. I felt like I could fit in and I made a lot of friends. I would still choose this school if I could do it all over because it has helped me grow in my independence and I have become more confident in myself.']

column2: ['I recently moved to this high school from Toronto last year. All of the teachers have been extremely kind to help me fit into my new environment, especially my guidance counselor. This school is a large size school that offers a variety of club choices along with unique courses such as sport marketing classes.', 'Great school.  I am able to voice my opinion freely and openly while being supported by administration.  The clubs and sports are A+.  Would highly recommend this High School.', 'I would describe my experience at south as decent on some days. I struggled through some classes but in the end I pushed through and was pretty happy with my result. There are teachers that will wear and tear you, but there are teachers that are lovely and inspiring.', 'Clarkstown South has wonderful academics.  The teachers and administration make an effort to ensure that students are in the best learning environment for them.  They offer many different opportunities for students to explore their interests.  The counselors, for the most part, work hard to help students with college readiness.', 'I have learned many things from Clarkstown South High School from my classes, teachers, and even my friends. It is a very helpful, diverse, and accepting community and I truly feel like I’m part of a family.', 'South High School is probably one of the highlights of my life. It offers great resources and has amazing teachers who will help you thrive in school and out. The school offers great extracurricular activities and academics. My tip would be to be involved in school! However, I would suggest for the school to start an AP Psychology course for students. I believe that it will help students learn more about psychology and be passionate about it. The facilities are clean, sometimes.', 'Overall, Clarkstown South was a good high school, and I made many good memories, and I felt respected as a student.', 'Amazing, approachable teachers; wide-variety of clubs with many leadership opportunities; fantastic balance of academic rigor and school spirit; dedicated staff; so much more!', "The best thing about Clarkstown South is the teachers. Most of them genuinely care about what their students and are passionate about what they are teaching, especially the English teachers. I think the main issue for students is the overwhelming workload. Another issue here is that students don't truly get punished for anything. Many students do not feel safe here because of this. It feels like this school puts all its money towards sports and leaves everything else behind. The substitute teachers are underappreciated and disrespected. The biggest problem here is the administrations inability to communicate information with others, which often leads to unnecessary confusion and chaos.   The best thing about South is the people. I have made a lot of great friends here and learned a lot from my experiences with them and my favorite teachers I've had.", "i'm currently a sophmore at South and i love it. for the most part,my teachers are amazing. they are kind and attentive. i especially love our principal, Mrs Tarantino. the only thing i would change at school is the bathrooms, they're kind of gross. the custodians do their best, but at this point it's just not enough.", 'I had an amazing high school experience and I wouldn’t change it for the world. The teachers at South care about their students and want them to do well, for the most part. DUAL ENROLLMENT CLASSES ARE A BLESSING.... if you are able to I highly recommend I went into college with 25 credits!! Makes sure to take advantage of the wide range of business classes offered as electives!!  The athletic events at South are well attended and very fun so don’t miss out!! Overall I highly recommend this school I graduated fully prepared to take on college and have adjusted well, thanks to the rigor and variety of classes.', 'Clarkstown South is a great school in a good school district. The resources available make this school great, as education is focused on and every endeavor- sports, theatre, and clubs- are well funded. Teachers are not stretched thin and are able to perform well in the optimal settings provided.', "The teachers at Clarkstown South are driven to see their students succeed. They are very helpful and understanding given a student's specific circumstances.", "An apprehensive, brace-faced ninth grader walked into South unaware of just how transformative her years here would be. I value my education most and am so fortunate to learn here; however, I would enjoy a larger variety of offered classes. As an economics major, I found my passion through my microeconomics class- economics makes the seemingly unpredictable manageable, just as South has done for me as a person. I would have loved to further my studies with macroeconomics, but South does not offer this course. Although courses are limited, it never hindered my growth because interdisciplinary learning mixed economics into several of my other classes- like research projects in Environmental or the study of different economic systems in government. Extracurricular opportunities completed my experience- like my school's endless support for my club that promotes fair treatment of those with mental disabilities. I couldn't be happier with the person that South shaped me into.", 'The education is good. There are a large variety of classes and extracurricular activities. The school itself is somewhat unsightly, it is dimly lit with few windows  in the halls and most materials like books are quite worn.', 'I enjoyed my 4 yrs at South.  Great school in a great area. I was very involved in activities and sports.  Through these activities, I was introduced to so many people.  I took a lot of AP CLASSES, so I was challenged with my curriculum.', 'I liked the educational resources available to all students specified to their interests. Personally, I want to pursue TV production and the TV studio and teachers were superb. Other teachers though were not very pleasant and the school district overall is unrealistically strict with the students. The education we receive I feel truly prepares every student for college. There are also numerous clubs and activities to take part in. The sports teams are consistently very good and go far in their competitions.', 'South is an average high school. I skipped my senior year to take classes at the local community college because of how much i did not enjoy my time there', 'The school offers an exceptional range of courses and college level classes, as well as interesting electives. There are an incredible amount of clubs and you can start one if you want.  The students are very diverse, so there is something for everyone.  Get involved in a club or sport and make new friends.', 'This school is something out of a movie. Almost like mean girls. The school principle had an affair with a social studies teacher. While the health/ gym teacher had an on going relationship with a student for 2 years while he had a new born baby. It was always interesting going to school everyday.']

column6: ['I have found school is like any experience in life, we get out of it what we invest. If you become involved in high school, you will walk away with a different experience then the student that just attends class each day. In my 4 years in Clarkstown South I have been a member of swim team, crew team, band, and a member of VASSA (Varsity Athletes Against Substance Abuse).This program provided me an opportunity to speak to  students in the district about the dangers of drugs and alcohol, and serve as role model for the youth in our district. Academically I had the opportunity to attend the local Community College in my senior year, while maintaining my involvement in all of my high school activities. This allowed me  to explore courses that will prepare me for my chosen career in nursing, as I plan to attend college in the Fall. I will walk away from Clarkstown South when I graduate this June, but the bonds with teachers and friends will last a lifetime.', 'It is a great high school for its academic rigor based on the classes you take. Most teachers are friendly and the staff is helpful. However, lunch is not so great. The school is not very racially diverse.', 'I  loved the community involvement at Clarkstown South. The faculty does an amazing job making every student feel welcome, and that we as individual students are their priorities.', 'I really liked the clubs  and student engagement. I think that the school did a really good job of fostering an engaged student body.', 'I would like to see teachers engage with their students more. For example, there are some teachers that will reach out and speak to a student that they see is struggling, which is very helpful and comforting, even if the student decides not to disclose much information. I believe that if all teachers showed this level of attention for and concern for the wellbeing of all their students, students would feel more cared-about and included in school.', 'It’s like stepping into the Twilight Zone. So much weird stuff happens here that sounds like it’s coming from a novel (there’s a suspicious brown puddle beneath the bleachers from unknown substances, the clock in the gym has gone missing even though it was covered with a plastic shield that was bolted to the wall). Once you “go to South” you “go to South.” It’s something that you can’t describe unless you come here. The honors classes are great because the kids in them are friendly, funny, and weird (I can’t say the same for the kids in the regular courses). Their NHS chapter is a strange cult. Fire alarms go off because kids vape near them on purpose. Weed is everywhere. There are a lot of amazing and weird teachers that you really bond with over the years.', 'their are some really amazing and involved teachers. Their is a wide array of sports, clubs and activities.', "Good school, but a poor administration that lacks the will to collaborate with others; petitions and issues will be brought to administration just to be ignored or turned down without sound reason or clear explanation. I enjoyed my time there but the entire student body and staff shouldn't see the principal and other likeminded individuals as roadblocks any time something is proposed.", 'The teacher are dedicated and care about the students.  The school has a huge selection of after school clubs and activities.', 'I had a good experience at Clarkstown South. I made a lot of friends and did pretty well in school. My teachers prepared me well for Regents Exams and for upper level classes.', 'This is one of the best districts in the area based on public schools. However it is an older school and needs to be worked on with the interior the hallways are depressing with no natural light and feel trapped once inside. School is strict when it comes to different ideas.', 'Through my high school career the challenging academic classes have always made me aware of my privilege in my educational opportunities.', 'I loved Clarkstown South. These past four years have been the best of my life. My academic, social, and athletic life with this school has made me such a well-rounded and confident person. There is little I would change about my high school experience.', 'South high school have given me an great high school experience. From fun school events like sports games, to meeting amazing teachers, I have grown immensely over the past 3 years. I have been pushed outside my comfort zone and challenged for the better. I would like to see more overall school spirt and participation among the students.', 'Some of my teachers throughout my high school career were exceptional while others were uninspired. Overall, though, my experience was positive and I feel that this school has given me a solid high school education.', 'The school is very clique-y. I found it hard to mingle between groups. Otherwise, for a public school, it was nice. The teachers were great, for the most part.', "I loved my experience at South. All of the teachers were so helpful in fostering my growth as not only a student but also as a person. The track program got me to be so well rounded. I wouldn't be anywhere today without my high school.", 'Clarkstown South High School is definitely an optimal public learning experience. It provides excellent education programs and out of school extra curriculum activities. If there was one thing I would change it would be the time when the first period begins. I understand that it is for the bus schedules so they can get the middle and elementary schools in too, but when you have some students waking up at five thirty in the morning it can lead to a lot of damge over time.', 'I like how teachers put in effort to see us succeed, and I like that they always prepare us for state tests. I do not like gym quizzes', 'I really liked going to Clarkstown South because I enjoyed going to school everyday. The atmosphere was very positive and there were many clubs and sports that you could join.']
column8: ['As a senior at South, nothing much has gone on here for the past 3 and a half years. However, this year a lot has gone on, for example, we had a large bomb scare which included emergency evacuation of the school and now we have a fellow student who has been accused of having an affair with a teacher. I think South is a great school for anyone to go an try hard because most of the teachers care a great deal about their students.', 'Clarkstown South Senior High School is an average high school experience- nothing exemplary, nothing abysmal. In recent years, however, academics have been declining, exemplified by the negative trend of 1st tier and Ivy League acceptances.', 'Clarkstown South has been a wonderful High School experience for me.  These past 4 years I have been challenged academically and developed wonderful relationships with fellow students and teachers.  I never felt unappreciated and I would not have changed a thing.', 'I love Clarkstown South, as I am a senior and still attending. Overall, I think everything about the school was really great. There are so many different opportunities, educationally and physically. The teachers and staff are all extremely helpful and kind as well. There is not anything I can say I really disliked about the school. If anything it would be the small amount I got to see my friends, but that was not a big problem. ', 'Im already busy with extracurriculars that are not run by the school, so I cannot speak to them personally. Most of the money goes to sports so some of the non athletic activities need ore funding.', "Not a very supportive place, I can't wait to go to college. Just try to make the best of it.", 'Most of them are not very approachable and for the most part the staff do not show that the care about the students. (Not all of the staff this is just the overwhelming feeling of the school).', "There doesn't seem to be a noticeable issue with health or safety.", 'There are many extracurriculars, but it seems obvious that some are provided much more support than others.', 'Although many parents get involved, it is mostly the students who run many organizations.', 'Personally, the majority of the teaching staff are very reliable and knowledgeable. They will always be available to help.', 'We have a lot of security guards watching over students, but students can easily drink or do drugs in the school without getting caught.', 'There are a variety of extracirriculars at the school which is great but not all of them are sufficiently organized or have enough funding', "I found a lot of myself in HS. I've became more confident and social", "Some teachers q re very dedciated to their students and genuinely care for them. Others don't put in the same effort as others", 'The academics are the best part about this school. I came to college fully prepared for schoolwork.', 'The social scene is accepting and outgoing. Everyone knows everyone and everyone is fairly kind. There are friend groups, but rarely any fighting goes on.', 'We have one police officer at school at all times. We also have a large security staff and security cameras. The school nurses are usually available and helpful. I felt safe in this school because it was in a great area. The location was perfect and we are one of the safest counties (or towns) in the state of New York.', 'I have had extensive experience in extracurricular activities. I was on the executive board for our schools DECA chapter, I was a varsity cheerleader for four years and captain of the team for one, I played softball and I also joined clubs like the Italian Club to celebrate my heritage, and the Assets Leadership club.  There are so many opportunities and a place for everyone when it comes to extracurriculars.  There are fun options like art clubs and bowling clubs and there are academic driven clubs like Mu Alpha Theta. One thing thats cool about this is that since everyone is so close with their friends, when one person joins a club usually everyone gets involved. There is alot of positive influence.', 'I would do this all over again because I met my best friends here. The environment was family-like. Specifically, football games under the Friday night lights. After days of school work and stress, we all came together as a unit to enjoy the game and cheer on our players.']

column2: ['Overall John F Kennedy High school provides a great learning experience with amazing programs such as the drama and music departments, of which promote a diverse and fun environment for every student. The academics and curriculum taught at this school push students to get a head start on their college education with AP courses that will inspire them to major in a plethora of subjects. The staff and security are friendly and professional, striving for not only a safe classroom environment, but to nurture successful and hardworking students into their academic futures.', 'Good academic school. Not the best kids, but a safe school that promotes intellectual growth. I had a good time senior year, but was really stressed out years prior due to enrollment in mostly advanced classes. STEM is a priority and school spirit is at a low.', 'Kennedy was better than I thought it was going to be. While I thought I’d never miss it, I really do. It was such a good school with a great class & wonderful staff / faculty', 'The education I am receiving at John F. Kennedy is at a high quality. The friendships with peers and bonds with teachers I am making are likely not to be made at any other school in my district. Besides the few kinks that every school has JFK is the place to be.', 'John F Kennedy High School takes pride in its grades and academic excellence. Its faculty is very educational and for the most part, deeply cares for its students. However, the administration could do a better job of including classes that will teach students about real-world problems, such as investing money, how to build a resume, or even about taxes. The school system as a whole prepares students for a superficial world and focuses them on niche fields of work which focus subjects such as trigonometry as a requirement. High averages are pushed and grades become a priority. Rather than a more eclectic approach of taking classes which suit the students, and teaching them what they will truly need to know in the future.', 'Jfk was not that bad, some of the teachers are very caring and they teach very well. Although there are some positives there must be the negatives. Even though this is an anti bullying school, I have seen a lot of bullying. If your kid is getting bullied or is not fitting in the school does not take any action. The staff wait a very long time and cover up your issue as if it never happened .There are spoiled kids in this school who do not have any manners and did not receive any parenting. There is not much diversity. If your child is facing any bullying you need to further investigate because JFK teachers just try to protect each other and their school’s reputation as said before. If people see that there has been bullying in this school their status will turn low, which they do not want, that is why they neglect your case.  There has been many changes to this school such as the principal changed. Something needs to be done.', 'Overall I had a great high school experience at JFK. The classes I took my junior and senior year really helped me going into college and the teachers that taught them were all amazing and extremely qualified for their jobs.', 'John F. Kennedy high school was consider to be an average school for me. I thought I learned many things and it was a safe environment to be around.', 'I felt after four years I received a wonderful education from teachers who really care about their students succeeding.', 'The sports are fun the teachers try to help if you need anything the security guards are really nice it’s a big school you can make lots of new friends and there are internships for the summer if your interested in making money', 'I think academically Kennedy is a great place however I do think the people bring the schools rating down', 'JFK has prepared me with the academic knowledge and skill set I need to go off to college. I have truly enjoyed my four years there. I was a member of the football and lacrosse teams where I learned how to be a good player, but even more importantly,  a team member. We were provided with caring, nurturing teacher who went above and beyond their duties to help us. Overall, I had a great high school experience at JFK Bellmore.', "John F. Kennedy high school has welcoming teachers and guidance counselors who are always willing to help. The courses are challenging but are worthwhile and interesting. Additionally, they help to shape students for college. There is an abundance of school spirit present within the students who are in clubs or sports. The faculty is very kind. The library is filled with many new novels, and the librarians are very helpful. The only issue is the school's new heating and cooling system which is not properly functioning, but I'm positive the hardworking custodians will fix that very soon.", 'The health and safety is very well monitored in this school.', 'The overall experience here is positive. I do wish that this school focused more on expanding interests and guiding students to choose careers and passions at an early age. This can be fixed by the incorporation of technology, immersion programs, effective and healthy habits of communication by appreciating different views on current events. I would also love for there to be useful interaction between the students and higher faculty for the most productive use of finances and potential for the student body to grow.', 'Clubs are diverse but in my opinion difficult to attract students.', 'From my experience with my daughter, many wonderful and knowledgeable teachers.', 'Lots of communication from the principal. Safety and welfare of students of utmost concern. Bullying not condoned.', "Very good academic experience for my child, who has an IEP. Her guidance counselor has been wonderful and effective, as well as her special ed coordinators and most of her teachers. Socially, it's a tough school.", 'The health and safety policies of this school are very good due to the nurses and many security guards who can prevent bullying and other threats to safety.']

Socially, it's a tough school.", 'The health and safety policies of this school are very good due to the nurses and many security guards who can prevent bullying and other threats to safety.']
column6: ['The extracurriculars in this school is good because their are many activities and they make for an offer of diversified programs so that every student can find something they love.', 'The overall experience at this school is good because of the variety of activities the school offers. The activities at this school are diversified so that the students can get educated in some programs, while having fun in other programs.', 'The teachers at this school are, generally, not terrible, but most of them do not put forth enough effort to be good examples or to do their job effectively.', 'There seems to be plenty of extra curricular activities for students to take advantage off. Support from the school staff administrators and teaches are all welcome', "All the teachers that I've been in contact with over the past four years have been of high-quality integrity and genuine caring about the students", 'I have never felt safety as an issue', 'Great school, teachers , parents and students are top notch', 'They are very helpful and willing to teach', 'lots of different options. fully satisfied with oppertunities', 'Overall experience was average. Had fun, but it was stressful.', 'Teachers are adequate. They were either very hard or too easy.', 'The school offers a very supportive faculty who is willing to work with the students to achieve the academic support they need. The work may be strenuous to the average American, but in the long run, the earn very high achievements. For example, incoming freshmen who are in an honors science class typically take a course that offers an introduction to the reality of scientific research. Students are paired up to work on research competitions like the Toshiba Exploravision Competition, hosted by Toshiba, which students design products that can be used to make life easier in the future. The group I was apart of actually received the rank of "honorable mention" for our work. If students wanted to continue their passion for science, they may take the class, Advanced Science Research, where students will actually learn about how to properly conduct research. Students then enter competitions that require extensive research that offer scholarships like Intel\'s Science Talent Search. Our alumni were finalists in the nation-wide competition.Although JFK brings a lot of academic growth to its students, the students themselves develop strong bonds and form cliques that are hard to socially reform.', "I'm an international student, it's fairly good so far, kind of hard to meet people, don't know if it's me or them...", "Overall, my son's experience has been positive.  I do NOT find the teachers as willing to help as I would have expected but I think that has to do more with union contracts than with desire.", "I really enjoy this school, it has taught me so many things. It has helped me grow into the person I am. Little by little I have been exposed to different situations that it has taught me to keep striving. Being exposed to bullying and name calling is common in every school and it can be monitored as well too. I learned to stick up and stand up for the kids that didn't stand up for themselves.", 'The research program is amazing.', 'There is a low variety of foods in the cafeteria and most of the food is of a questionable quality. The "healthy" food is mainly either salads, nasty tasting whole grain food, or frozen and processed vegetables.', 'Most people are not involved in sports but those that are tend to be very involved. There is a lack of school spirit and a low turnout at games, but the facilities and equipment is good.', 'There is no anti-bullying policy but the staff tries to discourage it. While there is no obvious bullying, there are more subtle things that happen that goes undetected by staff.', 'Most of the teachers are knowledgable in their course and work hard with their students so they will succeed. However, some teachers have less control over their classes than others, leading to unproductive classes.']

column2: ["The office ladies are literally the worst. I would rather drop out than have to go into the main office and talk to them. All they like to do is sit at their desks and talk, and if you go into the office to ask them a question, they will be incredibly rude to you. Once, I went down to the office to ask about my finals schedule. I stood there and tried to ask them, but they flat out ignored me until one of my teachers came in and backed me up. I don't understand how they get paid to do absolutely nothing.", 'I would like my school to have more school spirit. There is a hand full of students that are very disrespectful to students, teachers, and the school. On the bright side, we can go out to lunch and we are given a lot of freedom.', 'The education quality is high. The administrators and teachers put a great amount of emphasis on education.', 'Leonia High School is extremely diverse and has an excellent staff. The teachers do their best to prepare students for college and life beyond high school. LHS offers several clubs and activities for students.', "My experiences with LHS were pretty good for the most part. I've never had any personal issues with teachers or staff members or students. It's just overall things we hear and I feel like we could have so much more if our school and board of education actually used what we have towards useful supplies. And also, they need to start hiring experiences teachers, not ones that are right out of college because every year they wonder why they have to fire these new teachers after one year of teaching.", 'as a new student at this school, I was shocked to see how disrespectful the main office staff is to students. From most of the teachers to the guidance counselors, no one is ready to help you or even generously help you adjust to the new surroundings. Terrible experience.', 'This is a good school in some ways, but not others. Many of the science and math teachers are terrible, while most of the history and language arts teachers are pretty good. My experience wasn’t terrible in this school overall.', "The school and its staff is not at all and sensitive to a student's needs and have no regard for the student's feelings. No one is welcoming here and people are mean and unfriendly. The teachers don't really care about you or your performance and the resources at the school are very poor. The school's culture and environment is the worst part.", 'What I loved the most about Leonia High School is the diversity within the school. There are many different types of students from different backgrounds that bring a unique perspective to the classroom.', 'Leonia High School, like many other schools, is a place that allows students to nurture their knowledge on different subjects of interest and a safe community for students to make friends.  The school provides many diverse and challenging courses ranging from Robotics to Nutrition and Health and multiple AP classes for students. The school also holds special programs called the Academy program which is split into four specific fields: STEM, Business and Marketing, Humanities, and Culinary Arts. Through these programs, students are able to take classes geared towards their specified academy through an accelerated curriculum focusing on their interests. The student body is diverse and friendly and many teachers are willing to help students who need assistance by staying after school.', 'One of the calmest, warmest schools out there. As a student you are taken care of by teachers and staff alike with unconditional support while giving them plenty of freedom. The school intends to foster a safe environment where students can all thrive. Surrounded by all kinds of clubs ranging from DECA and JSA,  everyone finds a place to enjoy themselves and contribute to the community. Here you find the best teachers and guidance counselors. They grant the best opportunities for AP credit and honors courses. Upon graduation students are prepared for college.', 'I enjoyed the academics here. However, the food could be upgraded along with the cleanliness of the school.', 'Aside from the few exceptions, this school is filled with excellent teachers who are willing to help the students succeed. I have had many positive relationships with my teachers who have helped me grow as not only a student, but as a person as well. One complaint that I would have is that it is very strict with the rules such as the dress code policy. Additionally, the bathrooms always seem to run out of toilet paper by the end of the day which is always an issue.', 'The academics at Leonia High School were definitely above the standard in Begen County. I especially appreciated the Science Academy and the teachers involved with making the transition into such a rigorous academy easier than it sounds. Personally, the reason I highlighted only three stars had nothing to do with Leonia High School as a school, but due to my classmates and the overall atmosphere. There seemed to be too much of a disconnect between those who excel and those who could care less. In fact, it seems that, now as I gradaute, the students coming after me are more likely going to excel less than my class. Overall, though, the academics are there for those willing enough to take the challenge.', "Being at Leonia High School for four years was a pretty average experience. Our academies are pretty good. The teachers here are a hit or miss - sometimes you'll understand the material given in class, other times you'll need to teach yourself the entire lesson outside of school. The clubs are well organized, and the bake sales at the end of the day are phenomenal. There's not a lot of school spirit. We have some good sports teams, most notably, the swimming team. Parent involvement is average. The diversity at Leonia High School is okay, but there are many Asian families that live in the town, so they are definitely not a minority at the school. I would say that the school does prepare you for college. Some administrators are friendly, but some do not tolerate anything. Our food is what you would expect from a public high school, and the facilities are functioning. Overall, Leonia High School can be a fine experience, but it isn't the best in Bergen County.", "I was in the Science Academy, which was very rigorous. I liked it though because it helped me to become closer with many people and allowed me to have a guaranteed group of friends that would help me when I was struggling. One thing I didn't like was the principal. He was too strict only on girls and never on guys.", "Leonia High School has a very strong sense of community and is very diverse and accepting. Many of the students strive to achieve and will undertake as much as they can. There is also a great selection of extracurricular and academic programs. Students are even able to come up with their own independent course if the program of studies doesn't quite meet their needs. However, this school loses me when it comes to some of the teachers who work here and simply do not teach. There are a few fantastic teachers who have taught here, but there are also many who have classes full of struggling children and it is very rare that the school actually does anything about it.", 'A school that values the statistics more than the students. With no interest in what you want to pursue -- with the exception of allowing students to have independent studies at their proposal -- this school values your academic status over your passion.  We have a culinary academy and a science academy but if you are interested in anything else, tough luck! Funding is allocated for the profitable careers.', 'Leonia is filled with many opportunities to get involved. They hold various classes that allow students to become more aware and more ready for their future classes in college.', "Great school, great staff. The only thing I'd change is the food. Overall, it's a friendly community full of excellent learning experiences."]

column6: ['I am an incoming Junior here.Pros:Academics are very rigorous + wide array of interesting electives and AP courses.Great teachers who care, but the occasional "horrible" or "sub par" teachers is common.Great selection of clubs.Guidance is amazing - They help you out on most issues big or small.Cons:Administration is dictator-esque -clear bias towards some teachers -hurts both the students and the teachers themselves.Sport Events virtually unattended by students. No school spirit.Food is disgusting - most students just order out or leave campus to eatSpace can be cramped at times - Hallways mostly packed in between periodsAs an resident of Edgewater, the busing system is absolutely atrocious. Buses are always late, we have to wait up to 45 minutes after classes end to actually get on a bus.Besides these cons, LHS is a very good schools for academics and preparing you for college.', 'This high school prepares you for the academic asset of college. It challenges students to use their full potential in completing work in class and at home as well.', 'Very small high school where everyone knows everybody. Can even become friends with your teachers because they all care about you greatly and want to help you in any way possible. Very involved administration who want the school to excel.', 'Although the academics were not great, and the teachers can be very hit or miss as well as the programs there such as the Leonia Science Academy could be a disaster for some, it still provided me with a comfortable environment in which not the community is overall passionate and kind, and the extracurricular provided me with a lot of enjoyment throughout the years. Although the workload could be a lot, and a lot of stress may occur, the people and the activities there make it worth it.', 'Amazing teachers, coupled with a rigorous cirriculum, and a wide varoety of college classes, and honors courses, provides for a life preparing high school experience.', "Leonia High School is a very small school housing students mainly from Edgewater, NJ and Leonia, NJ. Positive:-AP classes available-Many sports and clubs-As juniors and seniors, students have the opportunity to enroll in a J.I.I.P or S.I.I.P which is an internship/externship program that allows students to create a class or continue their studies in something that they are passionate about. - Science Academy, Culinary Academy, or Business Academy.-There is a rotating block schedule which means that students do not have the same classes every day and not at the same time. Negatives:-The school itself is very small and due for some renovating. -The bus system for Edgewater students is still very circuitous and messy.-Although there are sports teams and Leonia apparel, there is absolutely no school spirit. No pep rallies, cheerleaders, students don't really attend games to support their team.", 'It is a very high level school. The teachers and Counselors are extremely responsible and respectable. They are professional and majority of the kids get into very good colleges.', 'A great school with very diverse student body, challenging curriculum and many extracurricular activities.', "In this high school, it's a school that is very diverse, and yet very small, everyone knows everyone, I clicked with the other students there, I was the new student and the student welcomed me with open arms. It's place that you don't need to close yourself off and be shy, there is this warmth presence that you'll feel when you walk in, in the mornings. Teachers are with you every step of the way, if you stumble they will give you a helping hand and pull you up to speed. They always want their students to be the best, making learning virtually simple, disguising it as something else. They push their student ahead, ultimately making high school a highlight in life. ", "Most of the teachers are well prepared and teach very well. They cooperate with the students to make sure they have the time to help them understand the topic if they didn't understand it in class. A majority of the teachers also understand that the students take other classes therefore they do their best to not give the students a workload.", 'Their is definitely a lot of diversity in the school, however a majority of it is asians.', 'Their is a vast amount of extracurricular activities for students to join. They can join sports from soccer, basketball, volleyball, track, golf, bowling, tennis etc. Their is also a lot of clubs in the school and if a student desires to create a club they are allowed to. They however have to be devoted to it.', 'My time spent at this school has been nothing but the best. It shaped me into the person I am today. Without my teachers and friends that I met I would not have been able to make it this far. They, along with my family did their best to push me to become the best version of myself that I could be so I could succeed and I am truly thankful for that.', "A majority of the teachers at this school are very great. they help the students and care if they understand the topics or not and do their best to make sure they understand. However there is also like in every school a few teachers that don't really help you and where you have to study on yourself and learn the topics on your own.", "Many different academic subjects are given by the Leonia high school. There is a diversity of academic subjects. Scheduling process can be somewhat easily done with the counselors' help. Extra help are open most of times.", 'Leona high school is a very accepting school to everyone. There is no discrimination or racism towards anyone.', 'As the principal of Leonia high school says, "Respect to get respect" everyday morning through announcements, bullying policy is the most important matter to the school, teachers and students. Also, the security policy is also important. Every visitor has to sign-in. The school practices lots of time for safety such as lock down and fire drill. I\'ve never felt that I am not safe in this school.', 'There are many clubs and organizations in Leonia high school that anyone can join including choir, jazz band, chorus, orchestra, musical, play, and etc.. The most popular club or organization is the "Limelighters" which is the drama play staff organization. They enjoy and prepare everything for plays after school.', "What I liked the most about Leonia high school was that there isn't any discrimination or racist. When I was attending another school as my first time in the US, I was very disappointed with the discrimination by the teachers along with the students. Unlike the people at the school which gave me a bad memory that still stays in my mind, the teachers and students at Leonia high school respect each other and never discriminate somebody. If I had to go to school again, I would definitely attend Leonia high school.", "Most of the teachers at Leonia high school are very friendly, kind and respectful. They always respect their students, listen to their stories and ideas. They help the students who are struggling with the teacher's subject and when even it is not their subject. Also, they move around in classrooms to ask each student if they have any questions or any concerns. When they give the students quizzes or tests, they always give the students review sheets before the test day and go over everything with the students. They are eager to help students with extra help and they even come to school earlier than they do usually to help students in morning. Every teacher has their own rubric of grading system and keep their consistency in grading. Of course, not every teacher in the school are great because everyone has different characters but most of them were very kind, respectful and sweet."]

There is no discrimination or racism towards anyone.', 'As the principal of Leonia high school says, "Respect to get respect" everyday morning through announcements, bullying policy is the most important matter to the school, teachers and students. Also, the security policy is also important. Every visitor has to sign-in. The school practices lots of time for safety such as lock down and fire drill. I\'ve never felt that I am not safe in this school.', 'There are many clubs and organizations in Leonia high school that anyone can join including choir, jazz band, chorus, orchestra, musical, play, and etc.. The most popular club or organization is the "Limelighters" which is the drama play staff organization. They enjoy and prepare everything for plays after school.', "What I liked the most about Leonia high school was that there isn't any discrimination or racist. When I was attending another school as my first time in the US, I was very disappointed with the discrimination by the teachers along with the students. Unlike the people at the school which gave me a bad memory that still stays in my mind, the teachers and students at Leonia high school respect each other and never discriminate somebody. If I had to go to school again, I would definitely attend Leonia high school.", "Most of the teachers at Leonia high school are very friendly, kind and respectful. They always respect their students, listen to their stories and ideas. They help the students who are struggling with the teacher's subject and when even it is not their subject. Also, they move around in classrooms to ask each student if they have any questions or any concerns. When they give the students quizzes or tests, they always give the students review sheets before the test day and go over everything with the students. They are eager to help students with extra help and they even come to school earlier than they do usually to help students in morning. Every teacher has their own rubric of grading system and keep their consistency in grading. Of course, not every teacher in the school are great because everyone has different characters but most of them were very kind, respectful and sweet."]

column2: ['The togetherness of this school is amazing. Since it is a small population school, everyone essentially knows each other. When passing by in the hallways, people of both student and faculty are greeted constantly. When at lunch, students are mingling, enjoying their time together.', 'They undeniably hold up to academic standards, offering their students the best and ensuring that they are prepared for college. This is currently the second best high school in the city and cannot be shunned for having up to date technology and resources for students. Moreover the school possess a diverse student body and acknowledged such through multiple assemblies on an annual basis. The school is EXTREMELY involved in the community and offered a lot of volunteering opportunities for all students. Now i must say, the food that is fed to the students is really bad. moreover, they have a very limited spectrum of school clubs, partially because of the small student body. Additionally, because the school is fairly recent, they have no sport and students have to travel to their home public high schools in order to play sports.', 'I am a sophomore at Infinity Institute which is a high-school/middle-school. It is overall a very academic school with very smart and friendly peers surrounding you. We grow off of one another, helping each other in the process of doing so. What I would like to see in the future is the expansion of sports and after-school programs.', "Every class is an Honors class, so it was always challenging and engaging. Infinity Institute is on par with McNair High School, the only thing is that it's pretty new still. The teachers are friendly and care about us, and the school is pretty small so we know each other more and every student is taken care of individually by the teachers.", 'The school has some great teachers while some others completely miss the mark. However the teachers dedicated to education truly make a difference in the lives of their students.', 'The last three years of my high school life have been very experimental and it gave me an opportunity to experience another way of life through many different types of people and various working environments.', 'Best school ever! I rate this a 5-star because: One, Infinity Institute gave me a big opportunity to get into the best Ivy-league colleges after my senior year. Two, there might be a 98% chance I might enter in either a High Honors, Honors, or an AP class.Three, since me and three of my besties are going to the same school next year, there is ALSO an opportunity we might enter to Harvard, Columbia, Yale, or Princeton University! Together!All I could say is that this school is one of the top best schools in Jersey City AND New Jersey! :)', 'The administration treats you like a middle schooler, which Infinity does have. The math department is excellent however this school does provide any types of opportunities and preparation for college', 'I wish that there would be more involvement with all of the students, in each and every grade, and less focus on certain grade levels. I also would like to see more programs that interest the majority of the students, rather than small portions.', "Can't say that it's a breeze to get buy, but most teachers will present tests and quizzes without teaching the prior information presented on said tests and quizzes", 'The food here is practically disgusting, I have a picture of a mouse caught in a glue trap right beside my locker. The health teacher cut out all good and necessary foods of the school. This cut fundraising for things like bake sales and candy shops. This also cut the side shop in the cafeteria where people could buy food other than the rubbish that was served. The nurse does a well job at taking care of their students. Students do not even bother to eat at school, because the lunch is disgusting and there are no other options to choose from', 'Only few select clubs are good, and the ones that are good do not last long. We had drone club for a good month, but it was cut due to lack of funding for the teachers participating in it', 'The school is very small, even when it is a highschool mixed in with a middle school. The staff are very strict, with harsh consequences being implemented for nearly every minor infraction. For instance, if a student forgets to wear their student ID, they will be struck with a Saturday detention, also for wearing a sweater that is colored other than black or white. This restricts students harshly, and there is not much that this school gives back for their students. All fundraisers done do not go towards the students. We were promised sports equipment 3 years ago, but that never happened and we are the only high school in Jersey City without a sports team.', 'A few cherry picked teachers, mostly the math department, are the ones that genuinely care about their students and what they learn. All teachers one way or another incorporate technology into class with smartboards, laptops, and websites that assist the teacher with teaching the class. The physical education department is not great at all, because students do not learn much when the teacher is absent for half of all classes, or when an excuse is maid so students will not be able to play in the gym, which is unfortunately also our auditorium', 'The academics is generally very great and manageable. Students here tend to learn more than the average student. A lot of emphasis is placed on knowing the subject matter, as all classes are either honors courses or treated as such. The curriculum follows that of the state and district and covers most of everything required. The workload receives mixed reviews. Many feel that the workload is much too great, with it requiring a lot of dedicated time. I, speaking only for myself, rarely ever have an issue where the workload seems overbearing, but that can be attributed to a different work ethic. Unfortunately, with the school being as small as it is, the number of available classes is limited, so most students end up taking the same classes, due to a limited number of electives, although there still is a rather diverse course path for many students.', "The school is very safe. Upon entering the school, one must go through a security check involving metal detectors and a non-invasive possessions check by security guards (they only require looking into a student's backpack and do not go through all of the student's personal belongings). The school is small and only requires a very small security staff, however the staff is very prominent. All security guards are also unarmed. All visitors must sign in upon entering and leaving. Security cameras are present in all hallways and stairwells, with few located on the building's exterior, but absent from classrooms. Staff and students require ID, however this rule is very lax as the small number of students makes everybody recognizable without an ID. All exits can be locked internally and all but the main entrance usually are. Fire alarms are present throughout the building, as well as a PA system. There are also anonymous bullying report forms present throughout the building, should they need to be used. As per physical safety, the school leaves very little room, if any, for error.", "The school lacks most extracurricular activities. Sports are only available to the middle school, as of this moment. All high school athletics must be done at a student's home school (the school closest to their address that does not have a restrictive acceptance standard). The clubs that are available are limited. The YMCA hosts daily after school activities and anybody may sign up. Clubs that are available are the creative writing club, where students may write for the school magazine, chess club, where students may play chess or learn, French club and Honors Society, for students interested in activities related to the French language and culture, National Honors Society, for the high achieving students (there's no shortage of members), after school band rehearsals, and the many after school labs, such as algebra and biology among others, where students may receive homework help or simply review with a teacher and other students without the limitations of the normal classroom environment. The school could definitely use more activities, but those are uncertain to come without additional funding and approval from the district.", "The great thing about this school is that it's fairly new and fairly small. While this does have its downsides, such as a lack of established programs and funding, it also works in students' favor. The small community of under 300 students, both middle school and high school kids, make's the community very tight-knit, where almost everybody knows each other. Since the school is fairly young, we don't have many established activities, such as athletic activities for the high school or a large number of clubs and classes, AP or otherwise, but this means that the students can actively shape the future of the school and evolve alongside it. The students are, for the most part, very intelligent and friendly, meaning the environment is very welcoming and the academics can move a great pace. The reason I would go this school again is because without it I wouldn't be the person I am today. Infinity did me a great service by putting me in an environment where my appreciation for learning was rekindled, after burning out in the years prior due to an underwhelming and somewhat superficial experience in the previous grades. The supportive and thoughtful staff, who have done a great job at making the atmosphere feel inclusive, and the wonderful students, many of whom I am glad to call friends, made the experience worthwhile. If I had the opportunity to go back in time and redo my high school years at Infinity, I definitely would. It would give me the opportunity to capitalize on all of the things I never took advantage of, and hopefully, make my experience, and myself, better than it already is.", "Most teachers at the school are great teachers. They are able to teach the subject matter effectively and give many lessons. There are the few times where teachers are forced to give work that may not be entirely related to the subject and may seem to be 'busy work' but that is a rule (an unpopular one) set by the administration. Teachers are also very knowledgeable in the subjects they teach, providing additional information if anything, rather than the bare minimum to get by. Most teachers are also available to help students after school hours, which is a great help to those willing to make sure they understand the subject matter in a less restricted environment. Overall, the teachers at this school know what they are doing and will only ever get sidetracked due to mandatory administrative policies."]

['Nyack high school was a great school for me. The music and arts classes let me explore what I’m very interested in, and going there led to my attendance at Berklee College of Music.', "Nyack high school is a great high school, this is coming from someone who has been to 3 high schools and I can tell you this is my favorite one yet. I feel safe, and welcomed in this space and because of the diversity of the school I feel included. I would definitely recommend this school to anyone looking. I have been able to pursue many classes I'm interested in and they've helped me to prepare for college.", 'Very good experience if you get the right teachers and take higher level classes. There is much more focus on higher level classes and the better teachers are usually assigned there.', 'Nyack High School gave me a great four years, offering clubs and activities for everyone, a rich learning experience with excellent hard-working teachers, and a diverse group of people.', "ATTENDING NYACK HIGH SCHOOL WAS A LOVE AND HATE RELATIONSHIP. I LOVED ALL THE FUN MEMORIES I MADE WITH FRIENDS I WILL ALWAYS REMEMBER. THERE WERE GREAT TEACHERS AND THEN THERE WERE TERRIBLE TEACHERS, IN WHICH SOMETIMES YOU FEEL LIKE YOU DON'T HAVE A VOICE. ONE THING I CAN SAY IS I LEARNED AN VERY IMPORTANT LESSON. NOT EVERY ACTION NEEDS A REACTION. HAVING A DIFFERENCE IN OPINION WITH A TEACHER LED ME TO CURSE HER OUT AND FOR THAT I WAS SUSPENDED FOR A SEMESTER. WHICH ULTIMATELY HELD ME BACK FROM GRADUATING. A FEW YEARS AGO I WOULD HAVE SAID THAT WAS MY BIGGEST MISTAKE BUT IT WASN'T. I DROPPED OUT OF HIGH SCHOOL AND RECEIVED MY GED. I WAS LUCKY ENOUGH TO ENTER IN A PROGRAM WHERE I WAS ABLE TO TAKE A MEDICAL ASSISTING CLASS FOR FREE AND GET MY DIPLOMA AND CERTIFICATE AT THE SAME TIME. I AM SO THANKFUL BECAUSE I HAD NO PLAN ON CONTINUING MY EDUCATION. SOMETIMES GOING THROUGH THE BAD YOU WILL FIND THE THE GOOD. I'VE HAD A CRAZY FEW YEARS BUT I HONESTLY WOULDN'T CHANGE A SECOND OF IT.", 'Nyack Senior High School is a place where the students can learn and grow in a community where we can be ourselves. We have a diverse population of students coming from various backgrounds. I feel that free expression is an important aspect of development. At Nyack Senior High School everyone seems to fit in. It is most notable during football games or big events when we are all together. You would see students of a multitude of race, gender, religious background all sitting together smiling and enjoying themselves. At Nyack Senior High School we celebrate and embrace each other for our similarities and our differences......', "Nyack Highschool is probably one of the most diverse schools out there. This is in terms of wealth and ethnicity/background. There are some fantastic teachers there but of course, there's also many that aren't so fantastic.", "Outside of class, most teachers are always available to answer questions about school work, career choices and current events. If you're ever feeling stressed about anything there is always someone who will listen and act on your concerns. Teachers are receptive to how students want to be taught and most take care in organizing their lessons in an understandable manner. Guidance is good. If you need the help you have to seek it out.In my experience, the relationships within the sports teams are tight. Everyone comes from different backgrounds and has varying levels of experience. The coaches are highly invested in their athletes no matter the skill level.Diversity is good. It was good to see everyone from different cultures sharing their experiences both in the classroom and out.Food choices can be better. School faculty diversity can also be improved.", "Nyack High does an amazing job of offering students lots of opportunities to take the classes that interest them. They offer a wide range of APs, are offering more dual enrollment (with colleges) classes, as well as Project Lead the Way. But most of all, I have been impressed with the teachers - not only high quality, but caring and really dedicated to working with students as long as it takes. Most stay after school for tutoring regularly. And the class sizes are small. We are fortunate that our school is able to serve the needs of such a diverse community. This school district has been great since kindergarten and only getting better each year! The stats of next year's graduating class (2019) are incredible!", "Nyack high school is a great school, and so far I don't anything to change about it. In Nyack high school the teachers are caring, patient, and lovely. one of the most important thing in Nyack high school we don't support bullies and racism.", 'Nyack High School is a diverse school. They encourage students to challenge themselves and create a healthy environment for learning. Most of the teachers are good at their jobs, although some aren’t. They offer many AP courses for students interested and they have a large selection of electives to choose from. Many students participate in athletics and they have a large array to choose from. They have clubs for almost anything you could want. There are many opportunities for students to participate in school events. Overall, Nyack High School is a great school and I wouldn’t have wanted to go anywhere else.', 'alright teachers, athletics were nice, education was averagealright teachers, athletics were nice, education was averagealright teachers, athletics were nice, education was averagealright teachers, athletics were nice, education was averagealright teachers, athletics were nice, education was averagealright teachers, athletics were nice, education was averagealright teachers, athletics were nice, education was averagealright teachers, athletics were nice, education was averagealright teachers, athletics were nice, education was averagealright teachers, athletics were nice, education was averagealright teachers, athletics were nice, education was averagealright teachers, athletics were nice, education was averagealright teachers, athletics were nice, education was averagealright teachers, athletics were nice, education was averagealright teachers, athletics were nice, education was averagealright teachers, athletics were nice, education was average', 'The teachers are very approachable for help when you need it. Classroom culture is outstanding and very welcoming.', 'It’s a great learning environment with all the upcoming changes on the campus will allow students to start their college journey a lot easier only thing is sometimes with the college process you can feel like your doing it all alone because they have a lot of other students they are working with and can’t always make time for you', 'My experience at Nyack High School has been a roller coaster ride, but indeed I have learned a lot through my friends and my teachers. We are a very diverse school, and in turn this has shown me different points of view of my peers and of the faculty that we have at NHS.', 'I liked that Nyack High School was a diverse community that brought students together with different backgrounds. The school also has an outstanding music and art department along with above average athletics.', "I had a really good time at Nyack. Made a lot of great friends and memories, and helped with a lot of SAT/ACT preparation. I feel like it would've been cool to have students who had gone off to college come back and talk about the programs that they were involved in, I feel like that would've been good information for a high school student to know about college.", 'I love the Campus. They could use some additional parking. all sports fields now have brand new turf.', 'Nyack is a well-rounded school with plenty of opportunities to succeed academically for those who want to. The school has a strong music program, plenty of AP/Honors classes to choose from, a long list of extracurriculars, and teachers that want to see you do well.', 'Nyack was a really good school. There were some teachers that were simply there to relive high school, however other teachers were genuinely good and nice teachers. The students can be wild but most of them are there to learn and see their friends. The sports are average, as well are the clubs. The only thing that kind of sucked was that everyone had lunch at the same time. It was too hectic.']

column6: ['What was nice about Nyack High School was the diversity and facility members involved within the school. The people of this school was made it feel like home. Overall the school was a great place to be at. However, wish there was more funding done for there to be more programs within the school. Along with this wish they made you ready for college a little more with the difficulty level of some courses.', "Nyack High School is a great place for free expression and individuality but some departments staff could use some upgrading. Teachers gossip like a fellow classmate would providing for a immature and non-professional environment. Although the staff isn't necessarily the most mature, there are a few stellar teachers among the bunch such as Mrs. Kleinman, Mr. Allen, and Mrs. Derrick.", "i loved the amount of diversity and acceptance in the school .One thing that i didn't love was the readiness for the outside world. I left high school not knowing hoe to do taxes, or what a 401k is, how to build credit, live on my own etc. i think this is a big issue wth school systems in general that we aren't being taught the necessities for life, only hoe to get a good grade on a test for something we won't need in the real world.", 'Nyack High School has competitive academics. They offer a lot of AP classes and their music and drama program has done really well. With all the new additions, the facilities and grounds are looking even better.', 'I attended here during my senior year of high school. Even though I only attended for one year I enjoyed my time there and feel like I learned a lot. The teachers there were very attentive and supportive which allowed me to learn a number of real life skills and get through the process of applying to college.', "It's a fantastic school! The school has many opportunities for students to excel. It is well rounded in academics, music/theatre, and sports! The teachers are great and always there to help with student needs!", "teachers are great, atmosphere is very suitable, staff is there for you to succeed. students here aren't like the stereotypical kind in movies, tv shows, ect.. everyone is overall friendly and kind. security guards are very friendly and do their duty to protect us and our staff.", 'Nyack High School has provided me with a wonderful education and has undoubtedly improved em as a person. Many of the teachers genuinely care about providing students with a wholesome education and make class both informative and enjoyable. A wide variety of courses are available, and almost any type of student would be able to meet their intellectual desires here. Nyack also has a strong sense of school community and I have made many close friends in my four years here.', 'Professors were engaged in students involvement in their classrooms. Faculty members were helpful towards students, including counselors, who checked up on students to see how well they were doing. There are many activities  to get involve in, such as clubs, sports, community service, and more.', 'Nyack was a culturally diverse, accepting, and artistic community.  As someone who loved art, it was a great public school for me to go to.  Teachers were sort of hit or miss, but the ones I had that I liked remain as some of the most important people in my life.', 'We are the 1st school in our county to get a turf baseball field.', 'Generally the grading systems of the teachers are regulated and fair, but there are a few teachers that use rubrics with horrendous conversions that make it so you can only do really well or really poorly.', 'What makes Nyack unique is its diversity. Being surrounded by  different races and economic statuses brings a perspective to students that will help them make decisions as a grown up', 'Most of the teachers at Nyack High School go out of their way to engage with students for a better learning experience. They really take an interest in students grades and help them achieve their goals', 'There is a wide variety of academics offered at this school. You have many options such as Child Development or Creative Writing. The workload is easy if you get it done.', "NHS is a very accepting place. I have not seen discrimination towards any ethnicity and sexual orientation. However our school isn't always perfect and there's always a bully out there, but what school doesn't have a least one bully?", 'There are many extracurricular opportunities. There are many clubs such as the Queer-Straight Alliance, Youth Against Cancer. All of the clubs are very fun and you get very involved. You do fundraisers, which is pretty fun. There are also many sports to get into. NHS has a wide variety of choices.', "There are many teachers that know what they're doing. However there are some teachers that don't really care for their students.", 'There is an extensive bullying policy that we must follow. Personal safety is important at NHS and there are a lot of security guards roaming around the halls and also outside to make sure students are being safe. The school nurse are always ready to take care of sick students and treat them with quality care. Nyack High School is a very liberal/accepting place. We are a safe school.', 'I feel very safe at my school. ID cards are required to go to the bathroom. The nurse is very helpful. There are always faculty members around when needed.']

The teachers there were very attentive and supportive which allowed me to learn a number of real life skills and get through the process of applying to college.', "It's a fantastic school! The school has many opportunities for students to excel. It is well rounded in academics, music/theatre, and sports! The teachers are great and always there to help with student needs!", "teachers are great, atmosphere is very suitable, staff is there for you to succeed. students here aren't like the stereotypical kind in movies, tv shows, ect.. everyone is overall friendly and kind. security guards are very friendly and do their duty to protect us and our staff.", 'Nyack High School has provided me with a wonderful education and has undoubtedly improved em as a person. Many of the teachers genuinely care about providing students with a wholesome education and make class both informative and enjoyable. A wide variety of courses are available, and almost any type of student would be able to meet their intellectual desires here. Nyack also has a strong sense of school community and I have made many close friends in my four years here.', 'Professors were engaged in students involvement in their classrooms. Faculty members were helpful towards students, including counselors, who checked up on students to see how well they were doing. There are many activities  to get involve in, such as clubs, sports, community service, and more.', 'Nyack was a culturally diverse, accepting, and artistic community.  As someone who loved art, it was a great public school for me to go to.  Teachers were sort of hit or miss, but the ones I had that I liked remain as some of the most important people in my life.', 'We are the 1st school in our county to get a turf baseball field.', 'Generally the grading systems of the teachers are regulated and fair, but there are a few teachers that use rubrics with horrendous conversions that make it so you can only do really well or really poorly.', 'What makes Nyack unique is its diversity. Being surrounded by  different races and economic statuses brings a perspective to students that will help them make decisions as a grown up', 'Most of the teachers at Nyack High School go out of their way to engage with students for a better learning experience. They really take an interest in students grades and help them achieve their goals', 'There is a wide variety of academics offered at this school. You have many options such as Child Development or Creative Writing. The workload is easy if you get it done.', "NHS is a very accepting place. I have not seen discrimination towards any ethnicity and sexual orientation. However our school isn't always perfect and there's always a bully out there, but what school doesn't have a least one bully?", 'There are many extracurricular opportunities. There are many clubs such as the Queer-Straight Alliance, Youth Against Cancer. All of the clubs are very fun and you get very involved. You do fundraisers, which is pretty fun. There are also many sports to get into. NHS has a wide variety of choices.', "There are many teachers that know what they're doing. However there are some teachers that don't really care for their students.", 'There is an extensive bullying policy that we must follow. Personal safety is important at NHS and there are a lot of security guards roaming around the halls and also outside to make sure students are being safe. The school nurse are always ready to take care of sick students and treat them with quality care. Nyack High School is a very liberal/accepting place. We are a safe school.', 'I feel very safe at my school. ID cards are required to go to the bathroom. The nurse is very helpful. There are always faculty members around when needed.']
